Netgear has terrible customer service...when calling plan to be on hold for a least half hour each call for a live rep and expect a third world rep who has scripted answers.  Via online customer service submission.  I would get a do not reply email regarding my inquiry/concerns and to contact netgear but no direct/or any phone number to call back.  By the way...after 4 hours of attempted calls and speaking to various cust reps, I never received an answer to my concern.Unlike Apple who only contracts rep/cust serv within the U.S. and have local facilities.  Had I know my trouble with customer service, I would have went with the Apple router.The guest wireless feature does not work on all devices.Need to disable SIP/ALG in order for router to work with VOIP adapter.I would not recommend the product simply because of Netgear's poor customer service.

current modem is connected through ubs, however, the netgear router requires an ethernet connection. despite reconfiguring the modem and network setup, still no wireless internet available............

column9: Too late for Net Gear refund.
column10: I was satisfied with it, however, our telephone company came out and installed a wireless box, so I no longer need the Neat Gear, but you say too late for a return. SO No I'm not a happy camper.

column9: Average product - Below average customer service
column10: Overall, this is an average product. The main advantage (if you need it) is that is a simultaneous dual band router with the possibility of supporting guest network as well. Another functionality is the gigabyte router functionality and USB storage port (again, if you needed them).It is average in that regardless of band, the throughput and range is comparable to other cheaper products such as LinkSys 160N. In my experience the main disadvantage is throughput. When testing throughput between my laptop (with N adaptor and capable on operating in either band) and my desktop through the router, I get around 30Kbps. This is not acceptable for a N router where you should get effective throughput in excess of 100Kbps. This is further a concern when another router (around $100 cheaper) operates at around 60Kbps, i.e., twice as fast. As a background, I used a utility by lxChariot and the laptop was around 10 from the router with no obstacles.The reason I further reduced my evaluation from average (3 stars) is customer service. Specifically, each time I called, I was transferred twice. For some reason, the customer service number connects you to a customer service staff with very limited technical experience who then transfer you to another team. After explaining the problem and trying a few `standard' suggestions such as upgrading or flushing the firmware, I have been transferred to another level of support. At one time, after waiting for more 10-15 minutes, I was referred back to the person who referred me because the `higher' level support did not answer. While the staff was very polite in their interaction, a couple of incidences I find unacceptable, namely:1- The service rep. was trying to convince me that the throughput is the negotiated speed (in this case 300Kbps) which Windows reports for the network connection. I can only see to explanations, either the customer rep. is technically incompetent or he is deceptive.2- Another service rep. indicated that NetGear only consider Internet throughput. Again, this is utterly unacceptable as current speeds afforded by N or even G routers will exceed home Internet connections. I have repeatedly emphasized that a router is not just for connecting to the Internet but also for home networking (connecting computers)In summary, for average use that requires multiple networks (on different band), a gigabyte router, and/or network storage this router is for you (at a price). Otherwise, if you are interested in higher throughput, you are better off looking elsewhere. On a side note, I find using a utility to measure throughput instrumental to compare and evaluate router.

I got this router hoping to future-proof my home with a high-end product. BIG MISTAKE. The router doesn't connect to the internet. I'm fairly tech savvy but after hours of trouble shooting I'm ready to give up. Message boards are filled with people having similar problems. The solutions offered are not easy to follow and require a high networking skill level. I don't like products that require me to function as an IT department just to get them working. FYI to the rude tech support people... if I have to contact you to get your product to work, that is a failure of your product NOT the customer.

column9: Junk with constant disconnects on my WNDR3400 and WNDR3700
column10: Piece of junk.  Went through 3 with same results.  Constant disconnects.  WNDR3400 before this also disconnected constantly.  I have had my fill of junk.  Going to another brand.

This thing is supposed to be able to work as a repeater. It works ok on the download side, but the upload portion is non-existent. Can not find anywhere in the included help files and evidently there are no humans who work netgear support.Sorry I wasted my money. This thing sucks.

I bought this router and couldn't get it to work myself. Finally called a technician today. He came out and diagnosed the problem--the router is no good. I'm two days late, so now I can't return it. First time I'm not satisfied with Amazon.

column9: extremly hard to hook up we went through alot of problems called customer service on this product and on hold for a long time
column10: would never buy this again not worth the money signal is not clear or good like I thought its better to buy cheaper products sometimes

column9: I really wanted to like this router
column10: I thought this router had it all: dual band wifi, guest networks, gigabit ethernet, and a consumer-friendly price tag.  I've also heard good things about the Netgear brand.  However, after spending a couple hours configuring this router, all of my wifi devices connecting on the 2.4Ghz band would randomly lose their internet connection.  Devices on the 5Ghz band and devices connected directly to the router could still browse the internet, so it wasn't an issue with my cable modem.  I could still connect to local network resources (shared folders) on the 2.4Ghz band, so it wasn't an issue with wifi interference.  Maybe it was a DHCP issue?  Nope, performing a release and renew, and waiting 24 hours for the leases to expire, did not resolve the issue.  This issue had me puzzled.I attempted to contact support, but they were equally puzzled. After being told to completely wipe out my settings and start over a few different times, I decided that the time I could spend re-keying all of the settings would be better spent packing up this router to return it.  The model I had was WNDR3700 v4, which is the supposed version that corrected some of the issues in v1-3.  But, apparently, this version has its own issues.Yes, I did update the stock firmware to the latest version and, yes, I know what I'm doing (I've installed and securely configured many routers for family and friends without an issue).  How does a product like this get released to the market, by a name brand such as Netgear?  To give them the benefit of the doubt, it is possible that I just had a defective model, but after looking at the other 1-star reviews here and the issues on Netgear's own forums, I decided not to take another gamble with a replacement.  I'm sure Netgear does have some quality products, but the router I received was not one of them.

I have had to call tech support several times and it still only works intermittently.  They blame the ISP and the ISP keeps sending me back to them.  I thought this was top of the line but it shouldn't be this hard to set up a router.  Sending it back for a refund.

column9: Early failure due to design flaws
column10: Wireless Radio failed after 18 months.It was a common problem with early versions.Netgear knew about the failures and changed the design of the router which is good.But the knew that they had shipped a faulty product and did nothing.to help out those with the bad versions.

Bought the first one, spent considerable time with phone support, finally exchanged for a new one after about 2 weeks. Worked well for 8 months, then lost all range. 15 feet from router there is almost no signal. Called support, told that there is a one year warranty, but no phone support or live chat support for anything past 90 days. I asked how I could determine if it was bad without support, and they said they could do limited support, but 2 year support would be $190. They then asked if the power light was on, which it was. Then they pinged it and it replied. Then they asked if I could log on to the router which I could. They then told me that it was not a router problem and I would need to purchase the support. 2 routers in 8 months is not acceptable to me. I will not be looking at netgear products in the future.

Very frustrated with this purchase and going to return it. Router repeatedly drops connections on 5GHz. I'm not even playing games, but just youtube! Router WebUI page also hangs (I assume probably a chrome issue), but while loading in IE it works although takes lot of time. Mine is WNDR3700v4 and I updated firmware too. I did IP reservations for the TV & iPAD and still no luck..Netgear was my first choice over ASUS after reading reviews but looks like it isn't worth...

column9: lots of hype, very poor delivery
column10: drops netflix constantly at full signal, drops wifi defices frequently, no qos for video, no ability for reserved ip, all option that might improve its performance do not exist.  wifi range is far short of what is advertised.  bad bad device for anything other than slow pc internet.

I purchased this router brand new less than 6 months ago from the yellow & blue brick & mortar store. Since I have always had issues with cheaper and/or refurbished networking equipment, I decided to spend a good amount of money (just under a hundred dollars US) on a "good" modern router.  One with simultaneous dual-band, GigE, guest SSID, etc. and despite my past negative experiences with Netgear products, I decided to give this one a go.  And for the first several months, I was thrilled.But THEN:Out of the blue, one day the router just decided to reboot itself every hour or so.  Then every 45 minutes. Now it barely works for 15-20 minutes before rebooting.  Once it comes back up, everything works well until the next reboot.  But it really sucks when you're watching a movie on Netflix and have to keep taking 5 minute breaks as the connection drops out and re-establishes.I then tried dropping the stock firmware and slapping DD-WRT firmware on the router, but the build for my router (WNDR3700v3) has a bug in the wireless portion which caused the Wi-Fi to be completely unusable.  Spent a day or so getting the stock firmware loaded back on; the wireless returned but unfortunately so did the reboots.Apparently Netgear is only honoring 90 days out of the 12 month warranty stated on the box; I am not too optimistic about my chances of getting this problem resolved satisfactorily.  Probably gonna consider this hundred bucks to be a hard earned lesson...Netgear...NEVER AGAIN!!!

We bought netgear after having Linksys for years, we should have stuck with Linksys! We bought netgear when we got a new laptop a couple of weeks ago and having a lot of trouble connecting to it. We were told our wifi was old and probably needed to update, which was true enough but wish we had just updated to the same kind. We have had this since March 8th and even took back the new laptop because we thought there was something wrong with it, bought this with the laptop and still can't get on the internet with the new laptop half the time! It sometimes will connect for a few minutes or even a few hours then no connection at all! Right now there is none. I called netgear and the first guy kept asking what kind of virus protection I was using and telling me I just needed to get a better one, didn't try to help with the problem at all. The second guy got on my computer and said there was a lot of stuff that needed taken off that had the little yellow exclamation points and red warnings saying they sometimes come on your computer with some of the things they put on it. I barely have used the computer so if they are on there they must have come with what little stuff they put on computers these days. Of course he couldn't take them off because he said it was a software problem, well actually he could but it would cost me $250. That would also get me a new computer protection but even so it's a lot to pay to take something off of a computer that is a couple of weeks old and barely used. So he was no help either. Linksys had a lot better support! I'm thinking of taking this back and going back to them!

column9: Net gear doesn't stand behind their product.
column10: Only lasted about 120 days before it quite working. I call the tech support and all they wanted to do is sell me an extend warranty. They were no help at all. I was so mad when I finished talking to them I through the product away and bought other router but NOT from net gear.

column9: Major drop in signal for 2.4Ghz band after a year
column10: It seems to be a confirmed case and many people are experiencing it. After a year, my WNDR3700 is useless. A laptop about 4 feet from the router for no interference, 5Ghz band with full signal strength. 2.4Ghz band got only one bar. This is ridiculous, I will not buy NetGear again and will not recommend this router. Not a reliable router.

I upgraded from an old Netgear N300 router to this new Netgear WNDR3700v4 N600 router and I am not pleased so far.Set up was really easy, since I have some experience setting up network (Modem and Router) before. Worked perfectly for the first day. Onto the 2nd day, I'm on my computer, surfing the internet and out of no where I didn't have any connection. Looked at the router and noticed that it restarted by itself. I only have my computer, PS3 and phone connected to the WiFi. I tried to restart it by unplugging the router and the modem and waited around 1 min before plugging both back in. Waited for the router to start, and it restarted again. Checked all connections and everything fits perfectly, no loose connection. Mind you that I have updated the router as soon as I got it up and running when I got it (Firmware v1.0.1.42). I kept doing the unplugging for the next 30 mins and it finally started, but my WiFi was not turning on, only the Ethernet, after waiting 10 mins. So I had to unplug again and it started. Fast forward a few days later (Today 10/07/2013) It restarted again out of no where with the same device connected. I'm getting really tired of this.Never had any issue with the N300 but this router is a pain. Should have listed the reviews and went with another router. Will return this router if it restarts one more time. Too many restarts. If it does restarts, I will go with the Asus or Linksys AC router, since I hear a lot of good things about it and have a really really good reviews on Amazon and other sources.Hope Netgear read and understands the issue since other people are having really similar issues.Pros:Easy to set upExcellent featuresGets a steady and constant speedCons:Constant restartWiFi won't start sometimes.It may be a faulty unit, but If anyone else gets it, I hope you guys don't have any problems, or else is a pain.Thank you for reading my reviews, hope it was helpful in anyway.

column9: as long as you don't need it...
column10: received 3/17/2013 it now drops and has to be booted 4 or 5 time daily. Worked great for 6 months but after that down, down then down again..... find something better, then let me know so I can make a better choice... I have not talked to NetGear so far so look for my update.

column9: Worked for 9 months then dies after firmware update
column10: This router worked great for 9 months and then died after the most recent firmware update.Their tech support charges you for a replacement which you will invariably need.

Router worked well for a few months then began drop only the 2.4 wireless connection. The router had to be restarted to regain connection 2 to 5 times per day. (5GHz connection unaffected.) Tried changing channels daily with no improvement.

column9: Rounter maintaine intermittent connection to the internet
column10: I have a desktop and a laptop, both of which connect to the internet with WI-FI.  Both devices were able to connect without a problem through a CenturyLink router.  I switched to Comcast as a internet provider and purchased this router to connect to the Comcast modem.  The router was unable to maintain a connection to the internet using this router.  After about a minute, both computers would lose their connection to the internet.  Each time I tried to reconnect to this router, I had to re-enter my key.  After returning this router, I purchased a Buffalo router.  I was able to connect both computers using the Buffalo router, and have not had a problem maintaining the connection for the last three weeks.I will not purchase another Netgear device again.Jim

I didn't know that this router was not compatible with windows 8, which my computer uses, I thought it would be an easy set up, but then I find out I would have to download an upgrade for it to work for me. I am not that computer savvy so I now have the router sitting in the box it came in and am not using it. If anyone wants a router that is for windows Vista, XP, 2000, Me, Mac, OS, UNIX, or Linux. I have one that is useless to me.

column9: The worse support ever if you buy a Netgear device;  and this product will go down
column10: So I bought this router and had it for a year.  Within my year was up for the warranty, it stopped working.  They completely blamed it on a software problem and completely skirted the issues.  I talked with 3 'supervisors' and they wanted $40 to 'fix' it.  I will never buy another NETGEAR product again.  If you need help from them, they will make you pay.

column9: wish it would have worked longer and very poor tech support
column10: I purchased this router after a careful review of the specs which were very good indeed when I purchased the product.  This router worked like a charm for 9 months, flawless.  I have quite a few devices on the network, three laptops, couple of Xboxes, tablet, three smart phones, apple tv, you know the basics.  The dual band wifi was great, fast two signals secure really worked good.  Then, the wifi signal would just drop, like every ten minutes, you could reconnect by turning the wifi of and on again a couple of times and it would work for a while and then drop again, repeat, repeat etc.  I call the cable company and they run their diagnostics and point to the router.  I finally break down and call netgear which routes you to use an outside contractor which you pay for in order to get support.  This is frustrating but I liked the router.  I pay $40 to use their contracted tech support.  Over many hours (4) on multiple days they run me through all of the check lists and procedures, reset to factory settings, change channels, probably five other settings each requiring some time to see if the problem still exists.  They conclude it must be the ISP.  I have charter come out rerun wire, check signals, quite a bit actually with the same result.  The ISP portion works fine, always did but your router, not so much, same problem.  I call tech support again, pretty much the exact same solution run through the settings factory reset etc.  At this point there is nothing a setting will do to fix this issue. I ask for an RMA. It's still under 1 yr old, tech support says we don't do that, call netgear. I call netgear and get rerouted to tech support which says why did you call us?  So basically, there is no way to get to netgear directly to get an RMA because tech support will not issue you one.  So the warranty works how again? Did I mention I have already paid for tech support by the way.  So, if you want to roll the dice with this piece of equipment by all means.  However, if it's possible that you will either need tech support and  are not 100% sure this router will never fail I just can't recommend this product or this company and definitely not the tech support, as it was really time consuming, frustrating and useless.  It would have been far better to go out and purchase another product for $100 and skip the tech support and literally hours and hours of time wasted trying to get this product to work again or get someone on the phone to issue an RMA.  Which if that is the current business model of Netgear well that's really not terribly consumer friendly.So you do not get the wrong idea, this product the WNDR3700 was being used to replace the Netgear WNR2000 which still works flawlessly which is why I choose to stay with this brand for this product.  This has been my experience with this product, Netgear and their tech support contractor.

This router has given me nothing but problems since I bought it. I replaced my apple time capsule with this and nothing seems to work right. I constantly have to restart the router because things keep getting disconnected and a PS3 or XBox 360 will not connect to it. Netgear released a firmware version that doesn't work with the router if you are going to buy it do some research on the latest firmware version and all the problems that people are having with it.

Purchased this product 5 months ago, and was easy enough to set up, and worked great until last week when I had to reset  the cable modem. After that I kept losing my internet connection, and had to go and reset this router 7 or 8 times a day. Yesterday it finally died. From previous experience with Netgear I know there was no point in calling them for support because they make you pay  a lot for for it.I wish I had bought a cheaper router instead of handing over close to $100 for this piece of junk that lasted for a few months. (I notice all the 5 star reviews are written by people who have just had the router a few weeks) Yeah,this router is super easy to set up, and works great.....for about 5 or 6 months. But $90 is way too much for a product that lasts for a few months! And probably costs $2 dollars to manufacture!!Now I have no wireless connection until Comcast delivers a box that has replaces both modem and router. Glad I don't have to waste my hard earned money on another Netgear wireless router that lasts a few months. Although the previous router did last a few years.

This router was great for the first 12 months. It did what I needed it to do. USB was always slow but it was my first router with USB so I didn't know how fast it was supposed to work. We started having speed problems a few months ago and I've finally pinpointed our problems to the router. Awful, intermittent problems that were tough to diagnose.Basically I had to replace all of our netgear switches and router to get of constant packet loss.

This has been nothing but trouble.  First of all, the box did not include a manual or installation CD.  Because I opened it after a vacation it was too late to send it back as defective.  When I called Netgear to ask for the CD they said I didn't need it and would walk me through the installation. That did not work and the problem was blamed on Apple.  Apple was very nice but said the problem was Netgears.  I have spent hours on this and am not satisfied with the technical help.  The router might be fine, if I could get it to work.

column9: Don't waste your money on this junk
column10: I bought it from Amazon.com and long time wait after received it.. after connected with my modem and home networking, I found this is not working with Apple Mac Book Pro computer.. I called Netgear Tech support they refuse to provide Tech support due to this router seller three times sale and returned by customer.. I call Apple Tech support, even they can not fix the problem... so do not spend your money for any used router from Amazon.com. Its better to buy from local store so at least, you can return..Very bad experience with this seller and NetGear...
this router has poor reception disconnects my devices i cant get anything done switched back to my old router works better than the new one

I currently own a Netgear WNDR3400 and I purchased this router because of my familiarity with the brand.  I plugged it in and went to log in and that is where the problem started.  There was no graphical user interface.  Only a white screen with black text.  There was no banner or Netgear header.  There was no grey or blue or green or any other color other than black text on a white screen.  So I called tech support.  An hour and a half later and dozens of statements by the tech saying that this was the normal user interface, I went on youtube and saw what it was supposed to look like.  Mine was nothing like that.  It was as if I typed the text on a white sheet in MS Word.  The tech still insisted that was the way it was designed.  I can only assume that he was either incompetent or he likes to stubbornly insist on lying about the fact that my new router is defective.  NETGEAR must do a better job than this.  I can believe that the router is bad out of the box given the hit and miss reviews, but I can't accept the obstinate refusal to listen to the experience of the customer when there is obviously a problem.  This router is being returned........for a brand that is more reliable and tech support that is more understanding of customer issues.  I will now see if Amazon is as customer friendly as they claim to be.

I really liked this router for about 4 months. It's features are nice, its fast, etc. etc. And its highly compatible with WW-DRT so you can use open source software with much more control if you want to go that way.However, it apparently has a problem where the radio gets weak. Over the past week or so I thot I had ISP problems, but it was really my router slowly dying. Today it barely works from 3 feet away and constantly drops the connection. Instead of getting the expected connection of around 300M, I can only get 5M or 2M or 1M, when it connects at all. So beware!

I don't know if it was just bad luck or a bad product, but the one I received was defective. I spent hours configuring and factory resetting this router trying to get it to work consistently. This was my first Netgear product and possibly my last... returned!

Problems from day 1. Router required cycling the power more than once a week. Now the wireless has completely stopped working. Their customer service is no help at all. In fact it's some of the worst I've ever encountered. By whatever means you can, avoid Netgear products!

column9: Hardware Failure After 13 Months! No Warranty Coverage!
column10: I purchased this product and have been using it for over a year. I just returned from a week long vacation to find that I had no Wi-Fi in my house. When I examined the router, I noticed a subtle and continuous hissing sound. I contacted Netgear support and they said they were unable to help me because I was over the one year warranty period. I searched the web for recommendations and found that hardware failure was very common for Netgear products. I did try flashing the firmware, but that did not solve the problem.I would not recommend this or any other Netgear product to anyone. Beware Buyers BEWARE, Netgear design their products to last just over one year so they do not need to provide technical support to their customers.

I was very happy with this router until DynDNS stopped their free service in May 2013.  Now I can no longer use our web cams without purchasing DynDNS.  Linksys and other routers allow you to use other free DNS services but Netgear only allows DynDNS.

i bought this wireless router because i bought a larger home with two floors, on the description it said "for medium to large homes". installation was super easy, lets get to the connection issue: my modem and new wireless router are connected in my master bedroom. my game room is a couple of feet away same floor, in which it had connection problems, with my new netgear running with 2ghz at 300mbps, the connection speed was 6.5mbps unacceptable. my old 54mbps, without dual band would connect wirelessly at 18.8mbps. So i tried connecting to the other connection in which this router has, running at 5ghz 300mps, i tried connecting my PS3 and PC couldn't find the SSID at all, in other words no signal. Only my ipad and iphone were able to fine the connection. Yet again it ran slower than my old wireless router, in fact i went downstairs with my iphone and i lost connection. after almost five hours of trying to figure out this router, i gave up and called customer support. after all my frustration, to make a long story short, customer service was no help, signal was still horrible and nothing was solved. i am returning this product back to amazon for a full refund and hopefully i can find a router that works.

column9: 2.4 broadcasting issues and terrible technical support.
column10: I am not going to go into detail about all the phone calls, obscene wait times, disconnection on live chat, inability to reach a support representative, being hung up on and lack of product knowledge when I did finally get through but I will say that Netgear has the worst customer support I have ever experienced.This router has serious known issues with 2.4 broadcasting as you can read from all other reviews and a quick google search.Only purchase this router if you have the patience to unplug your router multiple times a day and do factory resets every week until a couple months after the warranty expires and it stops working completely.The only thing that saved me was that the place that I purchased it from was willing to take it back out of their return policy because they said they had so many issues with it.

Although I have purchased a different router than the WNDR3700 I just want to indicate that after encounering a problem with the product I called the support team. The support team was not only unhelpful but also very rude. I have never encountered such a low level customer service. If I had a time machine one of the first things I would do would actually go back in time and tell my self to not buy their product. I have never given such a low review to any product I have ever purchased. I belive that their support team is way below par and I am very disappointed.

Like some of you, I am not a avid reviewer but felt it was necessary to write this review.  I purchased this router (not from Amazon) to replace an old die-hard-set-it-and-forget-it Linksys WRT54G.  The Linksys worked great for years... the NETGEAR WNDR3700 I purchased slowly but surely crapped out on me after only 6 months... possibly a factory defect but nonetheless left a lasting bad impression.  The WiFi range was not what I expected of an N router and really not much better than my old Linksys.Although the router was set to broadcast 24/7, at the 5 month mark, the 2.4ghz band would randomly shut off once a day.  After a couple of weeks it went to twice a day.  I had to access the router through the 5ghz band to reset it or restart it from the on/off switch at the back of the router.  After the reset/restart the 2.4ghz band would work.  After a few weeks of frustrating daily restarts, the 2.4ghz band completely went out.  Restarts or resets no longer helped.Overall I am very disappointed with this router's hardware problems, performance and poor range.  I replaced the NETGEAR with an ASUS RT-N66U Wireless N900 I ordered through Amazon.  The web-based interface on the ASUS is clean and the wifi range beats the NETGEAR by a mile.  Where I got zero to one bar of signal strength on my iPhone 5 and Nexus 7 with the NETGEAR, I am now registering almost full bars.  My home network has two wireless FOSCAM cameras that did not stream well on the NETGEAR but now works perfectly connected to the ASUS RT-N66U.I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS ROUTER.  Move on to something better and it doesn't have to be the ASUS I purchased... but I do recommend it.  I hear the Cisco EA4200 or EA4500 work well too.

column9: Buggy router and NetGear ignoring responsibility for it
column10: I bought this product a few months ago. It worked fine in the beginning, but suddenly the 2.4 GHz signal strength dropped so you had to be less than a foot from the router to connect to it.  I called customer service and after 3(!!!) hours on the phone, they agreed to send me a replacement (they initially wanted me to send mine in first or to pay for the shipment)- and I would be stuck with no internet (I could still use the 5GHz with my IPad).  The new router arrived a few weeks ago, but now it stopped working because of a different problem. I am now already 2.5 hours on the phone with them and still am not sure they will send me a new one without charging, even though they admit that they will need to do so.Bottom line - a faulty unreliable product, with terrible tech support and customer service.  I would highly recommend not to buy.

I replaced my old Linksys WRT54G with the Netgear WNDR3700. There really wasn't anything wrong with the old router, but I hoped for a faster connection with the newer technology. Since installing it several months ago, the Netgear drops our internet connection at least once a week and more commonly every couple of days. It must be restarted to reestablish the connection. I never had this problem with the old Linksys router, which stayed connected for months at a time and never had to be restarted. Since purchasing the Netgear router, I've read many similar complaints from frustrated customers. I worked with Netgear tech support on two occasions and their level of understanding of the product seems very basic and their ability to help has been limited. No solution yet. I would recommend avoiding this product.

column9: Immediate frustration doing the simplest tasks
column10: Shopping for a new router is like shopping for a new PC motherboard. The time between purchases is years. The combination of radios, USB ports, firmware, and other built-in services require a solid evening or two of research.I’m a network savvy developer and it took me 30 minutes just to set the SSID and passphrase. That’s not right. I should have noticed something was amiss when I saw the router’s ON/OFF button. My old D-Link has no such feature. Why should it? I want constant access to data when it’s available.The setup delays were caused by a modal pop-up on the router’s admin page: “WPS process is in progress, please apply the changes later.” The number one search on Google pointed to the Netgear support forum, which was down the entire day I tried to setup the network. Thank you, Google cache. The solution was to initiate a WPS connection then cancel it. Whatever. The wired LAN worked, wifi worked, and all my devices could connect. Setup isn’t too critical (or so I rationalized) because I configure it and leave it. A router isn’t something you interact with – it just moves data.Every morning and sometimes midday the router would simply hang. The use of the power switch became clear. Netgear couldn’t get the firmware to work so they tacked on a power switch for fast/effective resets.Set in the OFF position I’m still not entirely sure it’s not operating. I didn’t hook up a wattmeter. I’d rather not know, actually. I even tried the factory reset when it appeared to freeze and there was no effect.I packed it up and returned it shortly after this ordeal.

When its online it works great. Purchased 2 weeks ago. Dropped 5+ times. Spoke to a friend who loves his. So I returned it and the (same model) dropped twice in one day. Will return for another brand. Stay away.

This router is bad and I would not recommend anyone to buy it. When the router was working it has to be power cycled almost daily in order to function properly. 4 months after I bought the router it completely stopped working. I called NETGEAR but they didn't help because my three month free support period was over. NETGEAR wanted me to pay a monthly fee of about $15(not a 100% on this number). I have already went back to my old router that I bought for $50. This is a first time I have ever bought a NETGEAR product and it feels like I have been conned out of a $100. If you are thinking about buying this product do yourselves a favor and buy a cheaper router from a different brand because the cheap router will at least be reliable unlike the NETGEAR router.

column9: Gave me more trouble than satisfaction...
column10: This is the exact product I was looking for and seemed to work good for about 3-4 months.  Of course it wasn't mistreated, or handled improperly, as it was just sitting on a desk the whole time.  This is not a user-error type of complaint either.  Network has been down more than it has been up, and after exhausting all trouble-shooting efforts, it is clear that it is the router.  Of course the return period has expired, and I'm left with an expensive paperweight.  It would sure be nice if Amazon would consider a replacement/return.  Honestly, all I want is a functioning router, an exchange would be suitable.  Well, I guess I'm back to using my 10+ year old router until I find another solution.

This thing never worked right.  I got it for my parrents and when I went to get into settings I couldn't remember the password so I tried a hard reset.  The hard reset button didn't work so I was locked out.  I ended up throwing this router away and getting a new linksys.

column9: WARNING:  Technical support is worse than a joke
column10: Apparently, and according to what is advertised as technical support, there are a number of additional provisions that apply before one can get installation assistance.  These involve the date of manufacture of the router, the date of purchase of the router, and the time period that has elapsed since purchase.  Prior to purchase of the product you are expected to ascertain the date of manufacture of the router.  Routers manufactured too far in the past, according to NETGEAR protocol, could invalidate your chances of getting installation assistance.  In that case, the installation assistance people will demand that you provide them with a copy of proof of purchase (i.e. the receipt) prior to them spending the 5 minutes helping you to set up your router.  If you do not have sufficient proof of purchase you will be invited to purchase, for approximately the cost of the router, an assistance plan where these same people will supposedly help you install your router.  The same applies to a time period (90 days was my case) between purchasing and attempting to set-up your router.  A delay in installation may make their promise of installation assistance invalid, according to their protocols, which of course you will not know at the time of purchase.Oh wait.  The 90 day thing is in very very small print on the side of the box.  The promise of installation assistance is in large print on the front of the box.Good luck.

column9: NETGEAR Wireless Router - N600 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR3700) Ok till it dies.
column10: Purchased just over a year ago. Setup from CD didn't work. Was able to set up manually with some help from the website. Worked reasonably well for just over a year, then died (power adapter was still good). Contacted customer support by email and was directed to try a couple of things that were for a bricked condition not a dead one (basic reset and a 3-3-3 reset, didn't work). After @ 3 email cycles I was informed that my router was out of warranty but each new tech, after apoligizing, would try to see what they could do. They always ending the email with 'Thanks again for choosing NETGEAR. Have a great day!' Myself, not feeling good about choosing Netgear or having a nice day but definately getting the runaround. I wasn't looking for a freebe and asked the next tech if I could have it repaired thinking they might be interested in why their product failed. I was informed that they didn't do that, but they apoligized and would see what they could do. It became evident they weren't going to do anything but couldn't say that to me. They were just waiting for me to give up and go away so after the sixth email cycle I closed the case. So the result is $99 for @ 13 months, not the best deal around, at least Amazon gave me free shipping. Must not be a rare incident because I see more of their routers now come with a limited lifetime warranty. They could of done something for me after all the customer support merry-go-round.

column9: Great until the wifi radio dies
column10: If you haven't seen the common theme with these 1 star reviews I will enlighten you with a quick summary.this router is great until the wifi radio dies. it is a known fact that the radios in these die anywhere from shortly after purchase or just after the warranty expires.for me the latter was the case. buyer be warned that the 2.4g radio will die on you. if you don't need a 2.4g radio then this might be the router for you.

I bought this based on the glowing reports of its power and range as a WiFi router.  Everything was fine until I upgraded to a new firmware version released by Netgear.  After setting up everything in my home network including wireless printing and NAS access for bot Mac's and PC's, I was very troubled to find that there was communication between my networked devices had been knocked out.  I spent hours upon hours reinstalling drivers but no avail until I did a little research and found that the new firmware that Netgear had released 1.0.0.32 did not support communications with networked devices...Correct me here but I think that's one of the basic functions of a wireless network.  On top of that when you call Netgear support they will help you if you pay them to help fix a problem they caused.After four months of people complaining they released another version of the frimware that would fix the wireless communication problem but their firmware utility did not recognize the new version of firmware as compatible with the router.  So now you have to go through a process of using something called TFTP, reset the router to factory settings, wire a laptop directly to the router using a static IP address and then reflash the firmware back to the version before 1.0.0.32.  The only redeeming thing about Netgear is that they keep old versions of the firmware on their website.My advice to you is to stick with a manufacturer that is good...which is anyone but Netgear...Linksys / Cisco is good, heck Belkin was very good.  If I had not spent so much money on this router I would have just junked it and bought one from a company that understands consumer technology.BUY NETGEAR ONLY IF YOU ARE REALLY WANT TO TEST YOUR TECHNOLOGY SUPPORT SKILLS....If you just want a router that works buy Cisco.

column9: ongoing configuration issues - DO NOT BUY THIS Router!
column10: I had a Linksys router for about 10 years that for some silly reason I thought I needed to replace with a newer router. Big mistake. I purchased this item in nov 2012.  Since the beginning I have had several issues, have had to reset back to factory settings numerous times and now it is not working at all. When I called Netgear support (Which was an act in futility in itself) they told me that for the price of $39, the could help me fix the configuration. I work for a technology company and am comfortable with technology. The fact that I cannot figure out the issue on my own is the first red flag. The second issue is that according to their support line, the configuration was messed up because of some sort of a power surge.  In the 10 years of owning my Linksys device, I never had that issue. But even so, shouldn't I be able to configure it myself without giving NetGear more money?  This has been such a huge headache. I cannot imagine how the occasional user might figure out this device without having any technical background if I have had such issues.  Poor product. poor customer service.
I bought this from newegg and it worked for 3 mos without problems and then the 2.4 ghz just died.  That is terrible reliability.

column9: Don't waste your money on this garbage.
column10: I've used netgear routers for a long time. I installed 3 of these for my clients and two of them the wireless just stopped working and one of them got bricked and couldn't reset it. I called and was asked to pay so they could troubleshoot and it takes a lot of emailing back and forth so they could send me another which i had to pay the shipping and handling. I was so fed up that I ended installing cisco routers for both of my clients and went back to using my old 54g netgear which still works great. I don't know if they're using cheaper materials but I've lost my faith in netgear.

column9: Product problems and Netgear support sucks
column10: I got the router and it worked great for 2 weeks. Then, everything was slowing down and I was having to cycle the power daily. Finally, I called tech support (farmed out to India) and spent hours with them slowly and painfully trying to change settings. Each time they said they'd keep my ticket open in case the problem wasn't fixed. Well, I'm again on the phone, was disconnected right after they said they'd call me back w/in 60 seconds, called back and asked for a manager, was transferred, but no answer, then disconnected again. Called back again and disconnected again. Not my phone. I simply can't get competent help from these people, aside from a product that works correctly (my wired connection to the router is 1/2 the speed if I go directly from modem to computer). Still can't get a call to last with them or get the help I need.About 3 months ago, we bought the N900 and it worked well. I needed another router and went with this one. I won't be going with Netgear again. I simply hate it when a company throws you into a never ending queue with people who don't fix the problem, and finally when the connection stinks b/c it's 1/2 way around the world.WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY. I welcome any attempt by Netgear to address this situation and will update this review if and when they do.Update Apr 5:Been on the phone w/ tech support daily. Each day they guarantee that the router changes they were making would fix it. 3 or 4 technicians kept assuring me (literally). Yesterday, the tech said they'd replace if I had more issues. More issues, call back, and then the new tech guarantees to me he can fix in 10 minutes. That they didn't want to replace, even after saying they would is just bad customer service on many levels. So, another hour of my time eaten up w/ this shoddy product, poor service, and waiting on hold on the phone. Now the customer service rep says the version 4 is out of stock and wants to give me a version 3, saying it's just the same (it's $30 less since v3 is discontinued). On hold to speak to a manager. If you went to buy a car and they wanted to switch you out to the older model would you do it? Absolutely not and it's ridiculous that they are trying to force me into it. Spoke to a manager after insisting and the manager says they'll 'try' to put me into the same product but can't guarantee. WHAT?! It's the brand new product and he can't guarantee I'll get what I bought, but wants to give me a discontinued model. Now the manager says I can be upgraded to a different product that is 2 years old, which has an average 1 star less rating.SKIP ON THIS LOUSY PRODUCT AND LOUSY COMPANY. CUSTOMER SERVICE PROBLEMS THAT DON'T END.

column9: poor reception, slow bootup, new firmware (1.0.0.36) just blowed it up
column10: I have had this router for about a year.  Before this I had a netgear G router and it was exceptionally good.  Therefore, when I was looking for an N with the gigabit naturally I went to netgear again.Well, this router has been showing me nothing but disappointment.If it works, it does provide the N speed it promises, and also the Gigabit speed.  But --1)  the range, either on 2.4 or 5, are much worse than my old G router. the same distance (about 50 feet) the G router had no reception issues, but the N cannot stay connected.  there are two interior walls from the router to the kitchen, it didn't bother the G router, but this one cannot provide a consistent connection in the same situation.2) the speed, everything I do a configuration change, it will have to reboot, and it takes far more time to come back.  the old G router was much faster3) the worst, came after the firmware upgrade.  I thought the new firmware would at least make the problem not worse, i was wrong.  the new firmware now makes the route not able to stay connected with any of my devices almost every 24 hours.  everyday now I have to reboot it at least once.I have tried to reset it many times, it simply does not work.Yet, they don;t have phone service after 90 days of purchase.  they don;t have online chat after 90 days of purchase.  I have to go thru the email channel with them and hope they can tell me if the unit is defective and have not heard from them.I would not recommend this router for this price.

I have a WNDR3700 purchased in 2009.  About 1 out of ever 5 times I try to log on it says that the internet is not available.  Resetting the 3700 seems to fix the problem for that log on but it will happen again within the hour.  I got with my internet provider and narrowed the problem down to the router.  I tried to get some help from NETGEAR and their answer was 'give us $80.00 dollars and we will help you for 6 months'.  I can buy a NEW router for not much more than $80.00 and I will have a new warrantee and support plan.  It may not be any better with another manufacturer but I am going to find out.  I will not be buying any NETGEAR products again and for your own piece of mind, I suggest you stay clear of them too.

column9: One of the most aggravating products I have ever purchased
column10: I bought this on recommendation of a techie and I have been severely disappointed.  I've experienced tremendous issues with wifi connectivity with Apple devices.  I've updated firmware, changed about every setting on the router and devices with had no success.  Research on many tech boards blames issues btw iOS 6.0 and Netgear products.  It seems to have some nice features and potential but has been an utter trainwreck in our home.

Well lets see no real features include a real firewall.Wireless connections were constantly dropping off the players in the house ever few mins after only 3 weeks online.I moved on using a Belkin now with no issues at all.The one before NETGEAR was an actiontec lasted 2 and a half years no issues until it died.

column9: Issues and Poor Support From Netgear
column10: I purchased this router a few months ago and installed it on my network. Everything worked until a short time ago we lost connectivity. I swapped out another router I had (belkin) until I could figure the problem on this one. I have been very busy, howver today I called Netgear tech support. Tech support asked me a bunch of questions and then told me he would not help me because my support was over. I was on the phone for quite a while until they determined they would not help me. Even though I never called one single time from the point we got the product a few months ago. He told to email the issue. Where in the world is customer service. After the many questions I was asked I find it very unusual to get no answer at all. Clearly Ill avoid Netgear in the future. The rep sort of slipped and told me that even though the product worked for me originally it might not have been set up correctly. 90 day support in my opinion is to make sure you hook it up. Actually it is so you dont return it to the store. Retailers demand that. Since I cant return it I might be stuck and get something else from another manufacturer. I have set up routers before and there is definitely something wrong here. My old crummy router hooks up in 30 seconds with zero issues. Really disappointed in this and I think there is more issues that I am unaware of.

column9: Useless tech support; product not ready for market yet
column10: Started working with NetGear tech support on one issue, but later ended up with a lot more:1. USB Drive mapping not working2. Log stops working for no reason3. User/password not required to access the settings page - anybody can access the configuration of the router w/o having to login.4. Rules for blocking services broken - had to reboot router to fix it everyday5. Wireless signal unstableUseless tech support:Started having issues a few days after I bought this router. Worked with NetGear Support for nearly 4 months with no progress and more issues were discovered.I have received almost a dozen 'apologies' like the below one but zero progress was made on the issue so far. After almost 4 months, they still kept telling me that their team is still working hard on next actions and they'll need more time. Really? After 4 months? Come on. I highly doubt if anybody is seriously looking into the issus I reported. I eventually gave up on the router and went back to an old one.'Please accept our sincere apology for the inconvenience that you had experienced. Rest assured that we will use your comments and feedback to review our Product Quality, Customer Service & Training Program to continue providing world class customer product & service to all our customers.'I had high expectations for NetGear routers but this experience totally changes my opinion on NetGear. I won't buy another NetGear product any more.

I have had Serious problems with this poor quality router. As so many others have said 'it freezes & drops connections'. I spend more time turning it off & on than I do using it. I tried to get some help from customer service and they informed me that it needed a firmware update, BUT, they also said that I would have to Pay either a yearly fee or an expensive one time service fee to get the update. The fee's were at least 1/3 or more the price of a New Router for the one time fee, and the yearly price was more than 90% of what a new router would cost. I am going to get me a new Asus router because I know the quality of their hardware from all the computers I have built using their motherboards.This Netgear router is junk when it quits working, and I refuse to pay for a firmware update, since it would cost me almost as much as a new router. (Stay Away From This Router) It will work very well only for a short time, then it's nothing but trouble. I don't like to publish bad reviews, this is the first bad one on Amazon. I didn't get this router from Amazon.Netgear customer service is also Poor. I had to call 3 times before I finally got someone who could speak english, and even then the connection was poor and had a lot of static. I will never buy another Netgear product after this.UPDATE: After doing more research on this router & problems, I found that netgear is aware of hardware problems with this router. It's all over the internet. I tried to use their Genie software to get a firmware update, with no luck. I just purchased a new Asus router from Amazon.

I have always purchased Linksys wrt54g before this.  I figured id try something different.  big mistake.  I have connection issues all the time...  cant even find a good custom firmware for it since its a piece of s*** version 3.  ill NEVER buy netgear again

column9: Beware with firmware updates for this model- Update, Died in less than a year
column10: Overall, the router works pretty well. Reading and writing off the USB is a little slow. The range is pretty good, and it's been reliable after I updated to firmware 1.0.0.32.  The problem, however, now is that there is a known issue with that version of the firmware that prevents you from upgrading past it. I am now getting notices that there is a new version available, .36, however, the device will not update. I've wasted several days with Netgear's HORRIBLE Tech Support, and other than trying to sell me paid support for more than I paid for the router, they've been useless. Netgear really has among the WORST customer support, so if you're considering this, hope you don't have issuesUpdate: 4/5/13  Well, that's it. Less than a year and the wireless chip died. Of course, Netgear's lousy support won't do anything since it was a refurb.  Live and learn, going to another brand now from now on.  Crap

the router was defective so how else could i rate it.  however, i can say that the company was very helpful trying to get it working.I was on the phone with them for almost 2 hours before they asked me to return the unit.  except for burning my cell phone minutes, it showed decent customer service

column9: First one died after 6 months and the replacement died in 2 months.
column10: While this router is fast and works great while it works, it doesn't work for long. My first one was brand new and lasted about 6 months and then just died. It had no functionality whatsoever. I went through the troubleshooting process with NETGEAR and they were helpful, however, to get a warranty replacement sooner than one or two weeks out, I had to pay over $30 shipping. The refurbished replacement worked for only 2 months and then died--same issue as before--nothing but an amber colored power light. I tried to call NETGEAR again and I could not understand any of the south Asian phone reps so I gave up. I went out and bought an APPLE AirPort Extreme.Update -- called customer service again to try and get another replacement that I could then resell to another sucker, but I was notified my original warranty was expired and that even though it was a replacement unit that died, that the original warranty still applied. I hope NETGEAR dies a painful death.

column9: Drops off all wireless devices randomly
column10: This wireless router is unstable when it comes to wireless. If you have more than one wireless device in your household do not buy this router.I have security camera, another computer and a phone and this router will randomly drop all wireless connectivity and you will have to restart it in order for devices to link up again.Horrible, 1 star.

I bought this router initially because of the good reviews and the capability to use it with 3rd party firmware, but upon using it, it is rather unstable. The wireless cuts out about once every 2 days or more with the default firmware. I did not try it with a 3rd party firmware and decided to get a replacement. Even after the replacement exhibited the same behavior, I decided to switch to another router.Switching to a e4200 proved to be a good choice as that one has very similar features and is much more stable. I run it for months without having to reset it.

I purchased this product in June 2012 and it broke within three months. I contacted Netgear and they sent a replacement in August (I had to pay for shipping and had to deal with buying another router to use in the meantime). I used the replacement router until January 2013 and it has just broken again. I contacted Netgear and they are only willing to replace the router instead of issuing a refund, which is just a hassle since I have a feeling it's only going to break again. I will never buy another Netgear product again. The product sucks and so does their customer service.

Previous review: Three starsAll in all a decent router for basic usage.  However if you are looking at the Dynamic DNS functionality to run services from computers in your home (Nanny cams, remotely manage files on your computer, etc) is quite lacking in that only one provider (DynDNS.org) is supported.  It is missing support for all the other large DNS providers out there, eg: no-ip.com, freedns.org, zoneedit.com, etc.  If you are already using one of these other providers, you can not use your account with this router.  Let's hope they update their firmware in the future to address this deficiency.-------------------------------------------UPDATE: Changed to ONE starBECAUSE: As of May 2013, Dyn.com has changed their policy that only allows 1 month of service (without continuously logging into their site). This makes Dynamic DNS operation on Netgear equipment effectively unusable.  DO NOT buy Netgear if you want to use Dynamic DNS with a free provider of your choice.

The router did not function at all,spent hours trying to hook it up,trying to find out whatI did wrong,finally called someone with expertice on the subject who determinedrouter did not function .Would not recommend this product at all.They expect thebuying public to be their quality control

This router didn't have the coverage area my 4 year old Belkin router had . I had to constantly run Network diagnostics on my Mac ect, It is a impressive looking  router.I ended up returning it to Staples and ordering  a ASUS RT-N66U from Amazon.We'll see how that performs.

column9: Worse than useless with stock software.
column10: This device features some pretty decent hardware. Unfortunately, with the included software, describing it as worthless would be charitable. Do not consider this device for even one moment unless your very first step will be to reflash it.The software is so terrible that it makes one seriously wonder why the people responsible for it are even allowed to touch a computer keyboard without adult supervision.First and foremost, this router deliberately gives root access to anyone who asks. There is a special service running for the purpose of doing just that. Your administrator password is irrelevant; the magic packet is a hard-coded value that cannot be changed. This level of negligence may be hard to believe -- search the web for 'netgear telnetenable' to see it for yourself.Even if that doesn't bother you, hope you don't need much of a custom configuration because many (most?) of the functionality is badly broken. For example, changing certain settings simply has no effect until you reboot. No, it doesn't tell you to reboot -- you learn that on your own after trying to figure out why the heck it's not doing what it says it will. For instance, adding a reserved DHCP address -- it will display the reservation but continue assigning dynamic IPs until the router reboots.That might not be such a big deal either, except that after rebooting, the router will not connect to the Internet until the cablemodem (plugged into the router's uplink port) is rebooted, too. This is especially great when the router reboots itself for no good reason, and you're not home to reset the cablemodem. There'll be no Internet connection until you do that.There are other issues but just thinking about the incompetence is grating on my nerves, so I'll stop here. Do not buy this device. You will regret it.

My first wireless router was a Netgear WRT54G. Worked great, so I stuck with them for my next two routers. I currently have a WNR1000 which is fine for my needs, except, in this house, we barely get a signal in our bedroom. So I figured I'd look for a full-fledged N router with a better range and maybe some extras. I saw this one and decided it looked like a safe bet. The WNR1000 page has a comparison chart showing the WNDR3700 with two more bars (5 compared to 3!), so I figured it would give us plenty of signal strength. I was completely and utterly wrong. The 5GHz band disappears completely halfway down the hall. The 2.4GHz band has roughly the same signal, but slightly less, on the three devices I tried with it - a desktop computer, a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, and a PS3. The PS3 actually gave the percentages as 50% for our old router and 47% for the WNDR3700, despite them being sided by side and with the WNDR3700 actually between me and the other router.Sending this POS back.

column9: Loved it until it died after seven months
column10: I bought this router because it offered the 5 GHz wifi band.  It worked perfectly for seven months and then died.  Returning it to Netgear.

What a huge let down.  Setup and installation was easy, and the connection speeds for wireless were great all throughout my house (2600 sq/ft), but it would drop the connections on a daily basis.  I searched the Netgear boards to see if there was some resolution, but it appears this is a common problem.

I purchased this router to replace my Belkin wireless G router.  When it works, it is FAST...unfortunately, it drops both wired and wireless connections at least once a day.I am returning it and will search for something that actually works.

column9: Worked for 5-6 months, now wireless is gone
column10: The entire device worked flawlessly for the first 5-6 months, but in the last few days the wireless has gone from whole-home coverage to only a 2 foot radius from the device.

column9: great router for a month, awful service
column10: I decided to update this product after my experience.  First off, the router was super fast with super far range before the newest firmware update became available.  Then it was a disaster.Netgear customer service is nuts!!!!  They are mean and difficult to deal with.  Their main focus is to not help you, and sell you their premium support plan.  They require proof of purchase to even talk to you for free.Im am intermediate to advanced level as far as my experience with computers.  I found it difficult to handle when I knew more than the their support group.For whatever reason, my computer refused to open the firmware upgrade.  I have file extractors that can read all types of files.I wanted the best router for the price.  But man did I ever put myself through hell.I cant get more than 2 bars at 20 ft away, and no reception at 50 ft.  When I first purchased the range was 4 of 5 bars 200 ft away.I cant take it.  I will go back to my d-link router.  It works and they have always been a pleasure to deal with.Also, Cisco has also been nice.  I recommend those brands unless you want to take the risk

column9: WNDR3700v2 Drops wireless every hour or so - requiring reboot
column10: Fast when it works. Have had it about 3 months and it drops wireless every hour or so, requiring a power-cycle. I do not have endless hours to research the internet or open customer support tickets (speaking with Pakistani or Indian customer service). When I purchase a product, I expect it to work. Unfortunatly, it's been more than 90 days since I bought this from the local brick and mortar- and I refuse to deal with Netgear through the mail (noting their poor reputation I have read about here and elsewhere).I have purchased and used Netgear routers and switches for years and was reasonably satisfied until my experience with this router.I do have the 'v2' version, so I will try to flash an alternate firmware and see if that solves my stability issues. I will update this review when I do so and let others that have my same experience know if that helps/hinders/ or solves the issues.

column9: WNDR3700v3 and netgearare the worst product and company
column10: Netgear customer service is the WORST!!! I bought a WNDR3700v3 a couple of months ago and now it's not working. Tried to get a replacement and it has been 15 days with no success. Called the customer service multiple times and they keep transfer me to different departments and with no straight answers on the replacement status! I DON'T RECOMMEND ANYONE TO BUY NETGEAR product because of the unreliable product and customer service!Second Review:DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT or any NETGEAR PRODUCT! Received the replacement router after a month of dealing with netgear customer service. But guess what, the replacement is also defective! and now they want to charge me in order for me to get another replacement!!!! and the router is still under warranty! I gave up with this company, they are absolutely the worst company to deal with....

column9: DO NOT BUY!!! If you can spend 3 hours on each reset (not factory, just power cycle), Go for it!! AND CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS!
column10: UPDATE: 1/12/2013: Decided to give the folks at netgear a chance and boy was it a nightmare! The first guy wants to know why I had to reset my box. It was funny, he did not even want to listen to the issue. The second guy, was better but wanted me to go through a 'series of steps' that would fix it guaranteed. I asked him what those were and I get a set of steps that I have tried a 100 times. He also went on to tell me how it can take a while for the switch to get an internet connection. It was hilarious and obvious that this guy did not no anything. I asked for 2nd level of support and he put me on hold for 30 minutes and eventually disconnected. The third guy was really trying to help but had no authority whatsoever to send me a newer version of this same router to check if the problem is rectified. I told them that I had, not one but 3 of these routers (same version tested). Finally I got to 2nd level support (3 hours, no kidding) have passed by this time. This person wants me to do an packet capture using wireshark (of a connection that is working fine). I told her I can send in my router config file and that's it. Two days later, I got an email asking for some information. A day later, I get a smart answer that has not tested anywhere close to what my config is (with a SB6121 modem). I told him that and haven't heard back. It has been a week. If I can demote this to 0 stars, I absolutely will.UPDATE: 1/6/2013: Had to power cycle the modem in order to connect a hard drive. I ended up spending the same 3 hours yet again to get the connection to work. Now I am not even sure what I did to get it working! I did the routine Reset Modem->Switch DHCP to manual -> Switch to Secure ->Switch to DHCP->Switch to NAT and it did not work! It just wants you to babysit for 3 minutes for some undocumented race condition to occur that causes everything to work again. The Hard-drive connection itself works great. Again, I do not know if people with a DSL connection have similar issues. Fact is version2 of this router worked without issues. It is difficult for me to point fingers at the cable modem.UPDATE 12/15: Had the unfortunate experience of rebooting the router and the internet connection issue was back. This time though, I had an IP address. I was able to ping the gateway (not the 192.168.1.1 but comcast's gateway). Turn off dhcp and manual setting works but not when dhcp is enabled. Restoring the settings from a backup I had saved when I finally got it to work earlier was not of use either. After 3 hours and down-grading the router to 18 (from 22), things worked. Surprisingly enough the issue 22 addresses is a LAN-WAN setup issue but the webserver GUI has also been modified.  dont have the patience to reboot again (the whole process to get it working took 3 hours and I know networking reasonably well). The issue definitely is in the router (why else would v2 work without issues) but netgear insists the problem is with the cable modem. Be prepared to spend a lot of time if you buy this router.I have comcast high-speed and I bought my own cable modem (SB6121 by Motorola). I have never had any issues with the modem that combined with my N300 router. I saw this router as part of the lightning deal for 70 bucks. The first router I was sent was a 3700v2 (whereas the v3 was advertised on the webpage). I noticed it and spoke to customer service to have a v3 shipped which I got within a day. There are internal differences between v2 and v3 in terms of the chipsets being used. All reviews pointed to the v2 having a better wireless connectivity overall. The main difference between v2 and v3 (user perceivable) is that v3 has a USB3.0 port which allows for better streaming from a connected storage. Also, v3 has a faster processor overall and should be able to take its DLNA duties in addition to its wireless duties better.I had no problems installing the v2 (and I did not realize it until I saw it on the user webpage). The v3, on the other hand, was a different animal. It simply would not allow the modem to connect to the internet. It turns out that both my modem and the router have a DHCP server which was causing a problem. When I setup the router in bridge mode (and manually assigned the IP address), reset the modem, internet was up and running! The minute I turned on DHCP on the router, everything went for a toss (wired and wireless). Surprisingly through all this turmoil, my vonage box was working flawlessly. After much trial and error, there was a setting called 'NAT filtering' and I moved this from Secure to Open. Lo and behold (and after a factory reset of the modem), everything was working very well. The wireless connectivity has been pretty solid and both 2.4 and 5 work very well (and simultaneously) and I did not perceive any difference from v2.DLNA streaming of movies and music work fine. However, when I map the the hard drive, I barely get about 3MBps. I know that the hard drive is capable of about 20-30MBps. This was with a computer connected directly thro a gigabit switch (and thro' the router port as well). Poorly designed. In fact, I am moving the hard drive behind another computer simply because of this reason.

Router worked for around 6 months, then started to freeze, requiring a manual reboot. It will also often lose all the configuration, requiring you to reconfigure the router or restore a backup. Extremely annoying. I bought two of these units, the other one started failing after 9 months. I've owned NETGEAR products before which have caused issues but this will be my last.

column9: Avoid this product at all costs
column10: This router worked great for about six months and then suddenly the wireless signal dropped by about 90%. Dealing with Netgear customer support after the first 90 days is a nightmare. It is through emails and we have been exchanging emails for about a week now. It almost seems like they want to drag the case on and on and see if you go away. Meanwhile, I don't have wireless signal in my house. I would avoid any Netgear products.After a month of exchanging emails my problem still did not get resolved. I figured that the problem was with the faulty firmware version (1.0.0.32) that they released. They have since pulled this version out but those of us who have already upgraded are stuck. We cannot downgrade and my router has become very unstable. Avoid Netgear products.

Worked fine for a couple if months. Has been an absolute nightmare since then. Avoid this product at all cost.  It locks up frequently and its performance is also often poor.  On the occasions that it decides to behave and for brief moments after a factory reset it works great.  I wish I still had my 10 year old linksys.  It never gave me the headache this netgear has.

column9: Believe the one star reviews - this is a defective product
column10: I purchased this product on the optimistic hope that the four and five star reviews were the more representative. The product worked fairly well for about seven days. During that period, it required nearly daily rebooting due to loss of internet connectivity. On day eight, it lost connectivity altogether. Rebooting the router and the modem, reinstalling the firmware, and systematic step-by-step troubleshooting would not solve the problem. I have now reinstalled my seven year old Netgear router, which is working slowly but steadily. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. IT WILL WASTE HOURS OF YOUR TIME.

As other reviews have mentioned the 2.4ghz band will eventually drop out on this router. I purchased this in 2/2011 and it failed in 7/2012. They will not replace the router. I'll be looking for a new router now.

I bought this to replace a semi-ancient but very reliable Linksys WRT54G router.  Everything was easy to set up, which was nice... until it kept killing my long-lived SSH connections.  No rhyme or reason, the router would just drop the connection.  This was not good.  I ended up replacing this WNDR3700v3 with a used WNDR4000, which does not drop connections.Also note that this WNDR3700v3 is NOT compatible with DD-WRT or any (at the time of this writing) alternative firmwares.  Maybe that won't be so bad if you don't have long lived connections, but mine is sitting in a closet collecting dust.

Have had this router for 35 days and it suddenly died, have had to send it back to Netgear (postage paid by me). At this price I do expect better reliability than this.  Next router is not going to be a netgear.The performance is average, NAS storage is too slow to be of any use. Only saving grace is Netgear's setup interface is easy to use.

column9: Hate it! Drops the connection every 20-30 minutes
column10: I hate this router! Thought I was upgrading from my single band router. Boy was I wrong. I can't get anything done as the connection to the router is dropped about every 20-30 minutes. It does reset itself, but man is it completely annoying! There is no new firmware update either. DO NOT BUY THIS!

column9: Router arrived broken and Netgear support is the worst I've ever experienced
column10: Router arrived on time as promised, brand new in shiny box.  That was the last good thing about it.Fail #1: The instructions for setting up the router are pretty simple: 'plug in, wait for it to boot, navigate to its internal web page for configuration'.  Simple, right?  And it was, except the router refused to serve up the web page.  The connection to it (both WiFi and ethernet) was good, my computer was getting an IP address, I could ping the router, just couldn't do anything else.Fail #2: I called tech support, hoping I was doing something wrong or there is some magic they can recommend.  Good news: very little time on hold.  Bad news: they refused to help me until I registered the product by giving them my phone number, email address and other information.  Absolutely refused to do anything prior to that.Fail #3: After I finally registered, I got transfered to tech support.  10 minutes on hold, 15 minutes of support specialist having me go through troubleshooting steps (nothing I haven't tried myself already, but I do it again) and he tells me 'looks like the device is broken, you should go back to where you bought it and get it replaced.'  Not a 'we are overnighting you a replacement because we allowed a broken product to be sold to you,' not a 'what can we do to restore your faith in our company.'  I didn't want to wait for the back and forth with Amazon, so I asked for other options.  He had the audacity to offer me the option of Netgear overnighting me a replacement with ME HAVING TO PAY FOR SHIPPING.  His supervisor refused to make any further accommodations.Fail #4: Figuring I may have better luck with their Live Chat support, I gave that a shot.  Very quickly the agent recognized that the over the phone support specialist forgot to have me try a firmware upgrade over TFTP.  While working through the steps the session gets disconnected, and I have to start over with another rep.  This rep has absolutely no understanding of even basic technology!  He was clearly reading from a script, and his answers changed with each reading.  Finally I had to figure out myself what needed to be done, but of course the router is broken enough that it wouldn't even take the upgrade.To summarize; the router appears to be suffering from a very serious malfunction making it completely inoperable.  But what makes things 100 times worse is the incompetence of Netgear's support personnel and their clear disregard for their customers.I will never again buy a Netgear product, and this router is on its way back to Amazon.

column9: Netgear n600 wireless dual band touter
