column10: I just bought  this router last night and after read all the reviews from previous owner.  I scarred to own it now.  I am going to return this today.  Thanks for all you guys for the warnings.

I bought this router about a month ago without doing any kind of research prior to making the purchase, and i have learn my lesson. It was problematic right out of the box. Its signal is weak and it drops 10 to 20 times a day...NO JOKE!!! After buying it, I read reviews that warned against buying this router for the very same problem that is now happening to me. I'm tired of rebooting this piece of $#*^ every half hour, so im buying a different router today. however, I'm gonna do some research first.

It works great until I updated the firmware to V2 1.0.0.32 then all the device under same SSID could not communicate each other.the real upset thing is the netgear tech support, really lack of training. Horrible experience with its tech support. so don't buy it if you want buy one router. don't upgrade your router firmware if you bought one already.2013-05-09 update  2.4G radio was dead. life time is 14 months, 2 month after warranty.

column9: don't buy this if you have a Mac
column10: Unfortunately if you own a Mac you should not buy this product as it does not work if you are going to have a printer attached to the router

column9: Worst Customer Support of All Time
column10: I opened the box, plugged it in, and got the basic router functions working fine.  I plugged an external USB drive into the USB port, and attempted to get DLNA working.  No go.  I went to the web site, which didn't specifically address this feature anywhere, but I found a list of supported drives.  My drive was listed, good.  Went to the web, found some older posts that said I should reformat the drive for best results.  Copied off the files to a computer, reformatted drive.  Plugged the drive back in, no good.  8 hours wasted.  Searched the net for more information, played with every setting, no good.  Tried to get a support chat, not available (In the middle of a work day?).  Called customer support.  Spent over 1 and a half hours talking to the same person, pattern went:  Support question, 'Is box checked?'  Me: yes.  Please wait... annoying music for 5 minutes, Support question:  'Is box checked?'  Me: yes.  Will you hold?  8 times... 8 FREAKING times I got asked the same question and then put on hold.  Eventually, I got transferred to next level.  Support question: 'Is box checked?'  Me: YES.  Support question: 'Is this other box checked?' Me: I don't have a box like that.'  Please hold...  Two more times I got asked about a non-existing setting.  Then we went through what version of firmware (mine was the latest), and second level decided they were looking at the wrong router.  Third transfer.  'Is the box checked?'  Me: (strangled screaming) Then I probably said something about sending the thing back.  I did not swear, but I was not happy.I returned the router.  And that's where I would have left it.  Until today, when I got an email asking about the resolution of my support issue.  AHA!  I thought, they might actually care, so I followed the link, prepared to indicate what I thought they might have a problem.  A series of radio buttons, if you choose poor, you get additional options.  I chose poor, and the question said: 'Choose all that apply'.  To a set of radio buttons.  Of which you can only choose one.  And I realized:  This company does not care about customer support, they don't even care enough to make their survey work, and I decided to spend at least 3 hours today making sure other people have a chance to avoid these issues by selecting a different company to work for, since that is approximately the amount of time I've spent dealing with their customer nonsupport.

column9: Worked a couple of days. Warranty is a lie.
column10: Worked a couple of days. Reboot the entire time. I contacted Netgear and got email to check this and check that. Like it was my full time job to get this place of junk running. This still has not been resolved. Case number 21896580 says don't waste your money or time!

Not stable , keeps dropping connections. Bought new router and it is rock solid and fast. Save your money and look at another brand. To add insult to injury, Amazon will not take it back because it is over 30 days old. Missed the return window by 6 days.

Bought it refurbished, one week after the return policy ended it powered off. After talking with an independent router troubleshooting company, NETGEAR, and Amazon they all arrived at the same conclusion, it's dead. Have only had trouble with NETGEAR routers. Do not pass go, do not collect $200.

column9: hours of tech support from india
column10: Very hopeful about this router and loved previous netgear products. Hate to say it cause its cliche but i should have listened to the reviews. I figured there were just a couple bad ones out there since it had 4.5 stars but mine has been aweful. Works for about 5 minutes then has to be restarted. I spent hours on the phone with someone who i could barely understand and his solution was just unplug it and wait 30 seconds then plug back in. Litrally kept doing that for over an hour. Never got promised call backs ontime if at all. Second tech guy helped me install new firmware which didnt help one bit. Going back to store and getting something else.

column9: It keeps dropping the internet connection!!
column10: How do you sell a device that connects to the internet just fine and then dropsthe connection every 5 minutes? What a crappy product!

column9: One star because they won't let me use zero stars.
column10: Bought one on line, loved it for three days and it died, completely, no power whatsoever.  Returned it thinking it was a fluke, 10 days later new one died.  Flaws in construction, cheaply made, going back to Linksys.

Is this router fast? YesIs this router pretty? YesDoes it have a good range? YesGoes it have 5G tech? YesIs this router easy to setup and work? No, the management software has bugsIs it secure? NO.I can't disable the WPS service. I cracked my own password in 1 hour. This is a MAJOR security problem.On some netgear routers you can disable WPS but not on this particular one. Not even the manual accounts for that. It is very naive from netgear to do this. It is also enough reason for a 1 star review, here is why: If you do get hacked and people start doing illegal activities with your internet, you will see yourself in a pretty bad situation with the law.I am flashing the firmware to openWRT or ddWRT this weekend. Because the router hardware is pretty amazing, but as always, the software they put on it, its just plain s***EDIT:To add to the already bad review the router today I wanted to extend my DHCP ip pool from 2-200 to the full range (2-254). It would not let me do it saying some crap about being used by WAN. The funny thing was if I went to that page, changed NOTHING and hit apply, the error would show up anyways. Because of this I am changing the 'easy to setup' to no.

column9: terrible tech support for nonworking product
column10: Dropped signals  constantly, every 30 seconds. Called tech support. Spent 4 HOURS online with an agent who would not give me a higher level tech, who made the problem worse by changing settings so that even with an Ethernet cable, the router didn't work. I suggested re reset with the pin-in-the-hole method; he didn't.And my daughter looked at the log which stated service was blocked. The tech support person didn't even know where to find the log. Finally, got an RMA.Then My daughter checked a setting in the firewall, changed it, and now no drops. The tech support did not even ask about my firewall, even after we read the log to him. Very bad service.By the way, tech provider is not NetGear. It is IYogi and they take over your computer, then send endless emails with attachments to download. Be very careful of these people.Remember, I am only average tech knowledge but I was the one who reset the dang thing when he made it inoperable.ADVICE: Check your firewall settings, especially if using Kaspersky.Tech support told me he had to try at least 3 times and have failure before authorizing RMA. Nice for Netgear but certainly not customer oriented.Moreover, for Netgear to replace, I have to pay shipping back AND be without the router while they process everything. Otherwise, I have to pay for the new router. For expedited shipping, I also have to pay.

This item turned out to be a complete failure.  It worked great for a bit then just as we approach the 30-day return mark it decided to decrease it's signal reach then communicate with the cable modem any time it felt like it.As for returning it - I contacted the seller and Amazon.  I was told I could get a full refund by the seller and forwarded this information to Amazon.  I did not get a FULL refund.  I was told I would receive the cost of the item $60.99 MINUS a 'Restocking Fee Refund Deduction' of $12.20.  Restocking fee? For a defective item?  Never again will I bother.

Got the router in and it was a breeze to setup a guest network and an internal network.  This thing drops wireless connections constantly.  I can be in the same room with it and it will drop the connection to a laptop 5 times in 30 minutes.  This is a pain if you are trying to stream anything over the network.  I will be returning this and going back to my previous router that actually works.

I upgraded to this WNDR3700 router for the features it offered with USB hard drive connectivity. I find out that there are only 5 hard drives that Netgear tested and got to function with this thing, non of which I own, and I am not about to spend more money on another hard drive. Seems to me they should not have advertised this feature. For as long as Netgear has been in the technology industry, one would think they would be a bit further in their own technological advances.Customer service is of no help, they keep closing my cases and only apologize for my experience, but never for their deceitful advertising of a feature that is useless. I wouldn't really have a problem purchasing another drive, but the five listed suck or do not have the capacity I am looking for.Pro: It connects you to the internetcon:interface is nice, but can be confusing, even for someone who has a lot of experience setting routers up. Features are not what they are sold to be. ****Update**** the new interface, through the firmware update, is a little more complex and takes some getting use to. Finding your basic settings that you need to access right away takes more time to locate. It would be nice if you could modify, and add quick links or favorites to settings you access on a regular basis.Buy a Linksys/Cisco for less money!My apologies: It seems they updated their firmware, and their link with what hard drives work, but it is still a small list. I have a Seagate 1TB that doesn't work, neither does the WD and the Toshiba that I have.here is the link to the list: [...]*****UPDATE*********After some time using, I am glad to tell you that it has been reliable. One thing that has changed is that my printer was hooked up via USB, and I came to realize the other day that the printer is using the wireless connection and the router is not recognizing the printer through the USB ports on the router. Same issue still exists with the External hard drives. I wish they would have put 2 more Ethernet ports on it, instead of the useless USB ports. Tech support has failed to give me a satisfactory answer, outside of me buying more equipment that may, or may not work with this device.
Tried this as an upgrade to my N150. But the connection drop was too frequent. An hour after installation, I was left with no option, but to return.

column9: Crippled Device; Not worth the $199 I paid for it.
column10: *EDITED REVIEW* (Redid most of this)I've owned the first WNDR3700 (v1) since it was released. I work from home sometimes , so I have to remain 'On line all the time'. With that being said, I have a very extensive background in networking (TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, Layer2/3/4/7, switching, MPLS, etc), software engineering (asm/c/c++).This product is awful for reasons I cannot even begin to put on paper.- The help file never matches newer firmware updates (if you look at certain options they are missing from the right hand side help menu)- No support for High DBI antenna (external)- Limited IPv6 options:-- This doesn't support 6in4 tunnels with IPv6, whereas older linksys stuff does.- No jumbo frame support on the gig ports. (who ships a 'router' with gig ports and no jumbo frames?)- No VLAN support (really?)- No IPSec tunnel support- High CPU usage from large amounts of port saturation (non-WiFi, connected gig-e ports. With straight Layer2 I should be getting close to line rate but I can't even get 350mbit! Seems this is software switched.- Primitive firewall with bogus options.-- Synflood blocking is silly, because most synfloods that I know of are in the orders of magnitude higher than my ISP gives me.-- This router seems to send ICMP_PORT_UNREACHABLEs on firewall rulesets, potentially causing a backscatter attack with spoofed IPs.- Router reboots/clears all wifi endpoints on basic configuration changes- The lights on the router for the ports is backwards.There are others, but that is a showstopper for me.

Bought this to replace the original WNDR3700 which served well for 2 years but the wireless signal deteriorated all of a sudden.Installed this router exactly as described in the scant how-to document, everything appeared ok except the 2.4ghz signal was weaker than the 5ghz, and the signal kept dropping out every few minutes. The wireless signal range for both frequencies on the new router terrible, worse than the old router I was replacing.I could connect to the internet with two iPads, a Blackberry, but while I could connect my HP Pavilion laptop running Windows Vista to the router via wireless, I couldn't connect to the internet. Spent quite a few hours troubleshooting and just gave up. I went to the Netgear forums online and found some posts with exactly the same problem I have, but no solutions yet.Bought a new laptop running Windows 8, and can now connect via wireless to the Internet. But the RANGE ON THIS ROUTER IS REALLY, REALLY TERRIBLE. Seems almost like it needs to be in line of sight to work. I'm barely 15 feet away in another room and connection drops in & out. Signal doesn't cover my apartment which is about a 100 sq. ft.Very disappointed.

I felt I must share my first review with all prospective buyers. I bought the NETGEAR Wireless Router - N600 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR3700)router to update my outdated equipment that you lease from Comcast. I didn't buy the product from Amazon but at the local Best Buy. I got the router up and going the first day without much problems. I have a Toshiba laptop, Toshiba tablet, 2 Droid phones, wireless printer and a Play Station. Everything seemed to work fine for the first week. The signal quality definitely wasn't very strong as advertised. I was barely getting signal (1-2 bars) in my bedroom on the second floor unlike my old router but that wasn't the deal breaker. Sitting 10 feet away from the router only got 4/5 bars... Then the real problems started beginning after 4 weeks. Signal would drop continually and eventually I called customer support in India. 'Danny' said my firmware needs updating and he will help get it done quickly. Well and hour later we seemed to be back up and connected. Everything seemed fine again til the same problem started happening dropped signal, hard reboots and 3 more calls to India. Multiple hours trying to fix the problem. He blamed the Play Station is causing the conflict. He changed setting to make the router basically run at 54 mbps on one channel and said that should fix your problems. He was right but why did I buy a router with 300 mbps capabilities and run on 2 channels-my old Linksys has the same capabilities. I called customer service again questioning the new settings and wanting to talk to a supervisor. Well twice I was put on hold waiting for this supervisor and after 20 minutes I got disconnected... I called again, talked to customer service expressing my dissatisfaction with the whole experience and this time I was not put on hold. I was HUNG UP ON! Well I packed it up in the box and drop down to Best Buy. Well that was the best part of the experience was getting my money back. STAY AWAY FROM NET GEAR, THEIR POOR FIRMWARE AND THEIR TERRIBLE OUTSOURCED CUSTOMER SERVICE.

column9: I had to leave at least one star...WARNING, they do not actually give a lifetime warranty!!!!!!!
column10: I wish I could have left none. The router died in less than 12 months, stopped sending out a wireless signal, and then it wouldn't turn on. Plus, it says lifetime warranty, but you have to pay 30 dollars to get a replacement and you have to send your router back first before they will send you a new one. Oh, and they were going to send me a cheaper one. The customer service representative could barely speak English and he was frustrated that I couldn't understand him and he wasn't understanding me. HORRIBLE customer service. Plus, he was supposed to be tech support, but when I told him that I couldn't turn it on, he told me 5 times to just turn on the router, even though I told him it wouldn't turn on. I had to put my husband on the phone.As for the warranty, there are no refunds, they flat out refuse to refund, and you have to pay almost 50% of the cost of a new one to get a replacement. That's not a warranty, that's a rip off. I will NEVER buy another Netgear product ever again in my life.

column9: QUIT WORKING AFTER 4 1/2 MONTHS - 5 stars down to 0 stars = only 30 days warranty really?
column10: UPDATE 1/7/13 - 4 1/2 MONTHS AFTER PURCHASE = QUIT WORKINGThe damn thing quit working on 1/4/13. I received this router on 8/22/12 - that's 4 1/2 months. I called my internet company and a technician came today 1/7/13, he upgraded my internet modem, and turned out what was wrong with my internet was the damned router had quit working properly! The thing now only gives full speed only if I'm sitting within ONE FOOT (~18.54Mbps download),but if I am as little as *14 FEET* away from the router the download speed drops to 4Mbps); at 16 feet distance = signal disappears completely. I tried resetting to factory settings, checked the cables, everything, the thing just stopped working. I will never ******* buy from Netgear again.UPDATE 11/22/12:I'm bumping the rating from 4 stars back to 5 stars. It's been 2 months 3 weeks since I purchased this router - and still - not a single dropped signal since I updated the firmware! The speed is good (130Mbps) when <=50 feet from router. I haven't yet learned how to get higher speed but I'm happy with this speed. This router is very reliable and I'm extremely happy with it because it is reliable and fast and gives 0 dropped signals!-------- This router gets 4/5 stars for two reasons:1) Range: at 50+ feet the speeds are halved (go from 130Mbps to 65Mbps or even less).2) Out of the promised 600Mbps I only get 130Mbps (within 50 feet of router).*I've had this router for 10 days. If anything happens I'll update my review for you all to know.*Within 50 feet my two laptops get 130Mbps speeds; but the desktop gets 1.0Gbps speed (directly connected to this router).*I needed a new router to use as a bridge/access point to expand the range in my home because my four-year-old WNDR3300 v1's range was the same (only good if < 50 feet from router).*Within a few minutes I successfully connected my refurbished WNDR3700 v2 to my old WNDR3300 v1 and now I have faster speeds and my range was doubled (two routers = 100 feet range at max speed). Now I have two routers connected to my home network!*I'm able to edit the settings of both routers (routerlogin.com in web browser). (Example: to edit Router #1 I just have to log into that network and I can edit it in routerlogin.com, and to edit Router #2 I just have to log into its network and then I can edit it in routerlogin.com).*I got lucky and got v2 - only v1 & v2 are supported for dd-wrt firmware, while v3 is not yet supported.*The firmware it came with eventually (after one day) led to dropped signals but ever since I updated the firmware I have not experienced any dropped signals! It has been ONE MONTH since I got the router and no dropped signals within 50 feet and rarely when further than 50 feet from router.*WNDR3300 v1 speed: 54.0Mbps speeds*WNDR3700 V2 speed: 130.0Mbps (maximum should be 600Mbps) = this is why I'm giving it 4/5 stars - because I'm not getting the promised speed. I need to google how to get more speed out of my routers.*The description should state which version it is selling. I got v2 but another reviewer got v3. If you're considering installing dd-wrt, you should contact the seller first and ask to get v1 or v2.*I received my order in three days.*I received WNDR3700 v2 (there exist three versions)*I've owned a WNDR3300 v1 (only version ever released) for over four years and I'm very happy with it. The last firmware released 3+ years ago fixed the signal dropping problem and I have NEVER had a dropped signal ever since! It is an extremely reliabble router and I love it. It also supports dd-wrt firmware.*I bought the WNDR3700 because it has faster speeds and range, but primarily to expand the range of my home network.---There are two methods for connecting two routers to the same home network.*Method #1: change the IP address of the second router to prevent interference and connect the second router to the first router - done. (E.g.: Router #1 = 192.168.1.1 ; Router #2 = 192.168.1.2). I followed this guide called 'How to Connect Two Wireless Routers Together' by Amit Agarwal.*Method #2: requires installing the dd-wrt firmware. I did not follow this method but if you wish to follow then google how to do it.I bought this router specifically also because two of the three versions are supported for dd-wrt, so I figured, if method #1 didn't work, then I could have method #2 as plan B. But I'm glad method #1 worked because it was so quick and easy. Method #2 has the risk of 'bricking' your router if the instructions are not followed correctly. For now I'll stay with the stock firmware and if I'm unhappy I can always change to the dd-wrt firmware, but I doubt I will need to.I'll update my review to report back on if signal ever drops, reliability, speed, etc.UPDATE 9/17/12:It has been one month since I got this router and I am extremely happy with it. When within 50 feet the signal NEVER drops. When further than 50 feet the signal RARELY 'hangs'. But it's super rare. In the ONE MONTH I've had the router it happened like 3x while I was further than 50 feet but I fixed it simply by logging out from the network and re-connecting to it - simple and quick.When within 50 feet the signal has never dropped.I'm so glad I bought this router to double my home range.  - I'll update my review in the future again ^^.

column9: Terrible - Signal drops, firmware buggy and frequent restart required
column10: I've owned several wireless routers including Linksys, Buffalo and Apple models over the years. This is by far the worst. The firmware is buggy. Wireless signals frequently fade, clients are regularly dropped (even at full signal strength) and the router requires frequent restarts. Traffic is frequently blocked between devices (NAS, printer, laptops, etc) until the router is restarted.  Customer support is also substandard. Stay away.
I sell servers for living. But I could not get the WIFI to work. I have an older Netgear that works fine. I say AVOID this router at all cost.

I thought that I was getting a high-end home router. Instead, I have a router that causes me nonstop aggravation. The wireless connection gets disconnected randomly, I've had to power cycle three times in four days, and setup was a hassle. Every small change in configuration disconnects all the computers while the settings are being applied. On the other hand, the very reason that I bought it- to get QoS for torrent downloads, isn't doing its job. I'm probably going to go back to the old D-Link I had before. In short: if you're considering spending top dollar for a great router, get the other one.

update 8/10/2012Hello Netgear Team - I actually still have this router.  It wasn't an option to return it to Amazon as it was past the time it was allowed.I'm willing to work with you guys on this reliability issue.  My firmware version is V1.0.0.22_1.0.17 which the router SW thinks is the latest and greatest (ie no new updates available).4 SSIDs being used (broadcasted, in other words not hidden)2 on 2.4 GHz (primary + guest) w/ WPA2-PSK security2 on 5.0 GHz (primary + guest) w/ WPA2-PSK securityIssue is around wireless AP, no issues on wired interfaces-----Bought this back in February 2012.  Made sure router had latest and greatest firmware.  Tons of reliability issues from (1) connection drop outs (2) unable to connect and (3) throughput from iPhone4, iPhone 4s, iPad 2nd gen and Mac Book Pro (mid 2012 model).  Problem shows up on either 2.4GHz or 5GHz using private or guest network.  Worst router ever had and paid big bucks for it ($99)!

column9: Constant lock ups and the wifi eventually died
column10: My previous internet setup was a combined modem and router but in December 2011 I finally split into a separate pair, and this Netgear formed the Wifi router part of my network. The setup was relatively straightforward and the admin pages are fairly easy to navigate. I was able to get it up and running within a few minutes and all my wired and wireless devices hopped on without any problem. The guest network was nice too for visitors. So for the first few weeks it seemed to work without too much issue but then the problems started - online gaming would report locked down 'strict' or 'limited' access, wifi would drop out, wired devices would drop their network connections. At least once a week it would need a hard power-off reboot. Speeds were wildly variable on the wired part of the network, despite being hardwired into a 24-port gigabit switch. I struggled along with it until July 2012 when I woke up one morning to discover a super high-pitched whine coming from the unit and it had no Wifi. The status lights indicated the Wifi was on, as did the setup pages, but sniffing for Wifi using InSSIDer (wifi snooper software) revealed the unit was not broadcasting even a carrier signal. Netgear's support is awful and their phone lines go to India where 'Bob' can't understand a word you say. They only have a 90-day warranty so anything beyond that and you're paying to even get an RMA number for returns. What I essentially understood was that I could send the unit back to them but I'd get a refurb unit in return. Which I'd have to pay for.I run IT for a couple of small stores and am pretty knowledgeable about network hardware but I've never come across a router that's fried itself so quickly. Very disappointed with Netgear's support and their product in general. I think I'll pass on their devices in future - one of their 5-port desktop switches failed on me last month so that's two products in two months. #fail.

I was really happy with this router for about two years.  Good speed, gigabit, decent UI.Updated to the latest manufacturer firmware (V1.0.7.98NA), and now I literally have to be within 2 feet of the router to get a wireless signal.  Absolutely unacceptable.Worse, based on *dozens* of bad reviews on Netgear support, I have no faith in getting it replaced via RMA, or that the replacement won't just abruptly stop working one day either.  I imagine I'll go with Asus, and not buy Netgear again.  Just not worth the risk.

column9: Can't tell if you're getting a v1, v2, or v3. Probably v3.
column10: Most reviews about the WNDR3700 refer to the first or second revisions. All those reviews are now invalid, because the third revision is completely different. No hardware inside the router is the same between the first two revisions of the WNDR3700 and the third revision.This is especially difficult for me, because I want to install specific software on the router. If I order it, I can't tell whether I can install the software until I receive the router. But I probably can't, because I'll probably get a third revision WNDR3700.
Pros: Was easy to setupCons: Unusable more then 1 room away. Even when in direct site of router, Signal would drop one bar per 10 feet.Returned to vendor, currently waiting on refund.

column9: After all this time.  It's just very unreliable.
column10: Without committing too much more of my time to Netgear.  I'll just say, like many others before me...This router drops you at least once a week. It doesn't care which OS you're running. It's just plain buggy.  Netgear should apologize to service providers everywhere for greatly hindering everyone's network connection.Bummer. >: |1 star for the price vs reliability.

This is my second Netgear Router.  However, this one ($80+) lasted less than six months and then told me I had an IP address conflict.  Netgear tech support told me that free support was only for a 90-day period and they wanted to bill me for support to fix the problem.  I'm tossing my Netgear Router and purchasing one from a more reputable company.
Had a lot of issues trying to get this unit to work in wireless repeater function with a WNDR3700v1. Returned it for the headache. Running DD-WRT now on the V1.

When I was ordering, throughout the order, there was never a hint nor display that said Refurbished. I came to know that only when I received it. While ordering I was damn careful looking for hidden information. Word Refurbished was not anywhere and now I felt I was completely cheated. 2.4 GHz gives 4 out of 5 bars within 20 feet. 5 GHz gives only 1 bar. Be careful with this product.
the range is poor, nothing in my house stays connected unless its right next to the router.No user friendly to set up.  I will buy another, different brand.

Bought this router new and hooked it up to a SB6121 Motorola modem.....never could get it to work, even after three hours on phone with a very nice person from tech support. End result was a defective router that has to be returned. My previous LINKSYS was a breeze to install and worked well for a long period before giving up the ghost. I think I'll spend a few more bucks this time around and go back to LINKSYS.

Bought it in November, and slowly the signal decreased in strength, speeds dropped, gaming consoles and laptops disconnected, and finally, a firmware update destroyed it. Different updates dont fix it. Emailed Netgear and got ignored. This is the last time i get a Netgear router. When it worked at first, this thing FLEW. Xbox live was great and lag-free. PC internet speed was magnificent. Video streaming from Netflix was flawless. The Netgear web interface was not bad at all. But it failed the test of time. Poor Netgear customer service too.EDIT: I was still under warranty and sent the dead unit in to netgear for a replacement. Got a refurbed unit. Works just like the first day i got it. Speed test shows that my Asus black diamond router performs 1 megabyte faster than the n600.

I bought this product on4/18/2012 from Amazon.com.  It failed on6/17/2012.  On 6/18/2012, I called NetGear to report the failure.  The lady I talked to could resolve the problem but said some one would call me within 24 hours.  I have not been called and no action has been taken to fix or replace the item.  If they do call I plan to demand a refund.

column9: Good Until I Needed Technical Support
column10: I purchased this router to replace an old Belkin 'G' unit.  Getting the new unit set up was pretty simple.  All of our laptops and other wireless devices worked very well with this router, improved speed, network coverage, video streaming, etc.  After one year and four months the router stopped working.  I called Netgear Technical Support for assistance.  They told me that my phone support expired 90 days from the date of purchase.  They would help me as soon as I agreed to pay them $ 79.99 for a six month warranty extension.  I explained to the person I was speaking with that I could purchase the same exact router for$ 94.00.  He could not understand why I would not pay the $ 79.99 to extend that warranty on my current unit.After ending the call with Netgear I hooked up my old Belkin router.  I needed some assistance completing the installation.  I called Belkin for assistance.  I told them that I had purchased the router several years ago.  They were more than willing to assist, at NO CHARGE.... The technician had the expertise needed to get me back up and running in a short period of time.  He was very polite, many 'please' and 'thank you' comments during the call.  Outstanding Customer Service!In the near future I will be replacing the Belkin router.  I liked the performance of the Netgear.  Unfortunately I cannot be loyal to a company that, in my opinion, is not loyal to their customers.
I try had to make it work but it never... sad about itThe lights dont go green, only red

Sending this back as I could not get the router to work with Charter. Modem connected fine. Thus, Charter wasn't able to help. Spent an hour with Netgear tech support who was unable to resolve the issue. (However, the tech guy did suggest that for $100 he could tell us how to make the router work. Apparently we used up all the free time.) Very surprised that an 'easy 1-2-3 install' could not be accomplished by Netgear tech support. Will try a different brand.

column9: Fine for web browsing, but NOT for professionals
column10: I bought this router to replace my old Linksys WRTG router. I figured, it's a $100 router, it must be good! Using it with Vista and Windows 7, there's something wrong with the router's ability to process packets. It's fine for web browsing where it's OK to re-send requests a lot, but for things like connecting to NASes or FTPing files, it constantly drops and fragments packets. NAS communication is SLOW (3mb/sec) and stuttering. You'll get constant timeouts communicating with FTP servers. All my problems went away when I switched back to the WRTG, so I'm sure it's the router's fault.On top of that, the admin website for the router is poorly laid out, and makes things like finding where to change the MTU a pain. If you know what MTU stands for, do yourself a favor, and don't buy this router. It's so not worth the money. Go with a Linksys instead.

column9: I will never buy another Netgear product again.
column10: I have been struggling with this router for the past 6 months.  Dropped signals.  The router not even showing up to connect.  There are forums filled with people with problems with this device.  I even bought a Netgear repeater to fix the problems.  Didn't work, and kept dropping the signal with the router reviewed here.Netgear said they'll troubleshoot it if I pay them to do so.Instead of taking that step, I plugged in my girlfriend's 3 year old Linksys router.  No more problems.  4 bars from the same spot the Netgear router wouldn't even show up.

I purchase this router in September.  All was fine until a couple months ago when the router's signal started deteriorating. Now the signal is so weak, I have to be in the same room to connect.  Netgear has a 1 year warranty on parts and labor, but only 90 days on Technical Support.  Since I have a Bachelor Degree in Business Information Systems, I troubleshooted the problem as being a defective router. (A known issue with this router).  Support told me instead of getting an RMA, I need for Netgear to troubleshoot the problem first.  He also, that the troubleshooting cost $39.95 per half hour of support.  I said, I know it is defective and give me an RMA.  He said policy is to do tech support first.  I said, go ahead and troubleshoot, I am not going to pay $39.95 each half hour for you to tell me it is defective, what type of scam is Netgear running.  Bottomline, they are not honoring their warranty by forcing people to pay for tech support, they don't need.Stay away.Update, after trying to get help over the phone, it looks like you can get help with the router through email/written support.  The customer service reps never mentioned this option to me in the beginning.  They wanted to push their phone tech support that cost money.  It actually looks like Netgear turned their phone tech support over to a third party and they are trying to make the callers use their service at $39.95 every half hour.So if you have a problem after the first 90 days, use the email tech support system if you don't want to pay for phone support. Email support was able to verify what I told them, that my router radio signals were defective.  I have gotten the RMA and I should have a working router shortly (I hope).

After having a previous Netgear N600 version that I used for over a year, I decided to give it to a family member, and upgrade my N600 to this new version.I was very disappointed from the performance of this router. I've experienced many connection failures! The range was also poor. eventually I have decided to return it and have bought a Lynksis instead.

column9: Flimsy construction, unreliable connections, toss it!
column10: This netgear router was a huge disappointment. I admit to being stupid and getting overimpressed by the lofty talk on the box, but it never worked well. The 'Max' range was extremely unimpressive, and nothing was ever fast about it. Then a middling-to-mediocre router got bad. It started dropping connections and restarting itself at odd intervals. I got fed up and, in a moment of desperation, started rooting around in my closet and found a linksys router (wrt54g) that had been gathering dust under some sandals for 3 years or more. When I had thrown it in there, it had felt like any other piece of cheap plastic equipment, but after dealing with the netgear this thing felt as solid as a rock! And it worked like a champ. I probably wouldn't have been grumpy enough to write this review if not for the obvious superiority of the far older router.

first 2weeks, it worked fine, reliable- but then started to lost internet connection 1~2 times per hour.4th week now, it is like a hell-bad connection, truely unstable device.wanted to return it but can't due to the policy... bad, very bad.
v1 and v2 supported DD-WRT, but the new v3 is completely different.  Inside, it's basically a WNDR4000 with one less antenna.  Do not buy -- not worth the hassle.  Go with an Asus.

I was excited about having the capabilities stated by this device. It was the most unruly router I have ever 'used'. Tried to use; that is. The console would log me out when navigating from screen to screen. The performance was horrible on either band and would only sometimes actually navigate to a webpage. Constant disconnects between computers on the lan; wired and wireless. The usb functionality was nearly unusable. I am amazed that there are any good reviews for this device.

Netgear routers are horrible. if you like calling customer service and talking to a dude in India then trying to be sold a service plan that will end up costingmore than the router then buy products from Netgear. They are horrible.

The DNS server crashes continuously and the router needs to be restarted over and over again. The hardware is worse than version 2, which was good because it allowed installation of custom firmware. Now it is impossible, you have to stay with the company's firmware, which is plainly bad. I returned the item after struggling with it for 2 days. Waste of time and nerves. Avoid.

I did a lot of on-line research, and many reviews had very positive comments on Netgear products and related support. Decided to buy two of these for separate locations. Initially, everything was as advertised. Set-up was easy. Performance was good. However, a few months into using these the performance began to degrade and frequent reboots were required (one began behaving like this at 6 months and the other at 8 months). When the first device began to experience problems I contacted Netgear Support. This was a miserable experience!!! The first two techs could not help me and directed me to premium support. The person in premium support said that if I signed up for $75 he would give me the URL to download new firmware, which he assured me would address the issue. Against my better judgement, I went ahead and signed up - this seemed like a ridiculous amount of $$ given the prescribed fix, but I was in a jam.... After giving me the URL the line was disconnected. Given that the support center is in India, they had preemptively asked me to give them two numbers (primary + backup) so that they could contact me in case of a disconnect. I waited, but they did not call me back. I then downloaded the firmware myself and it did not remedy the issue. I then called my credit card company to cancel payment on the $75 fee. A WEEK later I received a call from the hostile support tech who did NOT help me. He complained that he'd called me back - he had not done so - and that he'd provided me the URL and didn't understand why I requested a refund. Bottomline, if you're expecting a high quality product and courteous and competent technical support, do NOT go with Netgear. I will never buy one of their products again.

I spent a lot of time making sure that I picked the right router.  It worked fine at first.  The setup was easy - that's what I liked about these routers.After about a month, I would begin to see dropped packets via a game I played online.  One here, one there.... it was just a change to what I had been seeing while playing.... guess it was beginning to break at that time.A few days ago the packets loss was intense.  OK, I thought it was my internet provider... and passed on it.Tonight, I got home and the wireless connections would not work right.  Wired connections were working, but were not going very fast.  I tried everything..........  swapped out wireless adapters... still not good.  Shut off devices.......  did a factory reset........ still no good.Finally, I put took out this router and replaced it with another older router... All is well now.  Yup, the router went bad.........after 60 days.I will see if I can return it.  I will get a different brand, though.BTW, the router was not moved since I had set it up.  It had plenty of air to keep it cool... and, in fact, it was not very warm at all when I pulled it out.  Yes, I used the same power adapter for the 'old' one.... so, the power was OK.So, it's back to the reviews to find a replacement.
AVOID this product - after a brief period customer service starts charging per call.It is impossible to connect device on your own without them - very complicated.

column9: Does not last, horrible customer support
column10: I did not buy this product from Amazon but another online retailer. I felt compelled to share my experience with this company with other would be buyers.I bought this router on January 19th and it quit working on March 12th, maybe just a bad one, it happens. It was past the 30 days for NewEgg to replace so I was referred to NetGear to fix the problem and that's when my problems really started. They said they would replace it but it would take 2 weeks or 24 hrs if I would agree to pay them $30. Well we argued this point to a standstill. So I was to wait to hear from their customer service department (surprised they call it that) on an approval of a next day replacement minus the $30 bucks.....it never came so here I sit almost a week has gone by and still no replacement or one on the way.I recontacted NetGear about the status of my replacement and not to my supprise they have not done anything on it. So here I wait on a call or email from NetGear that I am sure will never come. Meanwhile no wireless in my house until NetGear replaces their defective product or I suck up the loss of the purchase price of this router and buy a new one (not from these folks). My advice, don't buy any NetGear products unless you a have the patience of a saint.

There is an inherent problem with this router.  The 2.4Ghz range stopped working 3 months after the warranty expired. I started to search for a fix and found out on the Netgear forums that this is a very common if not systematic problem with this router. Those fortunate enough to have this happen while under warranty Netgear would only replace the units with a 'refurbished' model.  They wouldn't consider giving me one for their faulty router. I really thought Netgear would stand behind their product since they clearly knew this was a recurring problem with this model. Don't buy.

Set up went pretty well and things seemed good. Then the box began rebooting itself every 1-3 hours. Support suggested power problems. While this may seem logical, their recommendation made no sense: Bypass the UPS and plug it directly into the wall, 'Just to see what happens.' Same problem.I replaced the box with another N600 from another store in the theory that that bad box gets through once and a while. Same problem.I dumped the 2nd box and bought a Zoom X7N at half the price and have no problems with it at all.

column9: DLNA does not work as advertised
column10: While the router functions fine, the DLNA media serving does not work on this router as advertised. It is a long-standing problem that Netgear basically refuses to fix. There is a very short list of compatible external hard drives that work with the router. If you are considering this router primarily for its DLNA server, you'd probably be best served going to a different product.

This router is not worth your time. Net gear routers are terrible. I know cause I've had five of them hoping the next gen would be better. I bought this one cause of the DLNA feature, which is next gen tech. If you don't know about DLNA, let me give you a brief description. It allows you to stream media content from your media storage to other devices with DLNA tech, such as your tv or tablet thru wifi. I have over 100 media files on my media storage and it only shows me four files. I thought it was compatibility issues with the my hard drive so I did some digging and found out that net gear knows about this problem and has not been able to solve the issue with a simple firmware upgrade. Once again another bad product from netgear, which will be my last netgear device.

I bought the Netgear 6000 in 6/2011 and have had 2 problem cases since then. The last case drove me to write this review.  After a couple of days of puzzling over why I could connect to the internet but not browse, I finally determined, with excellent help from my ISP (TW RR Cable), that DNS was failing with the Netgear router. So I called Netgear support expecting to get a simple software update.  After going through a long ID and problem verification session, the tech finally got me to a file to be downloaded.  The tech told me to call back after completing the download for instructions on how to finish the problem fix.  Of course when I called back, I got another support person who seemed to have no information about my case, even though I had a case number, and he had to run me through the same ID and problem verification as before.  Then when I thought I was finally going to get instructions on what to do with the downloaded file, the support person noticed that I was beyond the 90 day free support period and refused to proceed further.  Instead, he passed me to a third person who had to get all my personal and product ID information all over again. I didn't realize it then, but this third person's job was just to sell a support service plan, and the cheapest plan he offered was a 6 month plan for $79.99. By this time I was so fustrated and anxious to get to a solution that I overlooked the fact that I could have bought a new router for less, and I made the mistake of giving the guy a credit card number.  I was also mistaken to think that he would then proceed to explain what to do with the downloaded file.  No, instead he gave me a new case number and passed me to yet another person who also needed to know who I was and what the problem was with my router. By then my patience had run out and my voice was pretty loud so she dumped me off to still another person who seemed to have gotten the idea that something actually needed to be done. But first he wanted me to reconnect the router to my computer, since I had been by-passing the router with a direct wire to the modem.  And while I was doing that, he hung up!  I am now trying to get my credit card company to cancel the $79.99 charge.  I do not want to deal with Netgear again, ever!

Works really good, haven't had any problems with itand it's really easy to use. I never had problems with Netgear and always will trusted the company. ( I used it for 2 months and working on it to get different one. It over heats ( heats up like crazy just by using one pc while watching movie, doing work online  or even playing game after awhile you will be lagging, more than 2 pc its cutting speed by 50%. I have to restart it like 15 times a week and had to do restore it like 6 times. Test on T1 and T3 network at work it will drop connection because it over heats or it will lose speed more than half. This router cant handle basic Comcast network it says can handle gigabit FALSE.)

column9: Worked for 12 months, then 2.4GHz range dropped to 10 ft
column10: This worked OK for about 12 months, then a few days ago with no changes to the network, or to devices accessing network, etc, the 2.4GHz signal range dropped down to about 10 ft. The device has to be in the room where the router is located to connect to the 2.4GHz network - what is the point of Wi-FI? The firmware is the latest version, tried cycling power several times with no luck. Interestingly, the 5GHz signal is fine, but not all devices support 5GHz (iPhone, iPod, etc do not). This seems to be relatively common issue - lots of people have posted about this on the Netgear Support Forums. Here is the link to this topic on the WNDR3700 discussion forum: [...]As far as I can tell, there is nothing that can be done to fix this issue.My recommendation is to stay away from this and other Netgear products.

column9: It was nice while it worked
column10: I got this router about 18 months ago.  It was easy to set up and worked well....at first.  For the past 3 months I've had problems with it dropping internet connections.  Connections to the router itself always worked fine, but the router could not maintain a consistent connection to the internet through our cable modem.  At first, I had to reset the modem and router once a week...then it was once a day....then multiple times per day.Earlier this week, I reset the router back to factory specs and it worked great....for two days.  Then, back to dropping internet connections multiple times per day.  Today I spent time on the phone with Netgear support, who had me download a new beta version of the firmware to install.  The install failed.  After that I couldn't connect to the router at all.  When I tried to set the router up from scratch using the CD that came with it, the setup program couldn't detect the router.  It's now a brick.  I've put my old Linksys back into service for the time being until I can find a more reliable brand.

I went through several of these both version 1 and 2.  Both can't give my device a ip address.  Also it's no wonder that this company releases so many firmware updates and hardware revisions.  It's because they can't make a product that works.  Stay clear Netgear!!!

My 4 months old WDNR 3700 N600 router suddenly lost range . One has to be within 6 feet to connect. This problem is well documented on forums. Beware of their scam. The product has ' 1 year hardware warranty' BUT in order to claim warranty, you have to pay $99.00 if you are out of the 90 days 'service warranty' in order to get customer service to diagnose your problem and claim warranty. This is the cost of the modem itself. In essence, this router is warrantied for 90 days only, any additional warranty will cost you the price of the product itself thus doubling the cost of your router. One often get 90 days warranty on refurnished items NOT new ones.  This tells you how little confidence they have in their product. Forget asking for supervisor phone numbers as they all lead to the same person that frustrates you even further. I went through the 'i will transfer your call' routine many times only to get told I have to spend more money.  I will junk this new router and will NEVER ever look at netgear product again.

column9: Turned into a brick after 5 days
column10: bought this model based on a blog post i read online singing its praises because i had moved and needed more range and speed (previous router was limited to N on 2.4GHz and signal was weak).the N600 was fabulous for 5 days until one night my wife asked, 'where's the wireless network?'  the router was just sitting there with 2 solid amber lights.  keep in mind that i did not do any sort of tweaking of the settings--just stuck to the 'basic' setup pages to set SSID and security.  on initial boot up it was connected to the internet and it ran through its firmware auto-update process and successfully downloaded and flashed the updated firmware.after several factory resets (holding the reset button, 30/30/30 cycling), nothing helped.  even tried using the CD that came with the router but those 2 amber light just stayed lit and never turned green and i couldn't even connect to it via ethernet.my time is too valuable to spend hours on the phone with tier 1 tech support for a unit that was clearly defective so i returned it.recommendation--before buying, read through the 1-star reviews for these newer router models for reports of problems such as the one i encountered.
Love the USB feature and this router worked great for 8 months.  Now it regularly drops our wireless connections.  It's very frustrating.

column9: Refurbished with no Serial Number, No Support
column10: Amazon sends me a refurbished router, rather than a new one. I wouldn't mind, but the refurbished router comes with no install disc. No worries - I can just download the install software using the serial number. Oh wait, Amazon also peeled off the serial number, so I have a router I have no software to set up, no manual, and no way to connect to the internet.Thanks for a deceptive product description and a useless product.

column9: Won't handle Canon Wi-Fi printer, and good luck with Netgear support!
column10: All was well till I bought a new Canon Wi-Fi all-in-one printer (model Pixma MX882). This router will not maintain a wi-fi connection with that printer for longer than around 15 minutes after printing the last page. To restore the wi-fi connection with the router, you have to either power cycle the printer, or on the printer control panel switch it temporarily to wired LAN, then back to wireless.Is this a Canon flaw or a Netgear flaw? Canon will tell you if you have ANY other wireless device in your home, that device will 'steal the IP address of the printer.' No, that makes no sense, and even if you disable every wireless device in your home, it won't solve the problem. Canon then will tell you it's a Netgear problem. Well - at least Canon support is free and their call center is in Virginia.Then we come to Netgear, who, as countless people have observed, charge for support after 90 days. They are very, very efficient at processing support calls, with usually no hold times - of course not, they charge for those calls, which presumably discourages a large percentage of callers into hanging up immediately. They collect a ton of fees from the remaining callers, more than enough to pay for the efficient call centers. Heck - for what they charge for these support calls you could easily buy a brand new budget 'n' router.Netgear promised me if they could not solve my problem, they would refund my $39.99 single-incident support fee.Need I say Netgear could also not solve the problem? The had me try a half dozen things, none of which helped. But they would not refund my money. Every time I tried to get my money back, they connected me to an engineer who either went through the same steps with me again, or explained to me that since my Roku worked wirelessly, there must be nothing wrong with my router, and therefore it must be a Canon problem.Finally on 12/19/11 I reached a supervisor who agreed to a refund of the support fee. I was told his name was 'Kiruba,' but he identified himself as 'Mike.'On 1/9/12 as the refund had not come through, I called again. I was promised the refund would be coming, and that the refund department would contact me by both email and phone with 24-48 business hours.On 1/17/12 I called again - no refund had appeared and their refund department never contacted me. Now I was told, by 'Alexander,' that though he sees I was promised a refund, nothing was done to actually process it, so he would start the refund process and have the refund department contact me with 24-48 hours. He also said I could not have been promised they would contact me by phone and email, since they have no ability to call anyone and can only make contact by email.It is now 1/23/12. I have never heard from the refund department nor received a refund, and do not expect to ever hear from them or receive a refund.So, as I promised Netgear I would, I am making the story public here. And of course I will be initiating a credit card dispute.Beware of Netgear tech support. They don't try many different solutions, and can probably only help you solve the same simple problems you can find answers to on the web or in their user guide. Their most efficient skill is charging your credit card, and they are very good at promising refunds they never issue.By the way, on my own I eventually found a way to keep the wi-fi connection to the printer stable, but don't know if it's a good long term solution. If you want your Canon Wi-Fi printer to maintain its connection to this Netgear router, you have to disable the router QoS feature called WMM (Wi-Fi multimedia) on the 2.54 Ghz band that the Canon connects to. Once you do this, the Canon connection will be 100% stable indefinitely. Is there a bug in the Netgear implementation of WMM? Or a Canon bug? How should I know? Neither of these companies even suggested looking at this feature.WMM is presumably useful for things like streaming video and audio, and you'll find web pages that say 'never, ever turn it off.' Some pages will say 'if you turn it off, your 'n' router will drop down to 'g' speeds.' I haven't encountered any problems with it off, but don't feel good about disabling it, and wish there was more information published about this feature that consumers could understand. I may eventually revert to a wired LAN connection for my printer, so that I can safely re-enable the WMM feature.Don't expect to be able to use this router with a wi-fi printer - certainly not with a Canon printer. Not unless you are willing to take your chances on this WMM setting.I would advise everyone to buy a router from a company that offers free support at least while the router is in warranty. I know I will not be buying anything from Netgear in the future.EDIT: Netgear responded to my review below. I emailed them as they requested. They did not respond to my email. I gather they were unhappy about my review, but cannot actually do anything to assist me, technically or in terms of a refund of the fee - which is more or less what I've already observed about Netgear support. Perhaps the person responding meant well but ran into internal roadblocks, I don't know. My bank's credit card dispute resolution department resolved this in my favor.

ITEM DID NOT HAVE VERSION NUMBER, HOWEVER I MOVED ON BY TRYING TO DOWN LOAD SOFTWARE FROM NETGEAR. THERE IS NO SERIAL NUMBER. CALLED TECK SUPPORT, THE UNIT IS REFURBISHED, NOT NEW. AMAZON SITE SAID NEW. WILL RETURN THIS TOMORROW. AMAZON WAS VERY GOOD ON THE RETURN, I DO NOT HAVE TO PAY FOR SHIPPING. THE INSIDE BOX HAD A LABEL STATING IT WAS NEW.

This is my first netgear product since 2003 when they shipped buggy routers that Flooded University of Wisconsin Internet Time Servers costing the state thousands of dollars. I figured after almost 10 years, they may have improved a bit. At first it seemed to work well. Signal and range were decent. Features were decent. I hooked it up in an environment of about 14 wireless devices (computers, ipads, etc). After about 3 weeks devices started randomly disconnecting from the network.  I wasn't sure it was the router until i noticed my devices showing up as 'Wired connections' when they were really wireless. If you can connect an iPad via a wired ethernet connection, lemme know, but that's what this thing said was happening. Tried multiple resets, firmware upgrades, etc. None of this solved the problem. I'd send it back for a replacement but Netgear's support has been difficult to get any kind of support from (Is your device plugged in?).To rule out interference from the neighbors or stray RF, I decided to get a comparable Cisco model. If that exhibited the same problems, then its not a router problem. It worked flawlessly, and continues to do so after a week. If I plug the N600 back in, I get the same issues within hours.I guess its true: You'll never get fired for going Cisco. I'm sticking with the E1000.

This is my 3rd Netgear wireless router - so I've been a fan of Netgear routers so I purchased a refurbished Netgear router (WNDR3700v2)  First the item arrived with the setup cd just floating around in the box - it was all scrathed up and didn't work, so I used the wizard to do my setup.  I was experiencing issues with the WNDR3700v2 connecting to some of my devices  (the newer devices).  I tried everything even had the cable provider replace the cable modem (based on a suggestion from the Best Buy Geek Squad who supported one of my devices).  Called Netgear and because this is a refurbished model (BTW - with NO serial number - made me feel like I purchased it illegally or something) but because it's refurbhished I get NO - ZERO - phone support.  Eventually they did say I have 30 says of online support (which by the time I called was almost up).  But that entails sending emails back and forth (they'll answer in a day or so).  But ended up just being you send in an email they ask for more - you wait a day and they provide some suggestion - that you've already tried....finally I decided to reset to factory settings again and just set it up again - seems to be working.  So basically the support was useless and I had to figure it out on my own - NEVER BY A REFRUBISHED NETGEAR PRODUCT!!It seems to be working for the MOST part - although I've seen some drops of service only to be recovered a few seconds later.....lesson learned I'll NEVER BY A REFRUBISHED NETGEAR PRODUCT and my not be netgear again based on the support or lack of that I recieved.

I've owned this router for a few months now and I don't have kind words for it.  First, the power supply died within the first few months.  Second, the signal strength is terrible.  I can't get more than one bar two rooms over.  I setup my old LInksys in place of this and I can get a full signal in rooms where the Netgear doesn't even show up.Now I'm stuck with something that is nothing more than an expensive gigabit hub.  If you have a house larger than 1,500 square feet, I strongly urge you to stay away from this model.

column9: Great when it works - But horrible end
column10: I bought this item about a year ago for $129.It was actually an improvement over the D-Link dir655 that has high reviews.  I bought it for the Dual N band, which worked great.Used Xbox and PS3 wired and two laptops wirelessly - When every device was on it worked flawlessly.Speed was not lost and you have complete control to adjust every setting.Last week the 2.4hz band stopped working and the unit started making a high pitched noise.  To my dismay i was told by net gear that I will have to pay to speak with someone, even though I knew that I needed a new unit! The person on the phone went over basic solutions ( resetting, unplugging, firmware ) All useless as I thought and my lost $35.I was told that a box will be send and they will fix it and send me another unit.  What!!?? How can one go a week without a router when there is 5 units and a business  in need of the internet connection.  I went out a bought a linksys 4200 and Will never buy a Netgear or use one even if offered for free.Horrible customer service and they do not have any respect for your time and money.  $129 is not chump change but to Netgear it means 90 days of warranty and a lot of headache afterwards.Good while it lasted - Never again Netgear.

column9: Bad customer support and a so so router
column10: Bought this router last year.  It worked fine until the firmware updated to the latest version. It would drop the internet connection many times in a day for no reason. After each drop, most time it would come back in about 5 minutes. Called netgear customer service, a support person from India told me I have to buy their extended service to get support, since it was out of the 90 days window. She didn't even tell me any possible link for a solution, other than asked me to buy the extended service.  Asked her manager (from India too), same, but a little better, told me to go to netgear.com for a good luck.  Before the firmware update, the 5G band was weak too.  I could get only 2 bars just about 20 feet away in my bedroom.I searched internet, this was a common issue for V1 version hardware.  But no solution was provided in netgear.com.  There was a suggestion from a customer to downgrade back to old version firmware.  I had not tried it yet.

I bought this WNDR3700 product thinking that it was a quality product. It worked for a short time wirelessly then stopped working even with a wired connection. I called support and was informed that they thought that it was my isps or my computers problem. My isps tech got it working with wired connection only doing things to their unit. I didn't have time until some months later to contact Netgear to be informed that only they can set up the wireless connection but won't until I pay 99.00 extortion for a years support. My advice, find another Brand Router!  Bob S

I just want to warn anyone considering a NetGear Router not to do it.  This router and NetGear support has been terrible.I ordered this Wireless router through Amazon.  I have had connection issues for months.  Recently NetGear charged me $80 for support plus $16 shipping to replace this router with a new one.  Well, the new one sucks too.  It constantly drops connections.  I setup a new wireless router from a different manufacurer and unlike what NetGear told me - there is NOT an issue with my PCs or home network.  It IS their piece of junk router that can't hold connections.  I paid $150 originally (Feb 2011) and $96 December 2011 for support that fixed absolutly nothing.  I should be able to get a refund for this defective item at the very least.  Unfortunately I can't get the many hours I spent frustrated troubleshooting, resting to factory defaults, and talking with NetGear's incompetent support back.  My purchase history on Amazon shows I'm generally a happy customer.  I would actually recommend Amazon not carry products by NetGear as they leave customers haning out to dry.  Worse than that the milk them for support on inferior products and close tickets without resolving the problem.Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR3700

I owned this router for 9 months, works perfectly once I tried and error to different version of firmware and connection is speedy, steady and no drop signal.Problem came yesterday, the signal strength suddenly dropped from Excellent to Low, I am still able to achieve very high speed traffic at 270mbps within 1 feet from the router. All other devices beyond a few feet are no longer detectable this wireless router.  I declared no firmware changed, nothing was changed, but dropped signal strength in a sudden.I tried to upgraded and downgrade a few firmware, nothing improve to the signal strength.Called support and I was told my hardware warranty is still valid but they insisted that the problem is not hardware issue, don't even asked any further problem and requested me to pay first for the software support.By the way, I bought a piece of hardware and believed is defective, and charge me for the software support which is don't even exist.If they said firmware, it is still belongs to Netgear support, they can suggest me to search the answer from the forum, but they did not, the only option is to pay for software support, it is completely insane.Some five years ago, I heard many people said Netgear has poor reliability products, but I still want to try after so many positive response to this particular wireless router.  Now I believed that they haven't improve the quality and I think this is why they want ripe me off first before telling me to get a replacement unit.Hardware design, I will give a 4 1/2 stars, reliability, warranty and support, sorry 0 star.Sorry Netgear, I am no longer buying anything from you ever.

column9: Horrible router and even worse customer service
column10: I purchased this router with high expectations based on reviews.Unfortunately it did not pan out. The wireless range was terrible and was a step down from my old Dlink wireless G router.I then purchased an IPad 6 months later and it couldn't connect to the wireless. I called Netgear for help and they demanded that I pay first because tech support had expired ( I had called them 6 months earlier for an issue that was resolved).I am now stuck with a brick ( still works as a wired router though).Do not waste you money on this router.

Expensive equipment and wi-fi connection drops frequently.Also, the USB connection was very slow (when it worked) and several times I was losing the mapped usb drive.There are other options out there. Don't buy this one.

So i bought it about a week ago. it worked fine up until about an hour ago, when it - without any warning- suddenly stopped getting internet connection. it just boots up and the internet connectivity light flashes orange/red forever. I can connect to it but i get no internet. I have tried new ethernet cables, power cycling, soft and hard/factory resets, everything i can think of and still no luck.My internet works fine in my house, just not this router.worst $100 ever spent. seriously 1 week life time?

column9: What a piece of junk (and lack of support to boot)
column10: I went round and round with NG Support for months, with some 'engineers' that apparently have never tried to configure and use this router on a home broadband connection. Anyway, I finally gave up, only to find months later that there is indeed a problem with this router's firmware (related to DNS name resolution, which causes an intermittent but consistently occurring disconnection on the WAN port).Since then, they've told the masses that they have a firmware fix, but it's just more of the same crapware, just with an updated version number (and with the word 'beta' attached - doesn't that just make you warm and fuzzy?). Needless to say, don't fall in the trap with us - do some research on various sites to determine the truth for yourself.Oh, and for those of you who haven't had problems, just wait: it takes months for this problem to surface, and when it does, say hello to frustration!

It was working good for 4 months. Now even 2.4GHz Signals are NOT working. I have to had to keep my laptop within 1 meter radius in order to get the 2.4GHZ Signals. Contacted Customer Support. They said your 3 months warranty is over. Now I am thinking either buy the expensive warranty or buy another router. This is my 3rd router from Netgear. The first 2 routers worked good for years. 4 months ago, I bought this and stuck with it. The customer support is very rude. I am really surprising how such a mandatory product for every house hold suddently doesn't work and the custmer support says you have only 3 months warranty. And the product was $100 and their 1 hour service is $55. Hopless product, Hopeless Company and Hopeless Customer Support.

column9: Beware!!!! on all Netgear used routers!!!
column10: I purchased a net gear router N600 and have been researching how to do a firmware update.  I am told I cannot not do anything with this router, because it is registered to the previous owner.  So I don't have the ability to log on to the router to make changes or do updates.  Please advise, I wish I would have known this prior to purchasing this router.  I have contacted REALTECH DIRECT along with Netgear, Realtech has not responded and Netgear wants to charge me 60.00 to remove the previous owner name from the online registration.  Buyer Beware!

column9: Works for six months, then quits.
column10: I bought this router six months ago. I read the reviews, and I remember seeing a few that said 'this router only worked for six months and then it stopped working.' I guess I just thought that wouldn't happen to me, but I was wrong. In fact, that's exactly what happened. It worked great for six months and then it started cutting out several times an hour. Upgraded firmware, did a factory reset, nothing helped. Do yourself a favor and don't buy this thing. It will work for six months and then it will stop working.

It's a horrible product. It worked in the first month then failed. I called Netgear technical support and spent hours and hours on the phone trying different solutions. But it still didn't work. Then I checked warranties policy. It's simply ridiculous. Here is the quote: 'All defective products should be returned to NETGEAR with shipping charges prepaid. Replacement products may be refurbished or contain refurbished materials. If NETGEAR, by its sole determination, is unable to replace the defective product, it will refund the depreciated purchase price of the product.' Netgear sold me a defect product which wasted so much of my time and caused so much inconvenience. But I have to pay for the shipping to replace the product? And I may get a refurbished one even though I paid for a brand new product? Are you kidding me?

I bought this router two weeks ago. Poor results. First called Vonage and internet provider. They said to call Netgear techincal support 888-638-4327. Proably I needed a softwate update or a different setting.1) I explained my problem with my two week old NETGEAR wireless router and was clearly told that NETGEAR does NOT provide ANY after sales tech support for AMAZON customers.2) I asked the tech to check this policy with the department manger to ensure there was no error in his understanding. He put me on hold with Indian?/Middle eastern? music in the background. He told me he checked with the head of the NETGEAR TECH SUPPORT department and this was corporate policy for AMAZON customers.3) He told me I could BUY!!! tech support service from NETGEAR for $99.95 for a year, 59.95 for 6 months or $29.95 for this problem.4) I told him that I would return the merchandise to AMAZON and ensure my company never purchases NETGEAR again and that AMAZON would be made aware. He said fine, he was certain he was providing NETGEAR CORPORATE POLICY for AMAZON purchases. I asked for his name. Ross is his first name and he refused a last name!!!Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR3700RealTekDirectFeedback Rating: 4.8 stars over the past 12 months4.8 stars over the past 12 months (936 ratings)Detailed Seller InformationRealTekDirect Storefront

Pros: Works fast when it works. Pretty.Cons: Connection would turn off and on for no reason at all. After a series of tests on my modem, computer, laptop, wii, roommates laptop, iphone and other devices I realized it was definitely the wireless router. Re-installed the drivers, updated what had to be updated, spent hours trying to fix the issue but to no avail. If I wanted spotty wifi connection I would have just stolen my neighbors wifi. After dealing with an older netgear issue in the past I refuse to even call up support for this product.All in all this is the third netgear router I have had the displeasure to own (thankfully I only bought two and one was a gift). If they work, its never for long. They're expensive and unreliable. They sucker you in with a sleek design but obviously thats where the line is drawn at netgear. Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND this or any other netgear product.

column9: No support for something that stopped working quickly
column10: Got this about a year ago.  It worked fine until this week. The 2.4ghz totally stopped transmitting.  I reset the router and verified the settings.  The 5 ghz was still working but the 2.4 is not working.  After 90 days there's no tech support for Netgear routers unless you send them $40. For the $140 I paid, I would hope it worked more than 1 year.  Wish I could find a reliable company to get a router from.

I paid $200 for this in walmart. It has a complicated and useless admin interface. I have been unable to get it to act as a repeater bridge, after scouring the internets and following complicated setup procedures.After much frustration,I put the gargoyle firmware on it, which lets me use it as a repeater but connection is extremely shoddy, dropping frequently and taking AGES to reconnect.The 5.4GHZ has very limited range ( need to be in the SAME room). I thought paying $200 would buy me a quality product, but alas, it was not to be.

column9: After a few months, drops connection daily
column10: I bought one of these several months ago.  I worked fine for a few months.  Now it's dropping the internet connection about once a day.  The only way to get it to connect back is to power cycle the unit.  I tried firmware upgrades and downgrades, but the problem persists.  AVOID!!!!
The 2.4 ghz radio died on my router yesterday morning. The 5ghz radio is still running fine. This appears to be a common problem for this router. Stay away.

column9: Flagship router in 2010 dies after 1.5 years
column10: After a year and a half, the radio part failed. Inches away from the router, my laptops couldn't connect to the network, 5% signal strength.In the meantime I had some minor, yet annoying issues, with external USB drives not waking up after going to sleep -- later firmwares fixed this. Transfer speeds from the USB drive were really crappy too.I payed $160 for their flagship router in 2010 and I will probably never buy Netgear again, they don't stand by their products.

purchased this item a little over a month ago and since day one the router will all of a sudden lose internet connectivity, most of the time lasting about 15-20 minutes unless i turn it off myself and turn it back on. I have gone to the Netgear forums for help and i have done all the standard troubleshooting like updating the most recent firmware but this does not help. I have even emailed the support email address for Netgear that i see on some of the negative reviews and not one word for almost 3 weeks, maybe they are waiting for any type of warranty to be expire. The router obviously works great when it wants to but why should i lose connectivity 3 to 6 times a day and that's when i actually notice the issue, it may lose connectivity more often.
