That means that if you have a WPS compliant device (which is becoming common), you don't need to type in any password. You just push a button on the front of the router and you're all set. Windows 7 takes advantage of this and will tell you to push the button on the router to connect. My Nintendo 3DS also noticed this and asked me to push the button. It's that simple: push a button and you're done. If your device doesn't support WPS, then you can also do the old fashioned thing and type in the password.The router also supports UPnP, so it takes care of the technical things like port forwarding behind the scenes. This comes in handy with things like gaming systems. These typically want certain firewall configurations to allow the best possible gaming performance. Let's say you connected an Xbox to it. The router will basically ask the Xbox if it wants the firewall to be set up a certain way and then it goes ahead and does it. No user intervention required!--Router Configuration--If you do ever need to go in and tweak any of the settings, it's pretty easy. Just go to [...] in your web browser and you'll get into the settings. No need to dig that cd back up again. Everything is laid out in a logical manner. There are three columns. The far left column contains the various categories of options. The middle column contains the options for the selected category. The far right column is a help column that explains the various options and what they do.--Real Life Usage--I've had this router for 8 months now and so far I haven't encountered any major issues. The range on the 2.4 Ghz band is impressive. The 5 Ghz band is much smaller however. The good thing is that you can set your computer up to connect to both. Then it'll connect to whichever one is in range. Netgear does also push out occasional updates that improves the performance and adds new features. One recent update that impressed me was the addition of IPv6 support. This is an emerging IP address format. The fact that they added support for that shows that Netgear is actually trying to future-proof their products rather than make you buy up later.Bottom Line: I strongly recommend this.

Installation was simple and easy - I love the guest account feature so I may give temporary access to my network without revealing my password. My only complaint is that the surface is a dust magnet that needs to be cleaned regularly.

I bought a new laptop and was using my old Linksys 2.4 GHZ router.  The laptop wireless connection was tolerable but the range was not that great.  I upgraded to the Netgear N600 dual frequency router, and what a huge difference!  Throughput speed increased, range increased, and connection reliability increased.  Also, the 4 gigabit ports increased my wired desktop PC speed as well.  Installation was a breeze.  An excellent product, I highly recommend it.  Purchased through Amazon, it arrived in a day.

This is a great router that came in quickly and was very easy to set up.  I had it up and running with both the wired side and wireless bands in 20 min.  I use it for two dell XPS, a lap top, smart phones, and a denon receiver.  So far no problems.

I bought this wireless router to replace my existing Linksys WRT54G router.  I wanted a new router which supported N as well as a dual band radio to allow me to stream video on the other network while maintain the 2.4GHz network for general use (i.e. laptops, phones, etc.).  I decided to spend a little more than you would normally on the typical home wireless router because I was tired of the reliability I was getting out of my linksys.  I had to reboot the old 54G every couple days and recently I discovered that the speed performance on my iphone 3GS was not good with that router.  Long story short, I read up and decided that this router was a good compromise between features, reliability (based on reviews), performance and cost.  I could have gone with the highest end model but decided that this model was plenty.  I do think that the cost is worth the extra features you get and hope that its also an investment into the reliability of the unit.So far I am extremely pleased, it was very SIMPLE to setup.  I am a power user of this type of equipment, but I still think it would be very easy for a new user to get going in minutes.  The web interface is easy to access and use and there are plenty of options to allow for full customization.  In fact, there are more than the average user would ever need.  While I would recommend this unit for anyone, I don't recommend that anyone go in and start messing with all the settings unless you have a good understanding of what you're changing.The performance is great, even on my Iphone which suffered on my old G router - I can now max out the cable modem speed when running a speedtest.net test on my iphone clear across the house.  Previously, I was lucky to get 1-2Mbps and now I max it out at 7Mbps.  In addition, I can stream HD video to my Roku while browsing on the other network or transferring files (each operation on a different radio) with no hiccups.  Very pleased with performance.The cost is higher than your typical home router, but so far the feature set and performance have made it well worth it!

Finding a router has been a pain. So many people dislike a wifi router for various reasons. This router seemed to have the best like/dislike ratio. The router works perfect. Set up in a few minutes. Works in my Mac only house. I play Starcraft game over wifi without lag from 15 feet away one floor below. While I'm playing my wife can still surf the net with out any problems. I've had it a month and have not had to disconnect it once.It seems most of the negative reviews on this router, and others, are from trying to get more than it's designed for. If you want a option loaded bells and whistles router then man up and spend more.Range is out standing. Router is on 3rd floor.  I am able to use my wifi only iPad 50 feet from the front door !

I've had this router for 4 months now.  It has an impressive spec sheet, and despite some short comings, performance is excellent all the way around.  I wish I could say that about Netgear telephone customer support which is atrocious.I initially installed my router as a switch in the middle of my network and had a Seagate Freeagent Desk hard drive plugged into it.  I had two problems:1) My hard drive disappeared about once a week, requiring a power reset or other fiddling to restore the hard drives presence.2) The router will not get the correct date/time from the internet time server.  This means that all the files on the hard drive that's connected to the router's USB port take a date of 01/01/2000.1) Hard Drives Disappears Issue:================================Every Netgear Customer Service representative asked me what make/model my hard drive was, and after citing my Seagate Free Agent Desk or Free Agent Go model numbers, I was told that they were not on the list of supported hard drives.  There is absolutely no excuse for a product like this to be incompatible with any Seagate USB hard drive or any other mainstream brand of USB hard drive.  Having a list of compatible USB hard drives is understandable, but when well-respected hard drives are claimed as being unsupported, then the list is being used as a crutch for an unpolished product.  As it ended up, the list is plainly not being kept up-to-date and all my hard drives are completely compatible.  The customer service reps were just clueless.I stumbled upon a post that suggests disabling the sleep function built into Seagate/Iomega hard drives using a Seagate utility.  That did it!  My drive no longer disappears.  I can't believe that none of the Netgear customer service reps could advise me of that.  In fact, I now have 3 external hard drives plugged into the router through a USB hub and they work great.  It is understandable that the router loses connection to a hard drive that goes into sleep mode.  It us unacceptable that Netgear tech support did not know about this issue with such a prominent hard drive.2) Wrong File Date/Time Issue:==============================I spoke with 3 different tech support personnel, including a supervisor.  After explaining that my router was taking the date/time of 01/01/2000 after resetting and was never updating the the correct/current time, I was asked by every representative what time zone I had set my router configuration set to.  How could a wrong time zone setting result in a date/time that was off by 11 years?  There is no way to manually set the date/time.The issue is this:  If you are using your router like a switch where you are not using the WAN port but instead have you router connected to your network via one of its ethernet ports, then the router will not be able to check for internet time (nor will it be able to download its own firmware updates).  Silly.  I can't understand why the router would have this limitation.  But, if you set up your network such that you are using the router's WAN port, these features work great.  This too should be a simple problem to diagnose for Netgear's customer support.Conclusion:===========1) This is a great router and it beats almost all consumer routers available today.  Even its successor, the WNDR4000 isn't that much better.2) You CAN plug in multiple hard drives though the use of a USB hub even though netgear will not comment on this at all, either way.  You can only plug in storage devices and cannot plug in printers.3) You must disable your hard drives' sleep feature.4) If you need accurate time/date (like any NAS user would) you have to plug the router directly into your modem via its WAN port.5) If you are familiar with networking, save your time and frustration and don't bother calling Netgear's customer support.

i like this router better  than what i have owned in the pastand this would happen t be my second Netgear router i've ownedthe first one died during an electrical storm,  but this turned out tobe a way better upgrade

I got this product on Amazon b/c the local Best Buy would be charging me the same price w/o the gigabit ethernet ports. However, by getting the refurb product, I saved another $15. I've been using the router and I've had no unforseeable issues! I've having problems getting good range on the 5ghz wireless signal, but apparently that's apparently a universal issue w/ all dual band routers.

column9: Good Router: Increased Rang and Speed
column10: So normally I don't hand out 5 stars to products unless they are flawless, but I felt obligated to because of all the unwarranted negative reviews.  This router would be about a 4.5 normally.First things first, many of the reviews focused on the BAD firmware that the router shipped with.  Before connecting the router to the internet, I had the latest firmware ready to update the router with.  The router shipped with version 1.0.0.6 and the latest was 1.0.0.8.  The new version of the firmware worked fine.  The process takes three minutes once you log into the router.I am upgrading from a 4-5 year old netgear router that I bought on black friday for $25, so the increase in features was a little overwhelming.I have moderate knowledge of computers, and I was able to setup the router without using the CD that came with it.  All you need to do is login, change the password, SSID, and set up security.The reason for the upgrade from the old router is that I have Directv now, which is plugged into the router, and for some strange reason IP conflicts were consistently happening which was causing me to have to restart the computer.  I've had this router for a few days now and it seems to be better.One thing to note RE a few reviews that I have read.  If you have DSL, the quality of your signal depends on how far you are away from the 'switching station' in your neighborhood.  The further away you are, the worse the signal.  And it is sporadic.  Some days it can be good, some days it can be bad.  It is not the routers fault.  You may think anecdotal that it, but check out posts on the topic.  A cable modem is the only way to have a fairly consistent connection.The range is definitely better.  The areas of the house where I was getting a 'Very Good' signal are now 'Excellent'.  Is the router worth $130, that is the question.  But no doubt is the range better, and it made my problems better.People--this router rocks.  Upgrade the firmware!!!!!

I purchased this recently because I had upgraded to Cable internet from DSL. My DSL router was a combo modem/router, so I bought this one for my cable connection. My previous DSL unit was also a Netgear wireless and it was extremely easy to set up, so that's why I purchased another Netgear for cable internet. Again, it was extremely easy to set up, no glitches during the install, it pretty much automatically detected everything for me, except I set up my own passwords, security, etc. In a two-story home, I can connect with my laptop wireless downstairs inside a room with the door closed - no problem. I can also connect anywhere outside in my yard with all doors and windows closed. My home and yard are not large, but the range works for me.I've used other brand modems/wireless routers in the past and did have some difficulties with set up and had to contact tech support. I really love the ease of set up with the Netgear routers. I've not had to reset the router yet either as I've had to do with a previous different brand.For my cable connection, I am using a Zoom cable modem, which is connected to this Netgear router. No problems setting them all up, they work perfectly together. I've had no issues whatsoever connecting my laptop, netbook, or iPod touch to my network either. I do not notice any speed lags with any item either while wirelessly connected.I believe this is capable of connecting USB units, such as a hard drive, to share over a network, which is a nice plus, though I've not done this yet. I really love this one and have already recommended it to others I know.

Extremely pleased with this router!I've had this router in service for about 8 months now and have not had to reset even once, despite multiple power outages, power blips, thunderstorms, etc. The dual band capability together with gigabit wired ethernet is great for connecting my numerous devices, ranging from various notebook computers new and old, fast new Win7 desktops, older Linux desktops, smart phones, etc. I have not tried to connect any A/V devices, so can't comment on that.I also have connected a 2TB Seagate external drive to the USB port, which I use for backups. Although the USB is slow compared to the wired ethernet it also works flawlessly. Before connecting the Seagate drive, I attached it directly to a computer and reformatted the drive, deleting all preinstalled software. It was then plug and play ready for the router and worked perfectly immediately. One feature I would have liked would be ability to create subdirectories on the external drive, each with it's own unique password, but then this is a router, not a server. You can password protect the external drive using the router admin password, but then that applies to the entire drive.Administration of the router is very easy using the web interface.

I bought this router like 2-3 days ago and I've had no problem with this awesome product so far...The thing which is important for everyone is the ease of installation and getting the router to work ... It's so easy and I got it to work in 1-2-3 ... All I did was following the tips on the manual and it started to work like a charm in like 2 minutes or so.Secondly, I want to insist on a special feature on this router, called Live Parental Control. Well the service itself isn't perfect, as no single parental control service is but if you've kids at your home, and if you're worried about explicit sites and stuff, then this router is the best one for you. You can use the Live Parental Control service along with another feature included on the router, called Content Filtering which helps you block certain websites using keywords and URLs. Live Parental Control plus the Content Filtering feature makes a totally safe network for your home such that nobody can visit sexual websites and sites with explicit contents anymore, except for the ones who are really EXPERT. Moreover, you can easily set up a bypass account for you and anyone at your home who likes to have a full access to the internet.Range and speed are awesome either. In my two story house, everybody has an access to the internet with the full speed and we we can even enjoy surfing the net in the balcony which didn't used to have an internet because of my old router.The other thing which used to get on my nerves on my old router was the restarting the device and stuff ... Well in these 3 days, I haven't restarted the router even once and it's working like charm; no weak signal, no low speed and nothing bad about this part.Streaming HD videos, lag-free gaming and many other features are there for you to enjoy!Well I gotta ultimately admit that this product was a bit pricey, but I'm totally satisfied with this router; at least in my case, I already got my money's worth.This router is totally recommended ...

I've had this router installed, paired with a NetGear WN2000RPT wireless repeater, for several weeks.  No drop-outs (that we've noticed).  We are using the primary wireless as a secure wireless bridge (with the WN2000RPT), and using the guest network for 'standard' wireless connections.  The guest network feature is very nice in that those users cannot (selectable) see the devices associated with the secure wireless bridge.The bridge is set-up between two buildings, about 130' line-of-sight.  Signal is strong and reliable; in fact the users on the wired connections of the WN2000RPT were surprised to find they are actually on a wireless network.

column9: So far everything the spec promised
column10: This router replaced my old Linksys router. Immediately I noticed a big jump in performance. Set up was easy and i was up and running in less than 30 minutes (includes firmware update). The dual band is great and everything is working as per the specification.
This was recommended by a friend to be installed so that our entire house could become "wire less".  Works great.  Now where ever I am in the house I can connect to the wire less fast and easy.

I was able to get this router working within ten minutes of unboxing.  Within twenty minutes the system had downloaded and updated its firmware.  I haven't tweaked its configuration since.PROs: Well built, can be hung on a wall. The router does not heat up too much. Configuration is easy and there is plenty of context sensitive help.CONs: Rudimentary parental controls. 5G wireless band is short range (though about equal in range to other routers I tried).I really don't have much more to add except to say that this router has increased the overall throughput and reliability of my network. I think this is because the firmware just works, the router has a fast CPU, and the router is provisioned with large amounts of RAM onboard.For me, this router is nearly perfect because once I set it up I could forget it.

I purchased this at Best Buy because I needed a quick replacement for my piece-of-junk Linksys WRT54GS.  If I hadn't needed it so quickly, I would have ordered from Amazon.I set the router up manually as I always do and it has been fantastic - hasn't stopped working once (like the pos Linksys did regulary), and has increased range and power.

I've had years of experience with installing and using routers for my extensive LAN.  This is not the first router that I have used.  I will say that it is the best router that I've owned.  I have read reviews where people have had problem with this router.  I did have one problem but found is that a WiFi card in a computer was bad causing degraded speeds.  After about 8 weeks of 24/7 operation, this router works great.I stream lots of HD quality video.  I get top speeds with the smoothest of streaming. When remotely streaming video through the router through WAN, I'm very impressed.The quality of WiFi signal is very good, somewhat better than the replaced D-Link DIR655.

I was looking to upgrade the home office from old school to the new N-Wireless technology as I was stuck at a 100 mbps connection at home utilizing the G Wireless connection that lead to timeout issues and having to reset the router frequently so that all of the wireless devices in the home including Wii, PS3, 2 desktop computers, 1 laptop, multiple cell phones, etc could utilize it. When I received the package containing the router, I took it out of the box, plugged in all of the cables, went to the router site and set everything up and I was literally online and using the 300mbps connection within 10 minutes. The instructions are very straight-forward and easy to do and setting everything up is as easy as it was on any other wireless router that I've used. You also have the ability to connect to the old 100mbps connection if you have technology that isn't compatible with N wireless. One of the most important things you can do is make sure that your computers and all that are compatible with N wireless and you can go to your device manager and see if you have an network adapter built in that says '802.11 a/b/g/n', then you have the ability to use N wireless without getting an additional external adapter. If you see '802.11 a/b/g' (without 'n'), you do not have an on-board N wireless adapter. If you don't have it, you will want to buy an external adapter for whatever computer doesn't have the capability. I would advise getting an N600 adapter to match your N600 router or any other correlating set. Make the adapter match the router for optimum performance.

column9: NETGEAR PRODUCT IS GOOD BUT SERVICE IS THE WORST I HAVE ENCOUNTERED
column10: I purchased the 3700 6 months ago, for extended range over my other wireless, and it performed great.  Had an issue with my computer and have not had connection, except throug a wired connection since (4 weeks ago).  I called the technical service number and purchased a GearHead 6 months subscription, since i had issues with my (new)computer and the wireless.  That was two weeks ago.  I have been put on hold 5 times, all over 30 minutes each.  A technician answered the call one time but was immediatly disconnected.  I have tried mostly in the evening, but finally understanding that is when most people call in i am trying the call at 10:00 AM, well so far i have been on HOLD FOR OVER 25 MINUTES.  SO MUCH FOR CALLING IN AT A DIFFERENT TIME.  I am going to protest the $70 charge it cost for the PROFESSIONAL HELP.The produce seems to work great, but do not have a problem and expect to get connected to someone to help.This forum did not give me the opportunity to rate the technical service.  I would guess that it would be great but the NetGear company is cheap when it comes to hiring enough people to service the product, even when someone pays extra for it.  I WOULD HAVE RATED THE COMPANY AT A ZERO STARS.

column9: Improved my download and upload speeds
column10: I just got this router this week and absolutely love it. My internet provider promised me download speeds of 'up to' 8mbps, and upload speeds of 1.0 mbps, which are both perfectly adequate for a small household with a couple wireless device. So, I went to speedtest.net and tested my connection speeds, I am getting almost 8.5 mbps download and 1.1 mbps upload consistently, and is actually better than I got when I had the laptop directly connected to the cable modem with a cat5 cable. We also Skype all the time with family across the United States, so having a good wireless connection was vital. In fact, our video quality is better now that we have the wireless router up and running versus when I laptop connected via cat5 strait to the cable modem. I was able to take the laptop completely outside of my house to the edge of my driveway and still got great reception and video quality. The installation and setup was easy and self-explantory, anyone with half a brain could figure it out. Great product, very happy.

I am a newbe to wireless routers, so all I can say is that this one works very well for video to my Roku and general internet to my desktop computer. The Roku is only about 25 feet away and there are no intervening walls. I am undoubtedly not very knowledgeable about all of the router's capabilities and the technical details, but for my present purposes, I didn't need to be since it was so easy to set up and connect.  I have only used it for a few weeks, so don't really know about longevity.

Replaced my old Linksys/Cisco WRT54GS router with this one.  Had read great reviews on Netgear stuff before and I finally tried this one after the prices were cut by a third.  HOLY COW!  My Comcast internet had been very slow and when I replaced the old router with this one it is multiple times faster.  Was a bit trickier to setup as opposed to my old router, had to restart it three times and it would still not connect to the web, even though it had the green light blinking that said it had a good connection but once I restarted my PC and laptop and connected the CAT5 cable it came with to the modem, it started working but I am not sure if it was because of the restart or the newer cable (More than likely the restart as CAT5 is universal).  Vast array of settings, multiple levels of security, ability to monitor your internet usage and set an alarm when you may reach the limit, if you have one.  Ability to create guest networks.  No more downloading firmware and manually upgrading a router because this one will connect and upgrade itself from Netgear's servers.  Looks good too, all black, glossy, sits flat or stands sideways on the provided stand that plugs into the side, but the glossy surface is very susceptible to fingerprints.  Includes a USB connection for network storage or to hook up a printer.  Four gigabit ports as well.  Price is great for the amount of performance you receive.  Once I change out my old modem, I am eager to see how much faste my connection will become with this.  True 300mbps connection on my laptop which is much faster now as well.  This router is great, buy it, you will not be disappointed at all.
This product is amazing work fast and easy to install, i recommend for everyone and the amazon.com is more than amazing is the best one.

I had issues with my old router causing loss of connectivity, even when trying to access files and photos on my personal NAS at home.  I would constantly have to restart the router.This router fixed my problem.  Better range, pulls up files/photos in half the time of what I had before.Easy setup and it has been reliable to date.  Not something I have to worry about anymore.

I purchased the Netgear WNDR3700 based on a great review and 'Best of the Best' rating in Maximum PC. They never let me down. It is very easy to get hooked up and started, but the performance was (note: WAS [please keep reading]) horrible until I did a firmware upgrade from 1.0.0.6 to 1.0.0.8. The embedded automatic upgrade (where you click 'Check' to download and install new firmware) did not work, so I downloaded the latest firmware from the Netgear website and loaded it manually via the embedded 'Router Upgrade' option in the embedded menus. This fixed all of its problems.Lots of features: the double radios are very easy to set up and useful if you're wirelessly streaming videos while others are working on their taxes (inside joke, but you get the point). Guest SSIDs are very easy to set up on each radio. You neighbors will be impressed when they see your pad has four SSID radiating from it. Each radio has bandwidth limiting available. QoS is easy, ...The range on the Netgear WNDR3700 is nothing short of amazing. All I really wanted was to be on the net in my garage, but now I can stream Pandora from all over the neighborhood on my own network. Very cool.

column9: N600 Dual Band Gigabit aka wndr3700
column10: This is such a quick router, i had another gigabit dual band and it was super slow compared to this one and completely amazing compared to the other one. the wireless signal is super strong everywhere, provides max bandwidth anywhere in the house and its in the basement of my 2200 square foot home. it's also refurbished and still amazing, i'll be adding to the network, a NAS drive which i expect will totally be able to take advantage of this routers raw power. it really is awesome to have this powerful of a router. i have 3 laptops, 2 desktops, and a ps3 on the router, and nothing ever suffers from lag or slowness when watching HD videos on youtube, netflix, vudu, no problems, super quick reaction from anything i'm doing. i also have digital voice from comcast, and nothing ever suffers when downloading large files.its' really an all around amazing router. can't say anything bad about it. FYI i paid about half of the one eighty it was going for at the time due to refurbished
I bought this about a year ago to replace a 5 year old Belkin.  This unit works just like I wanted.  It has both great speed and great coverage.  I would definitely buy it again.
I have always been a Linksys fan... After using this router for about 2 months now,, I will never look back... Best Range and stability ever!!  I completely endorse this router..

column9: Great for today's more complex home networks
column10: The N600 WNDR3700, not to be confused with the less expensive, older version of the N600, is a wonderful router for today's more complex home networks. I don't understand all the technology behind it, but I do know that my home network with my internet connected tv operating on its own separate node of the network seems to run much smoother with better video streaming than with my previous router.

column9: Works better than I thought it would!
column10: Very easy setup and I love the auto guest set up, so friends can use the Internet without giving them a password and they can not get into my files.  USB port works super easy, just plugged my flash drive and all my computers can share the files.  I have had it for over a month now and I haven't had to reset it even once, my old Lynks had to be reset every two weeks.  I am so happy I upgraded and chose this one!

column9: bought a router but I needed a modem
column10: My mistake.  I really needed a new modem and the item was returned promptly and efficiently. Thank you Amazon.  You're a pleasure to deal with.

column9: Works great with Xbox Live, two Xboxes, open NAT
column10: The WNDR3700 was an upgrade from an old Linksys G router which worked great but had problems connecting two Xbox 360s.  They could both connect, but one always had a moderate NAT setting which limits matchmaking.  My wireless Xbox worked fine (open NAT), but my wired one showed moderate.  I tried many settings, could not get it to work properly.I have two laptops (802.11G), one desktop (802.11N), iPhone (11N), iPod touches (11N), two Xbox 360s (one wired, one 802.11G), a networked LG Bluray Disc player (wired), and a home security DVR (wired).  I had put off upgrading my router because it has historically been painful to get everything to work.With the WNDR3700 (purchased at Staples with gift cards), setup was a breeze, everything worked immediately.  Excellent setup wizard disc which found my DSL modem, prompted me for my DSL credentials, and set up the two wireless networks (2.4GHZ and 5 GHZ) with WPA2 encryption.  I was using the internet within about 15 minutes.I had to do a couple of port forwards to get my security DVR/iPhone working.  Everything else was left at the default settings.  I tested my 'internet-facing' security at GRC.com with ShieldsUp!, and I am invisible with no security concerns.  Solid connections so far, no problems noticed.The best part for me is that BOTH of my Xbox 360s now show as OPEN NAT, even when being used at the same time!  If you google this topic, you'll quickly find getting open NAT is hit or miss with most routers, let alone TWO simultaneous 360s!  Well done, Netgear!

I got this router to replace a 'Not good enough to be called junk' Belkin router. This router is very easy to set-up, has great range, will allow you to hook up network printer. In by care I am able to use my Brother MFC-465CN with both my Desktop via USB and my Laptop via an ethernet cable to the router this saved my from having to buy a new wireless printer. Te router allows to you to set up for a guest if you want and change the password for the guest in no time or not allow any guest at all. The built-in firewall  will stop any one from getting in to you network. The USD port on the back of the router will allow you to hook up a protable USB device to back up you computer or share with ohter people. there is a power button on the back so you can shut bown the router if you need to with out removing the power cord and I couldn't do that with the Belkin. I have not had any problems of any kind with this router. If your looking for a Top Quality Router then get this one I'm sure you'll be as happy as I am.

I purchased this router to replace an old Linksys WRT54G. I was trying to connect my DVD player for Netflix streaming and the Linksys couldn't take the workload.The Netgear router was a breeze to set up and I have been streaming videos from Netflix and Amazon with no glitches for a week.Brilliant!

Purchased this to replace old Linksys wireless G router (Linksys WRT54GX4) that bit the dust.  Not only did this new Netgear N router have dramatically improved speed (expected since upgrading to N), it completely blew me away on the range.The old Linksys router was supposed to have had the best range in its day.  But in our case, we experienced multiple dead zones, which required 3 additional wireless adapters/expanders in order to get the signal throughout the house (2 stories plus basement).  The new Netgear reaches everywhere with more than 100Mbps, even in the previously deadest zones of the house.  Thus far have had no problems with wireless connectivity on 2 Windows-based laptops, a Windows PC, an iPad, iPhone and Blackberry.  Netflix video streaming to an iPad worked just fine all through the house.Also have a hard-wired network connected to the hard-wire ports, including a back-up hard drive, a Vonage VOIP adapter, some PCs and a Slingbox -- all worked just fine when attached to the new router.Setup was very straightforward if you've set up routers before (can't speak to its ease for a newbie).  I used the manual configuration, logging into the router; did not use the CD or 'Wizard'.  It was quite simple and had lots of useful options.Unit looks sleek.  Indicator lights in front are very useful and easy to interpret.  Having the 4 Giga ports is a great feature.  I do not use the USB slot.  I do not use the 'guest network' option, though it seems very easy to implement.Only had it for a few weeks.  Thus far has been very reliable and has not dropped connection.  Cannot speak to reliability and/or holding the connection over the long term.

I replaced an older D-Link wireless 'N' router.  I had to reboot it often to get my iPhone, iPod, and Kindle to connect wirelessly.  We got Netflix streaming for 'Christmas' and it was constantly pausing/freezing (thru TiVo).The installation was 'pretty good'.  Their 'Netgear Genie' program was very simple and easy to understand, unfortunately it felt very sluggish and it hung on me twice.  I was eventually able to get everything configured.  It has been running for two days now - and the iPhone, iPods & Kindle all connect immediately - every time (even on a 'good day', the old router took 60 seconds or more for an iPod or iPhone to connect).  Netflix has been running flawlessly with multiple videos streaming simultaneously and no pauses at all - over 6 hours of shows without a single pause/freeze (we often paused every 3 or 4 minutes)!  My 13 year old even mentioned (without being asked) that the range is significantly increased from our old router.  This router has already met or exceeded all my expectations and I look forward to working with some of the advance features as well.

I was using a Linksys WRT54g, but had issues connecting to a Panasonic laptop, and having enough range to get to the third floor with 11g, and fairly poor wireless network speeds.This is all solved, and after an easy transition of network parameters, I am pretty much happy. Wireless is now available everywhere and is faster than before. It may be that 11g is plenty for DSL, but for connections between computers on the network, I am much much happier with n.The downsides come form the extra stuff: I cannot get a past transfer from the NAS, and mediaplay to the PS3 is hit and miss.Does not affect the main use

I had an older model N-wireless. It didn't work that well so I thought I'd get an upgrade. This one is amazing. All the way across the house (60 ft) full quality full bars and it's sitting on the ground. Impressive.

Easy thats the thing that stands out.  It took me all of 10 minutes to get it out of the box up and going. Speed to my wireless tv a floor below has increased significantly.  Last time I added a router I had to have it set up by my Isp.  Took me awhile to get a new one because I did not want the hassleof setting a new one up and getting everything to work together.  This was so easy I was afraid I did something wrong.  have always had good luck with Netgear and will definately buy this brand again

column9: Why couldn't I find this router first?!  A beginner's review.
column10: Well, this is my first Amazon review, despite the fact that I've bought plenty of stuff here before.  I decided to write a review right after just submitting for returns to other routers that I purchased from Amazon:  Cisco-Linksys WRT160N Wireless-N Broadband Router and the D-Link DIR-655 Extreme N Gigabit Wireless Router.*SKIP IF YOU WANT TO READ MY REVIEW OF THE ROUTER--BACKSTORY OF HOW I GOT TO PURCHASING THE ROUTER!*I wanted to like both of those routers, but it was very hard to with the service they were giving me.  First up, the Linksys.  I had a Linksys before getting FIOS, and it worked fine for us.  It was that basic blue set that you've probably seen before.  Having switched from Verizon to Optimum Online in the last couple of weeks, I now needed to get a new router in that they do not provide you with one like Verizon does with their router modem combo.  The old Linksys was nowhere to be found so I decided to go with the Linksys Cisco after having been satisfied with the blue set (and I remember it was cheap then too, routers now are getting expensive!).  Set up with the Linksys Cisco was fairly easy, but I found its performance to be weak.  I was not getting above a 60 percent connection despite my room being only 25 feet away from the computer room where the modem is found.  It would fluctuate between 50 and 55 and no less.  On several occasions it dipped into the 30's, rendering online gameplay obselete for a while.I decided perhaps I should invest in a more expensive router, since 'you get what you pay for'.  I ordered the D-Link after seeing over 1,000 positive ratings and a 4 star average product.  I wish I was apart of that group of people, because as cool as the router looked, its performance was terrible.  I was really expecting a better signal, in that there were 3 external antennae on the unit and all the claims by the manufacturer sounded like serious business.  Connection was simple, and although my PC was freezing up trying to read the installation CD, I worked around that and simply set up the router through the web browser.When I went to connect my PS3 and desktop PC in my room to the router, I was shocked to see that I was barely getting a signal strength of 30 percent.  I checked the antennae (which are the kinds you screw in yourself to the back of the unit) in the back and they seemed to be secure.  I tried playing around with leaving the doors open between the rooms and all these other suggestions and I barely made it to 50 percent.  It would not stay and simply hover around 30 percent most of the time, 40 if I were lucky.At this point, I had two routers in the house and a 5 unhappy campers who were not able to connect to the internet without being subject to slow webpages and disconnections to gaming servers.  I decided that I would have to throw down a few more bucks then intended and decided to go with the Netgear.  The top of the line Linksys Cisco was a very close decision but having already tried one and a D-Link, I decided to go with Netgear for a fresh experience.WHY COULDN'T I HAVE SELECTED THIS ROUTER IN THE FIRST PLACE!?Simply put, this thing is fast.  More importantly for me, the signal strength is fantastic.  Remember the 30's, 40's, 50's?  My PS3 and desktop PC are now receiving 100 PERCENT signal!!!  Set up was fast, and the Netgear Genie is easy to use.  Even the online interface is simple and I noticed that the router doesn't have to restart after doing changes all the time like the Linksys.  On the right hand side of the web browser explains all the terminology so if you don't understand what 'Router Isolation' or 'QoS' stands for, it tells you right there with it's own scrollbar.  This is an amazing addition to making your router customizable if you don't know anything past hooking it up.  This helps folks like myself if you know enough to get you started with a WEP key and all but want to really delve into the meat of the router.My desktop PC has wireless n enabled and the download speeds are blazing fast.  Youtube videos in 1080 and 720 HD were loading like nothing.  My brother experienced no lag while playing Fifa '11 online (and happened to be beating a certain individual 3-1 who rage quit upon him haha)and everything has no problem finding and connecting to the router.I don't think there's much else to say, other than the unit is a very sleek looking device and has a small footprint for something so powerful.  I highly recommend this router.  If you are worried about spending money on a router, then know you're getting your money's worth here.  Don't make the mistake I made (twice!!) by going for the cheaper router to save money and expect as good service.  I mean, you might be lucky, or you may not need as much strength as I need (2 gaming consoles, 2 netbooks, 2 laptops, 2 desktop pcs, and one external cable box for foreign television use the router at any given time), but this thing gets the job done.

This router rocks.  I set it up to run a wireless n adapter from each of my TiVo Premieres.  The connection is much faster then my previous wireless G router.  Don't worry about setting up the 2 frequencies.  Just follow the simple instructions (like 5 steps), then put the CD in your computer and follow the instructions.  It took me like 10 minutes to set everything up. I'm not super technical either.  Got my Tivo's running on the 5GHz network and my other G gadgets on my 2.4GHz network.  Very strong signal too.  Highly recommend!!
Nice router, a bit expensive but it has good features like Gigabit Wired connections and simultaneous 2.4gHz and 5 gHz frequencies.

column9: Performs great and handles high usage.
column10: Performs great and handles high usage. My only down side is that it could be more powerful in receiving at a distance. I have had to use a booster to get it to the back of my house.
Easy to set up, FAST, and greater range than my old G band router (including through walls).  Attractive as well.

This is a review for the simple computer user! I just wanted a router that could support all my household's phones, tablets, smart tvs, and computers for streaming and surfing. My previous one (a belkin) couldn't handle it and froze constantly, or my desktop upstairs would be out of range even just for surfing. I am so excited about this router. I often need help with setting things up (like my last router). But this one had only 6 steps and it took less than ten minutes. It was color coded and easy. I have been using it now with all of my devices, very fast and no freezing. The router is downstairs across the house and my connections are very fast. I know this review won't help the tech savvy people, but it meets my needs and I wanted to support netgear for that.

I'm not tech savvy but the instructions that came along with the product were clear and easy to follow.  After a week of usage the signal hasn't dropped once.  Very reliable.  I also like the flexibility of being able to set it on it's side so it doesn't take up as much space horizontally.  Being dual band it is a good investment once more and more wireless devices switch to 5Ghz.  I bought this along with a cable modem to replace my leased Comcast wireless gateway.
This was an extremely good price for the very latest hardware revision (v4).  I am very happy with this purchase

Greatly increased wireless coverage and speed from previous router. Setup was simple. I am still using a wireless repeater w/ddwrt as I did with my previous router. But with this router, I may be able to do without.Yes, I would recommend this product.

column9: Great coverage all over the house
column10: This unit not only has enough hard wire ports for my many devices, the wireless coverage in my home is 'way better than my old 802.11a/b unit that it replaced.  The built in router functions are robust and easier to use than the older routers too.
With the multitude of wireless devices in our home... needed to go a step above!  This router meet our needs!

I wanted to wait a bit (4-months) before writing a review to make sure this router did what is expected.  I find the reviews of a techincal nature to not be very meaningful if it occurs during the 'honeymoon period.'  My previous router could not handle the loads that I was requiring (both voice and data) and required constant resetting.  The former router was also a Netgear so I was a bit leery of this one, but due to the reviews, the processor, and dual band capabilities, I decided to purchase this one and I am glad I did.This router is as easy to set up as any other router.  I went to the setup web page and entered in my codes and made relatively few configuration changes.  One configuration change I made was modifying the speed cap for one of the bands.  It came configured at 150 Mbps for one of the bands for some unknown reason.I especially like the 'guest' login feature as I can control the speed and do not have to give out my 'real' password to guests with Iphones.  This is also an important feature for me as I sometimes have clients come to the house who need internet access.  I can provide it to them while limiting what they can see/do on my network.I have to say, I thought the broadband meter would be neat.  However, it turns out that I never even look at it.  I find no need for this right now although if I had kids, I think it would be more important.Anyway, I have had one reset issue since setting up the router within the first couple of days.  Since then, everything has been smooth sailing.  I like that it keeps up with my phones, wireless data, and wired data requirements, often at the same time, with very little extra interaction.  Set-it and forget-it is the way a router should be and I find it is the case with this router.

this wireless router was recommended by a 'computer geek' friend of mine.  it cost a little more than i originally wanted to spend but i am glad i did.  have it working with at&t universe. i went from a 25 foot cord to wireless.  works well throughout the house including the bedroom which is upstairs and the furthest point from the router.  i have not done any online games but no problems watching movies (slashcontrol).highly recommend.

I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before I bought this router.  The router lives up to its hype for the wireless capabilities.  I have full strength throughout my house and outside.  Set-up was fast and easy.  I highly recommend this product.

I got a refurbished item but works like brand new !!! I was able to update the firmware with no trouble. Make sure that when doing the updates the pc or laptop must be wired to your router. To fully use the 5ghz band you need have a dual band network adapter too.
This is a great product. It may be possible that, based on some of the negative reviews, I got a good one. In any case, I recommend.
This is a great router to use for Online Gaming for the xbox 360. No Problems at all getting online an no lag problems..

Purchased this unit after Linksys Wireless N router died after giving considerable problems for nearly 2 years.  This unit installed with little trouble and, after setting up the wireless security, I went through my house and reset all of old wireless devices (three PS3's, one Wii, a lap top and one desktop).  So far so good and hopefully it just keeps working as it is now and doesn't have all of the random unreliability that the Linksys did.
This router is everything I was looking for in a router. It has a usb for a network drive and it is dual band. Works like they said it should.

My first wireless network, and I was nervous about picking the right router. I'm so glad I got this one! Simple to set up, easy to use, turns my entire house into a wireless network. Love it! Love it! May cost more, but worth every penny.
Excellent price received due to it being a refurbished item!Don't blow off such refurbished products as they work well.

Update: 8-24-2013 -  This router is STILL going. No problems yet!After going through two to three routers per year, on average, I bought this one because a review on Wall St. Journal said this model has the ability to produce a strong signal, and that it's capable, in essence, of shoving the BW hogs out of the way. In fact, this technology was given a thumbs down by the wi-fi 'technology police.' :^) So glad I bought it before they were all gone...

column9: Gig ethernet makes a HUGE difference!
column10: I bought a high speed router that was supposed to be great for streaming media and video games, but it really didn't help at all.  I took it back and bought the WNDR3700, set it up in about 5 minutes, and was able to stream perfect HD from Netflix.  The quality of video is shockingly good (I'm watching 30 Rock via Netflix right now, and if someone walked in the room and didn't know that I was streaming, they would most certainly think that I had just recorded it in on my DVR).  I read several techno-babble-filled posts that  argued that a gig ethernet connection wouldn't make that big of a difference, but in my case, it did.  This won't fix all of your woes-- if you don't have a strong signal coming into your house, this router won't save the day, but if you're like me and had a decent signal that was being distributed by a cruddy router, then you need to buy this product.  I just wish my blu ray player recognized the external storage as a server, but that's Sony's fault, not Netgear's!  GO BUY THIS ROUTER FOR AWESOME STREAMING MEDIA!

I have set up 3 routers in the last month.I have been able to set the router in 15 min, the internet connection is established through a wizard that makes it a no brainer setup. I have set up 3 routers for my friends, 2 out of 3 routers I set up didn't need a wizard they found the internet settings before I got there. All I had to do is to add a password to the Wireless. The range is insignificantly shorter than the Cisco E4200, and I been a true believer in Cisco before, however i just had to return their brand new E4200 due to problem connecting with Time Warner cable. Also a nice features of a netgear routers is the Self router firmware update, All you have to do is to login to your router using the Internet Browser, and it checks for the latest firmware updates.Streams HD Movies to my Seagate media player with Airlink USB adapter with no problems.A bit pricy.

I recently compared this unit with the Cisco E2000 and a Buffalo 'high power' model.  This router blew both completely out of the water.  Transmit power, receive sensitivity, and overall range were incredible.  Unlike the Cisco E2000, this unit is not pretty and will not sit just anywhere in your house without complaints from the aesthetically inclined.  But, if you can afford it and want longer range, this router delivers.Although you can improve this router by installing DD-WRT on it, the router already runs the maximum power supported by the chipset, and so DD-WRT doesn't get you any more range or power than Netgear gives you with the default firmware.  DD-WRT does give you an enhanced feature set and it is relatively easy to install (although harder to uninstall, so make sure you understand how to do it before you do it).If you find your range suffering using this router, I highly recommend that you download a Windows program called inSSIDer.  This will allow you to see all other Wifi devices in your area, and allow you to pick a channel that is clearest.Alternatively, you can just try out channels 1, 6, and 11 and compare them.  Because of the overlapping nature of Wifi channels, you should never use any channel other than 1, 6, or 11 anyway.  For an explanation as to why, do a google search on selecting the correct channel for wifi.If you need longer range than this router delivers, the best bet is to buy two and deploy them both in separate areas in your home.  Connect one to your internet connection (the 'Primary Router').  Turn off the DHCP server on the other (the 'Secondary Router') and set its IP address to a static IP address outside the DHCP range of the Primary Router (try 192.168.1.250).  Set both units to different channels (either 1, 6, or 11, and no others).  Set both to use the same SSID and set both to use the same security method (WPA2 Personal - AES) and the same passphrase.Then connect both together via the LAN ports (using a long ethernet cable or two Homeplug Ethernet Over Powerline Adaptors that you can buy on amazon.com).Viola!  You'll be able to walk through your house streaming music on your laptop or iPod Touch and it will automatically roam from one to the other without missing a beat (seriously).

The prefect router in my opinion. Installed easy on my Mac. Connected and configured in about 15 mins. RANGE IS AMAZING. I get full bars sitting in my driveway and once got about three bars about half a block away from my house. RELIABLE! I would have to reset my old router about once or twice a day. Since getting this router about a month ago I haven't had to touch it once! Dual band, simultaneous reception is flawless also. My Roku box picks it up instantly and I get full HD content without any hiccups.We have watched full HD movies on the Roku while both my wife and I are browsing the net on our iPhone's while at the same time one kid is on the laptop and the other is on my primary (wired) computer. NO LAG, worked beautifully. I recommend this router to anyone.NOTE: This router is incapable of WAKE-ON-LAN over the internet. These routers do not accept magic packets.

I am thrilled with this purchase. Not only was the set up really easy, but I'm never disconnected anymore. I work from home so it's really important that my service is fast and uninterrupted.. the Netgear Router has made working at home more fun and is so efficient.
I just got this yesterday and it was a breeze to install. It works great with my PS3. I will definitely continue buying Netgear stuff if they keep offering quality and easy setup like this.

I had an old d-link 624 extreme-G that in its old age would quit on me every 10 minutes. So I changed it to Edimax BR6574 N with gigabit ports. It also dropped connections a lot. Then I changed it to the netgear 3700. Much better.1.Stable: the 3700 is rock solid in its performance. I thought maybe having a 2.4 Ghz phone in the room was the reason for the dropped connections in the former two routers, but the 3700 seems indifferent to interference.2.2. Fast: Copying a 7 GB movie file wirelessly from my computer to the NAS drive took 23 minutes with the D-link 624 G, 13 minutes with the Edimax N, and 7 minutes with the Netgear 3700.3.Fast: The 5Ghz network gives a transmit rate of 270-300. The 2.4Ghz b/g/n network transmit rate is 130 on N.4.Versatile: I configured 3 networks to work simultaneously: 5 Ghz for video streaming, 2.4 Ghz for general use and a 2.4 Ghz network for guests. This way they don't step on each other's toes.5.Video streaming: On the D-link it was next to impossible. Hiccups, stuck picture, etc. On the Edimax N it was better, with only occasional hiccups. On the Netgear 3700 it's perfect. Not one lost frame. The configuration lets you tick 'enable video network' in the 5GHz to ensure smooth video streaming.6.Range: the 5 Ghz range is shorter than the 2.4 Ghz N, but is better for video at not-too-far a range. The 2.4 Ghz range is as good as the Edimax and far better than the D-Link.7.Easiest setup: You don't need the installation CD. Just type [...] and you get the router configuration screen divided to 3 parts: The left part is the menu. The middle part is where you configure the different things. The right part is a detailed guide that explains every configuration variable in easy language. If you're not sure how to configure something, just read the adjacent explanation on the right part of the screen. It's the best laid out configuration scheme of any router I tested. No need to be tech savvy and no more guesswork.Sometimes you may type the address and be redirected to Netgear's website. In this case type [...] and you'll get back into the router configuration. Just in case, once you're in the router configuration, bookmark it in your browser and you'll never be redirected away again.8.I haven't explored all the other features yet, but seems I don't need them.9.I bought it for $149.99 but the price dropped since last month to $129.99. They are getting ready for the new models - 3800 and the 450MBps model. But I don't need any more bells and whistles than the 3700.

Great router, had a Linksys before and could only get one bar upstairs. Couldnt play xbox 360 live and be on the computer at same time. I hooked this up plug and play, very easy and behold 5 bars upstairs can run both Xbox 360 and computer at same time. Running 2 Xbox live wireless, 3 wireless computers and wireless Kindle nothing has slowed down abit.

I bought this router as a replacement/upgrade from my previous router which was a D-Link DIR-615.  The difference between the two is like night and day.  I was constantly losing the signal with the D-Link.  I run my iPod Touch and Wii gaming systems off of it.  This Netgear router was super easy to set up and it hasn't dropped the signal once since installing it. It's been about a month now.  My iPod and Wii are immediately connected when I activate those features.  It was set up and forget with this router.  It will be nothing but Netgear for me from now on!

column9: The Wireless Router of the West
column10: I had a Netgear Wireless Router before the surge of the house power went on and off several times one day and blew my router. So I had been so pleased with Netgear that I wanted to stay with that brand.I found this N600 Dual Band router and felt it offered great features for a good price. I purchased it and am glad I did. This is a great wireless router. I was expecting to experience a bit of difficulty getting it set up as my last two routers (one linksys - a pain to set up and the netgear with a little better set up than linksys)were a bit of a pain to get working. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the simplicity of the setup. I practically plugged it in and it works. Following the setup guide everything went smoothly. My Macbook began working with either the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequencies with no problems.I then began setting up our Windows Vista. I've had a little more problem with this system staying connected, but I cannot contribute it to the wireless router. I'm thinking it's possibly the wireless mini card installed in the Windows system. But when the system recognizes the wireless, it works great.Adding wireless printers and other devices are a snap. Just begin the setup, push the 'Push and Connect' button and it does everything else for you. Fast and easy. I had my whole network up and running within 45 minutes. It was great!The connection speed is very fast and works well when I have to VPN into work when I work at home.This was a wise and sound purchase and I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fast router that is easy to install and use.

This product doubles our existing range on our wireless. My daughter has a room in the attic upstairs and she used to not be able to receive a proper signal up there. Now she can easily use her laptop, xbox 360, and ps3 without a single complaint. My favorite feature, is that this specific device creates two separate bandwidths increasing the number of devices we can support with our internet. We have Charter, unfortunately, and they've cut their services by over half.  You now have to pay an extra 25 on top of the already high costing internet to receive the same speed you had before. With this we don't have to pay for the upgrade, and we can still use all of our electronics. No more computers being dropped because of low bandwidth, no more stalling on xbox live. Just fantastic. I'm thinking we might be able to switch to a more cost effective company for internet soon and still be able to run multiple devices.

I have Verizon FiOS and the horrible Actiontec router that goes along with it.  Since switching to FiOS a few years ago, I've had wi-fi connectivity issues with several laptops, hand-held games (Nintendo DSi), Apple products (iPods & iPad), smart phones, wireless printers, and NAS devices.  Obviously, the FiOS router is pretty useless alone.  I replaced the Actiontec router with this Netgear router and setup my local network on the Netgear.  So far, it has been wonderful.  Lightning fast wi-fi performance and everything connects reliably.  I have not encountered a single connectivity issue yet.  I run all of the aforementioned devices as well as two large LED televisions and a wi-fi enabled home theater system through the Netgear and everything works flawlessly together.  The dual band functionality works fine and the guest network is a great feature for providing internet connectivity to visitors without opening up your local network to them.  My kids play several online games on computer and PS3.  They have not reported any problems with the new router.  So far, the WNDR3700 has solved several wi-fi connectivity issues in my household.  I recommend this router to anyone looking for a decent router, but I especially recommend it if you currently rely on the Actiontec FiOS router.  Trust me, the difference is night and day.

I got this to replace my aging Linksys 54G, which was limiting the throughput from a 50 megabit/sec Docsis 3 cable feed.It allowed the download speed from capable sites to better than double to 3.5 megabytes/sec, while still retaining QoS supervision for my IP phone.Do note that I did not use the wireless capability at all, but rather am feeding my apartment cables through an associated MoCA box.Thus far, the product has been exemplary, unobtrusive and it just works.

This was a step up from the router I had, plays COD Black Opts very well.Phone, Roku, as well as laptop found and added with no problems.NAS Server hooked up with no problems at all.Range is very good complete home is well within reach, retaining good ping everywhere as well. Visitor, gives guest a place to hook up without being on the main, very happy with this product.

column9: Just replaced my old wireless router with this...
column10: Had an old Linksys WRT54GS and wanted a router with N600 and dual band capability plus a USB storage connection. This router fit the bill and it's the first NetGear router I've owned. Very easy setup if you are familiar with wireless routers. After configuring I tested my iPhone's connection to it, just like before (other reviews mentioned that they had to reconnect these devices to the new network, not so here). In other words, it's easy to replace an existing wireless network with this baby. Then I set up the 5Ghz network and the guest network, easy. Connected a 1.2TB USB drive to the router and customized the share info, again very easy. Never even opened the instructions, just glanced at the back of them while still wrapped in plastic to see the admin password (password). Did all setup through the browser of course (I never use the wizard, ick..)My hard-wired computers didn't have any problems connecting to the new router, it was seamless and transparent. All in all about the easiest wireless setup I've done. I have an XBox 360, Wii, DirecTV DVR, two desktops, several laptops, two iPhones, and expected at least some issues. Nope, it just worked. Very happy. I didn't grade the connection strength because honestly I don't know if it is better yet.

column9: Worth the price and works with Comcast!
column10: I was looking for a high-end router that works out of the box with Comcast.WNDR3700 lived upto its price and review.The setup was seamless and I was up and running on a couple of laptops and PS3. Yet to explore advanced features of the router. The wireless signal is excellent in all the rooms.

This Netgear router has solved my connectivity issues with my Playstation 3. My previous router would disconnect me from PSN network and the only way to re connect was to power down the router.It has given me zero problems with multiple devices being used simultaneously.2 iPhones, a Lap Top, 2 Xbox 360's and a PS3.Set up took less than 20 minutes for all devices. It will also auto update when you log onto the router.Please note: If you get a connection error when the router is searching for updates, unplug it and then plug it back in and this should correct the problem.My signal for Streaming Netflix to my Xbox in the bedroom has also improved and the lag is completely gone.

column9: Works as advertised, absolutely no problems.
column10: A little trouble setting it up but their help desk got me through it. Using it for over two years now with no problems.

column9: Review of Netgear WNDR3700 Wireless Router
column10: My Netgear router has been installed for about 30 days so all of my impressions are based on the initial installation and setup plus only 30 days of use.It was very easy to install and set up. I am a relativly low tech person so this was important to me. This router replaced a Linksys wireless router which didn't have enough 'punch' to provide a usable signal to my basement home theater which is two floors below the router location. With the Netgear router I now have a strong signal there and I am very pleased with all aspects of the WNDR3700 Netgear router. It has been flawless so far.

column9: Great router, if you don't buy it refurbished
column10: I purchased a WNR3500v2 router at Best Buy and it was dead in 11 mos. Best Buy allowed me, with proof of purchase, to trade in my old router and pay the difference on the new one. The new one is the WNDR3700 and this thing is a beast. After reading many of the negative reviews of this device, I simply don't agree...unless you bought a refurbished unit. This router has so many options and so many configurations that it's impossible not to like. Sure every now again electronics go bad. The speed is also great when you pair it with a DOCSIS 3.0 modem. I've got it attached to a Motorola SB6120 surfboard extreme modem and it's blazing fast. I'm able to stream 720p movies from my laptop to my Xbox 360 to my tv while my wife watches Netflix on a different laptop and there is no freezing, buffering..waiting at all. One small piece of advice that makes a huge difference in the performance of this router....Don't use a standard surfboard or other modem with it, you must use a DOCSIS 3.0 capable modem. If you don't, your speeds will suffer largely by comparison...I'm talking a difference in 20-30 Mpbs.Pros-Blazing Fast speed in both bands (2.4 and 5)-alternate on/off buttons for wireless transmission and router (either turn off the signal or the entire router)-Ports recognize if there are no Cat cables attached to it and adjust power accordingly to each individual port. You can set transmission power in the online configuration (25, 50, 75 or 100 percent)-4 x Gigabit ports-Websetup is easy, even if you've never set up a router before. Do what most people do, open a separate window if you have questions on how to configure it and search the WWW.Cons-Really haven't found any yet, it does what I need it to do.The one thing that will make the biggest difference in the performance of this router is the modem that you have attached. DO NOT USE ANYTHING LESS THAN A DOCSIS 3.0 capable modem.If you have any additional questions email me at halo_snooze@yahoo.com

column9: Big improvement over a Belkin N+
column10: I bought this router to replace a Belkin N+ that was consistently dropping our laptop connections around the house in addition to have issues streaming Netflix. Finally, when downloading PS3 game updates, the Network would slow to a halt for the other devices.The step up was extremely easy.  Had all devices hook up within 15 minutes. We have 3 laptops, Blue-Ray player for Netflix, a PS3, and xbox360.  Netflix downloads are significantly better, as are PS3 gaming downloads. No more dropping connections, or slow network when downloading PS3 game updates.  Very pleased.  Well worth the extra money. Hopefully, it will be reliable. Time will tell.

column9: It surprisingly increased my wired speed.
column10: I had a cable modem feed a Vonage device feed a Linksys WRT54G to which I had both wired and wireless devices connected.The WRT54G had been a reliable beast until recently where reset-requiring interruptions became more frequent (1/month).I decided to rewire with this device, and surprisingly found that my webpages were responding noticeably faster (wired).  I was quite pleased.  The WRT54G is 10x slower for wired connections at 100Mbps, but I just didn't think it would have made a difference since my connection is 25Mbps.  Well, it did, whether it's the boost in MBPS or otherwise.  Perhaps there was a ping boost as well.  It is pleasantly faster for the browsing experience.  File downloads have identical speed.It was absolutely plug and play, and I was also able to put my Vonage behind my router, something I was never able to do with the Linksys.  Though I'm sure it was possible, I was never able to do it despite the college effort.  With this guy, everything just worked the first time.I had 2 laptops, a network switch, a vonage device, a Wii, a BluRay, a TV 2 PCs and a DVR hooked up to the network and rewired in under an hour.  It would have taken half that if I were better at cutting and crimping my own ethernet cables.

I was doing my research to buy a new router.  I noticed in the December issue of MaximumPC, they tested several wireless routers and the WNDR3700 came out on top.After reading through 35 pages at the NetGear forum  ([...])  They have determined that the WNDR3700 and the WNDR37AV is the exact same router!Apparently NetGear changed the name to appeal to a different market set since the 37AV mentions 'Video and Gaming' in it's description.  They even sell for the same price on Amazon.  A v2 is supposedly in the works but appears to be several months away

column9: This router is a Class Act. Highly recommended.
column10: I recently upgraded to this Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR3700. The installation took about 10 minutes. It works like a charm. The N-level connection worked with existing equipment right off the bat. The security setup was close to intuitive and quite simple. The Gigabit connections to connect to my desptop (or laptop if I so desire) work seemlessly. Not a single hitch. Perefect from the time I opened the box. I sue the router in conjuction with a Logitech Squeezebox Duet for streaming music. It works like a dream. No breaks. Not Wi-Fi interference on VoIP phones or other Wi=Fi connections. This is a five star recommendation.

column9: Easy To Set Up & Works Great
column10: I was little hesitant about spending so much for a router after reading some of the bad reviews, but am glad I pulled the trigger on this purchase.I didn't use the set up disk, but the set up was really easy. The user interface is easy to navigate and understand during set up, and I was able to set everything up including a guest network in under 20 minutes.I have been using this router for about 3 weeks and have not had a single issue or had to rest it.I am running 1 desk top, 3 laptops, 1 PS3, 1 Xbox, plus I allow my neighbor to use the guest network.It faster than any router I have owned.

column9: Easy Installation, Worked Like a Champ
column10: I have Windows XP and finally decided to take the step to wireless, even though I still have a hard-wire LAN in my house.  This router had four wired LAN connections (exactly the number I needed), and it allows my son to use his wireless laptop while home from the Army.  We even set up all our Blackberry phones to use the wireless for browsing at home...even though I don't pay for T-Mobile's Internet access.Installation from the CD was easy and it also gives you the option to update your firmware to the latest version.  My speed has been good but it's early to tell.  My next step is to acquire a wireless adapter for my Blu Ray player to use the 5 Ghz speed for accessing Netflix movies (once I have an account).  That will be the real test for streaming video.But overall this router is working as advertised and easy to set up.  It even guides you through creating a wireless access point, including a good password so others cannot access your router.Many of the reviews are older so make sure you take that into account.  I believe many of the issues older than 6-12 months have been fixed in the latest version you can get in the stores.  Good luck!

This is a replacement for a Linksys router. I did screen shots of the Port Forwarding, Address Reservation, etc. pages before shutting the Linksys down. Did not use the Netgear CD at all; the router connected to the ISP without any help on my part. Just went through the menu items one at a time, and 30 minutes later I was enjoying faster throughput with my wired and wireless devices. Wireless PCs throughout my medium-size condo are all reporting 300 speed.The dual-band and guest-network features are very useful and are easy to set up.Haven't tried the USB connection and probably won't, as I have a Synology DiskStation.The firmware upgrade process is a smooth one.I have about 15 devices with MAC addresses in my home and they're all performing perfectly.This is a really, really good router and I'm glad I bought it.

Installed my network after Christmas as planned.  Went flawlessly.  Set up router via web interface instead of CD and this way was probably as easy as using CD.  Also plugged in my 1TB WD backup drive so all 3 of my computers can access it.  Downloads from USB drive are good although the uploads to it could be faster.  Also connected HP Photosmart C6280 and that connection also works great.  Really working as expected of course I did research quite a few routers before purchasing this one and it is living up to my expectations.Only thing which is very minor is they could have included mounting screws with it as I had to search around to find just the right ones.  I chose to mount it on the wall rather than taking the chance it would get knocked off the desk.I would recommend this router to anyone although a novice may want to use the CD to set it up.
Speedy delivery as promised!  Product was easy to setup and connect to my modem.  So far, it surpasses my expectations for reliability

I don't usually review things, but given all the problems I've had in the past installing, configuring and getting other routers to run properly, this one was a breeze.  It is super easy to install, has excellent range (I have it in an office and through 2 rooms (4 walls) it connects to a wireless adapter and runs the full 20Mbs we get from the cable line), and is very reliable. It is pricy for a router, but considering the quality, worth it.

Set up was simple,and quick. I had other routers in the past always seemed to have some problems setting it up and connecting at times. I want a router that could stream movies to my tv, while I was enjoyinng  some online poker,and my kids where playing farmville, or goofinng off with there ipod touch. this router has great range ,easy set up annd I am able to all of the thing I wanted too. well worth the money.I would recomend this to a friend for sure

I bought this router as an upgrade to the Linksys Dual Band (A+G) Wireless router I had been using previously.  I have been connecting many more devices to my home network and reliability and bandwidth were becoming issues.  I was streaming Netflix to both my Xbox and Blu-Ray player and was beginning to see consistent dropped connections from the Linksys.  So it was time to start upgrading to the new wireless N band of spectrum.  Issue was I still had several devices which were capable of wireless G.  Liking the dual band option of the Linksys, I went in search of something similar for a new router with the new N band included.  I looked across all the main networking equipment providers (Linksys, Netgear, Buffalo, etc.) and settled on the Netgear WNDR3700.  All I can say is that I am not disappointed in my decision!!!This router is great.  It has dual band wireless (N & G) as well as a USB port for connecting a external drive which can be shared over the network.  Amazingly enough, this is a tremendous feature which should not be overlooked!  Setting this up is a snap and I now I have access to my movies, music and files from any computer in the house!The router performs very well.  The N band signal strength could be better but with a simple upgrade to N band wireless adapters it performs much better.  I am no longer dropping the connection when streaming on the N band to my devices as well as maintaining a connection on G band computers or other devices (i.e. my son can watch movies on my Xbox streaming Netflix while I continue to work on my laptop upstairs...  this was not the case with my old Linksys).If you are thinking of upgrading to wireless N (and you should), then this is the router for you!

My old router was dying once every few days and with wifi movie streaming on our gaming console, it was really time to upgrade to something more reliable.  I wanted reliable simultaneous dual band support and so far I have only needed to reset it once in the past month.I was annoyed with the configuration of DHCP ranges and static DHCP addresses (it deleted the static address mappings when I changed the DHCP range to no longer cover those addresses in an apparently futile attempt to segregate known from dynamic addresses by CIDR block) but aside from that everything else was fairly straightforward.The range is solid throughout my two story drywall house and out to the back yard...much better than my old router, but I have moved the unit antenna position to be more favorable so that isn't exactly a fair comparison.Anyway, no complaints to date, which is more than I can say for the previous unit.

Replaced a Linksys WRT54G with a powered antenna booster with this router.  Quite frankly the Linksys with the booster had a stronger signal.
