However I wanted to get a dual band to set up a home theater system with wireless internet access since I don't have a ethernet connection close to the TV.  I did not bother with the installation walk through and went directly to setup by entering the usual IP 192.168.1.1.  Setup was straight forward with basic and advanced screens and nice help on the right of the screen.My only complaint, and it most likely is not the routers fault, is if I use maximum power of 300 MBS I get dropped connections with my wireless in the second floor office.  Dialing back to 130 MBS did the trick and the connection is rock solid now.  I really did not need the 300 MBS since I am not competing with 25 other routers in an apartment type building.I like the DLNA feature but for some reason the manual is nearly silent on it.  Being able to hookup a 500 MB hard drive to the USB is nice once you transfer files you want to share to it.  I did not utilize the parental controls that interface with OPEN DNS.  Don't have kids and do not need it.Lastly pay attention to the manual and do not place the router on or near a file cabinet.  I had it placed in a closet on top of one.Would get signal strength of 2 or 3 bars upstairs.  I moved it out of the closet and away from the file cabinet and now get consistent 5 bars in my upstairs office.  I suppose the Linksys with the powered antenna booster overcame that problem by blasting such a strong signal that it did not matter.Highly recommended.
The product work great, and the setup my other computer using the Netgear bridge was fairly easy. This product was replacement/upgreade because my other Netgear went out-no power at all.

column9: dd-wrt makes this the perfect WAP!
column10: I bought this Wireless router with the full intention of using dd-wrt instead of the included operating system, so  I can't say much about the included OS, but as a hardware device, I get very strong signal all over the house, and it works flawlessly.

column9: Solid. Have had many wifi routers. This is the most trouble-free
column10: Once every few months it might drop for a few minutes, but nothing like the other routers I have owned (even the junky Netgear WNDR 3300).Has separate networks for G and N, as well as 'Guest' networks for each, which have tunable bandwidth. Pretty clever for friends and family or just sharing the wifi love with pedestrians.I keep it in the basement, and even the N signal makes it to the second floor of the house with 3 bars of signal. Nice.

good fast router .. the shared hard drive\media server works great . tends to get a little conjested at times and need to be reset but with the amount of data i transfer some times that should be expected i suppose type n connections are clean and clear and have fewer dropped or lost packets than most .. installation was very easy one of the few i have found that could easly be plug and go with default setting if desired

As tech is changing everyday i wanted to upgrade my linksys router i bought 3 years ago to something advance that can held up test of time for couple of years .I did extensive research but always there were couple of reviews that`ll bash my pick of router so badly that i end up doubting it.Reluctantly i decided to give Maximum PC choice a go as they named it best router twice within a year for Home/small business use and i am glad i trusted`em.During continuous usage for a month in hybrid environment of 5GH and 2.4 GH it really do justice with both signals.I gave 5 stars to most questions amazon askedEase of installation  5/5Ease of setup  5/5 ( i needed to do nothing -just plugged Ethernet cable and clicked next)Ease of use  5/5Increased range  5/5Speed of connection  5/5

This router has been running 24/7 in my remote vacation home for 6 months now and has not missed a beat.  I stream video on the weekends from Vudu and monitor the home with multiple remote web cams.  My wife and I are both actively VPN'd into our offices while all watching movies as well.  Has not gone down once.  Video streaming never skips a beat.  I don't use the N Band, only G but finding a router that doesn't intermittently crash is rare and this one was well worth the extra money.

Just got this for x-mas, so have only been using it for 1 week.  Installation was rather straight forward, no problems.  So far, it seems to be all it says.  We definitely noticed an immediate improvement in speed and quality, from our old router!

I resherched alot of wifi routers and picked this one based on perfromance options and reviews from other web sites. I am very happy with it, setup was simple and quick and the signal is great anywhere in the house even with with several devices running.

column9: Best home wireless router for the price.
column10: I wanted to find a router to replace my aging D-Link which kept dropping the signal.Did some research and found the Netgear. Best purchase I could have made.Super easy to setup and get running. Had all my gear running in about 15 minutes.Desktop, laptop and smartphones.up and running with excellent speed and access.

I have had the same router in my house since moving into my house, Never any problems with it. Recently Upgraded the Firmware to Open-WRT so i could fake a Nintendo Zone in my house (3ds Streetpass) and it seems more responsive.Only real issue with this router is the USB port is SLOW like molasses in winter. I had a Hard drive hooked up to it at first, but it took just as long to transfer a mp3 song to it as it does to play it, so don't bother with that, if you want NAS, there are MANY excellent options for around $100.

Had this router for a little over a month, works great, have not had to reboot it once.  That is in contrast to the Linksys router that this is replacing.  In Linksys defense, the router was probably 6 years old.  But this Netgear was easy to install and i haven't had to worry about it at all.

I won't elaborate on the technical aspects of this unit. I will focus on simple things that matter. The unit is the most reliable router I have ever owned. I have gone through 7 routers in the last 2 years. I finally found one that will work as specified and not die on me. Belkin has awesome range and speed but requires frequent authentication which severs the connection for a few seconds - very bad for streaming services! Linksys couldn't make a good product if they had all the R&D funds in the world - daily resets to maintain fast speeds. The only good Linksys products are the ones that have dd-wrt mods (3rd party hacks). 2Wire is good, but not fast and you won't get more than a year out of it.I've had this router for many months now and it is working flawlessly.This router is:FastReliableTrouble-freeFeature rich - many user options
Product was as advertised. Arrived early, in brand new condition. Setup and operation worked flawlessly. I recommend the product and the retailer J&R.

I got this router for really two main features, the speed and more importantly the usb port which gives you a real easy way to have a network storage. It was really easy to set up. Three laptops, one desktop, a PS3 a TV and two droids can all access the same drive. It's easy to dump the vacation pictures on the harddrive and then view them on the TV wirelessly, instantly. Great too for sharing Itunes library over the netwwork. Have the app on my phone that turns it into a remote for itunes. Nice for summer BBQ, I can control itunes while out in the yard. There are a lot of other features that I do not use. Aside from that, it's been up and running for about 6 monthes and had never failed. Set it and forget it. About the only thing that is a little goofy, is the blue leds on the side. I'm not sure that they are of any use, but I guess some people like a lot of blinky-lights. I don't so I covered my with electrical tape.

After using multiple Linksys routers, this is a very welcome upgrade.  I've used Linksys for quite a while (both stock and dd-wrt firmware).  Previously, in an attempt to save a few $$, I used several routers bridged together to get coverage across our house.  This resulted in a 'mostly stable' network, however under heavy load I would experience drops and loss of connectivity.  Our use is what I would say is typical family use (Inet browsing, streaming music, streaming movies from netflix).Approximately 3 months ago, I upgraded to the N600.  Since then our network reliability has increased significantly.  No drops, great throughput.  The range is much better than what I would have expected.  I'd estimate that the range is 2x of what we had previously.Pros:- Great Range- Good throughputCons:- A little priceyClosing thoughts:I've read where these units start to fail after 6 months of service.  Here's to hoping this issue has been corrected.UPDATE 5/1/2013:Well our beloved N600 gave up the ghost this month.  Our 2.4GHz wireless network started dropping out.  The 5GHz network continued to work fine.  I ended up going with another brand for better VPN features.

This router is amazing. It only took 20 min to set up and it is working perfectly. IT not only increased my wireless speed, but with the Giga ports my wired LAN network is much faster as well. The best part about this router is the dual network ability. You can set up one network for some wireless devices and another network for others! buy this router!

column9: Probably the Fastest and Most Powerful Router on the Market
column10: This is quite possibly the fastest and most powerful router on the market today.My laptop is constantly receives a connection of 300 Mbps throughout my entire house.My PS3 has a lag free connection for games and easily streams HD movies from my PC with this router.This is Netgear's top of the line router. If you need speed, this is the final word.

I had my doubts I could install this, considering I had no knowledge of wireless networking.  Ten minutes after I began the installation process using the supplied CD, it was up and running great.  My router is used for a wireless network consisting of a Internet-ready Blu-Ray disc player, laptop and a Vonage VoIP router.  Like any modern-day electronic device, check for the free firmware upgrades in the beginning to reduce known operational issues.  The device may be recently purchased, but who knows how long ago it left the factory.

Upgrade from an old semi-reliable Linksys Wireless G classic.  We had to reboot our old Linksys once a day (5 years old), so I upgraded our network to the Rangemax 3700.  I couldn't be happier, this is the next 'ole' reliable'  It's fast, has plenty of ports (4 = enough), and exceptional when streaming video through internet or network.  The network storage was a great addition from the old school linksys, however, I expect that in this generation of routers.  Honestly, in my opinion routers should have several USB connectors for shared devices, but I won't dog it for that.  For your basic wired/ wireless needs this thing definitely has it, and works very well for xbox and ps3.  I have the xbox wired and it's perfect, I'm the fastest of all my friends and live typically picks me to host.  ps3 I only use wireless and I don't play online with it usually, but no hang ups.  I reboot the router about once every couple weeks just because a fresh restart is needed every once in awhile.  It's pricey but I believe this is a much better product than it's cheaper competition.  A friend has taken back two cheaper ones and bought one of these instead and liked it as well, and he said he should have gotten it in the first place....  I almost sound like a Netgear rep... but he took back 1 of the cheaper netgears.

I purchased this because of a review in Maximum PC (Dec 2010). I am not an expert but this truly was easy and for the features you get DEFINITELY worth the price. I have a very vast cable connection and there seems to be not much of a difference between hard wire to wireless speeds. I am able to connect my PS3, TV and 3 laptops with this router with no problem at all. The whole setup (basic) took approximately 20 min. the CD that comes with it takes you through setup step by step. I would recommend this device with out reservations.

I've used a number of routers over the years and have some experience with wireless networks, this router is by far the best on the market. Rock solid 802.11N coverage on 2.4GHZ and okay on the 5.8Ghz channel; which is expected considering the nature of the frequency.The guest network feature is also fantastic, as it allows you to provide temporary access but not give out your WPA key to anyone else.The router is also rated highly by [...]

I was called upon to help setup a wireless network for the in laws so that their son would be able to game wirelessly on his PS3 while providing internet to a workhorse desktop. I had my eye on the top notch Buffalo router since there were HUGE thumbs ups from DD-WRT aficionados and figured I would give that a try. This ended in headache so I attempted to go for the same setup that I use for my own home which is a Linksys E3000 and that also manifested another headache. Having trouble with Netgear time and time again in the past I was reluctant to give them another go but did some research and they gave this router fairly high ratings for gaming. Setup was really easy and I had the little dude connected and ready to go within 30 minutes (may have been shorter but I fit a snack and a restroom break here and there). So far they've had no complaints with it going for a good few months or so. I was so impressed with Netgear's performance that I purchased a network repeater to aid my linksys' dead spots and it works well also.Thumbs up Netgear

I had a linksys WRT300N which cost me more than the Netgear a few years back. It never worked right even after firmware upgrades and all the tweaks i could have possibly made. So after i bought the Netgear it was like night and day. This router has fantastic range and it's a true dual band wireless N router. Some other Dual band routers will only do 5ghz N and the other 2.4ghz G. This is something important to look at when buying a Dual band router, and is a feature easily confused with less expensive routers. It has many features for advanced users but can also be easily setup by a first time user. I've already recommended this to two friends and they love it. I recommend it for you too.

column9: Best router i have ever owned
column10: Super easy and super strong signal. 2 things that i really like about it.1. I can easily decrease the wifi strength. I have the power on 25%, still the signal is strong in my 1000 sq ft apartment. And I dont have to worry about the signal leaking over to other apartments.2. I can turn off the wifi at a button and dont have to worry about people trying to get through my password.I have had it for over a year now and its still the best out there! what are you waiting for? buy it!

Having owned several lesser quality routers I was of the opinion that no router was worth > $100.  I was wrong this router is much better in terms of setup, functionality, reliability and connection quality than anything I had used before.The only negative I have about the product is the lack of good long distance range on the 5GHZ band....something I knew prior to purchasing.
This Netgear router is super fast and definitely a step up from my 6 year old netgear router. I gained the dual band capabilities, along with more coverage! Great product!

Fastest router I had up-to-date.  I had this for a while now, but decided to do a review.  It has NEVER dropped its range or signal.  If you want to do hardcore gaming, home-business, or just a constant user, this router is just perfect. Netgear always has quality products.  And Amazon just makes them a whole lot better with price cuts, free shipping and no tax (California). Amazon+Netgear=Beastly products and prices.
Installed everything and in under 10 minutes everything was up and running perfectly. Love Netgear!
For some reason my Linksys just got lousy. This Netgear solved the coverage issues in all areas of the house.

Very pleased with this unit.  Haven't tried the attached storage option, but range is better and it has many new features compared to my older Cisco WRT54G.  Would recommend to anyone.  Online reviews indicated greater range in a variety of environments compared to the newest Cisco Linksys E-3000.

Going to be short on this, researched 29 top contenders and narrowed it down to Apple Airextreme-too much and don't tell you it is better to have MAC, Dlink- comparible model $250, and Cisco- again to much. So, the real clincher was value for the dollar and this router works very well and sets up in minutes, and the extras are a bonus.
Very happy with it. Works great. Easy to install. Love the USB port for my external drive.

I purchased the Netgear WNDR3700 to replace a failing D-link DIR-615. The D-link developed a intermittent disconnection from the cable modem. That was happening about 3 to 5 times a day.I have owned Linksys and D-link products in the past and I planned to get another D-link, but my last 3 D-link units all developed some kind of component failure, so I decided to look for another vendor. I don't hate D-link products and most vendors are using Atheros or Broadcom components anyhow. I just wanted to try another vendor.I choose the WNDR3700 for the fact that it supported 802.11a,b,g,&n. There is a lot of WiFi routers in our neighborhood and I wanted 5Ghz to have cleaner spectrum over the very busy 2.4Ghz spectrum.After 30+ days of usage the WNDR3700 has performed great. The 5Ghz shorter range is great, it covers in the house, but I can hardly detect it outside the house:)An added feature is the guest WiFi zone. I have used this a couple of times when we have friends and family staying over. It allows me to give them internet access to laptop's, iPod touch, & a couple of Nintendo DSi's without me give them my WPA security code or have access to our computers over the router.Overall this has been a very good router. The only con I would have to ask for a little more internet security options, but if I find that its not good enough I'll look at DD-WRT or others to replace the Netgear operating software. Until then I'm happy with this router.

column9: The BEST router I've ever had!!!!!
column10: I can't believe how easy this router is to set up and use, The install disc work perfectly the first time and the instructions and prompt were clear and concise. I have heard some people had to use tech support to get up and running, But I had no such trouble.. Great device I'd recommed it to anyone. The only negitive is the price,,, I would be nice if it was 25% cheaper.

The router was shipped promptly and arrived in excellent condition.  I plugged it in and in a matter of minutes was up and running.  The signal is great for my wireless Roku - it runs like a champ.  Streaming videos and tx large files are fast on my laptop.  The price was a little on the high side, but you tend to get what you pay for - and this is quality.  I have a 500 gig external hard drive plugged into the USB port.  The software has a tool to make setting it up easy.  Right now all I store on it are pictures.  Actually I haven't tried to stream any videos through that USB port, but I have no problems accessing the files.Also - I recently changed from phone dsl to cable.  All I had to do was press the reset button on the router and let it and the cable modem figure it out.  Once the units established a connection I simply went in and set up my encryption and passwords for my wireless network.  Piece of cake.

This router was a snap to set up and works great! The dual band capability is a life saver for me since I have several computers running of the router + a Tivo that streams movies from Netflix. Setting up the Tivo on the 5GHz band and the rest of the computers on the 2.4Ghz band has eliminated a lot of issues with congestion. Also, other routers were bothered with too many WiFi connections (sometimes 8+ with wireless printers and all...), but this router never flinches. Highly recommended!

Excellent wireless router, used here in a multiple Mac household, with some external web feed device as well. No issues with installation, setup, ease of use, reliability, or range. I marked down 'Features' to a 4/5 because the sharable external USB server is slowww and limited to WIndows-type filename characters. But as a router it's very nice, and we are able to have the older computers' G network on 2 GHz separate from the newer machines' N network on 5 GHz, so the old ones don't drag down the new The guest open net is a nice touch too.

Had this router for the past 3 weeks and this thing works great.  I did have some problems with the set-up (for some reason, when I logged into the router, it asked if I wanted to update the firmware--when I selected 'yes' it can't connect then sent me to the website and not the router--odd), but after that, it has been running great.  No freezes, no lock-ups, speed has been great.  Fast and reliable, what else do you really need in a wi-fi router?

We love this router. We have Comcast internet and this router is wirelessly running a PS3, Xbox 360, Wii , Panasonic 3d blu ray player(wireless N), a Panasonic Plasma TV, an Asus gaming laptop (wireless N) and an iphone on our home network.With all electronics listed above we have never had a connectivity issue, a problem setting up, or speed issues that have anything to do with the router ( any and all problems are because of Comcast). It is simply the best I have used and haven't had a single problem with it. I would highly recommend this product.

I've been looking for a new Wireless router for several weeks.  I evaluated the other Draft N wireless routers that are available, and while the WNDR3700 router was more expensive than most of the other options, I was impressed by the reviews and feature set of this router, so I decided to buy it.  I am very impressed.  This is a great router.  I am by no means an expert, but I had no problems getting this working.  I set up the 5.0 GHz & 2.4 GHz band frequency channels with WPA keys and connected the desktop and two laptops along with two printers.  I also set up a guest network with a WEP key for the iPods, Netflix, and for friends who come over and want to hook into the internet.  Everything works great!  I also want to eventually buy a NAS hard drive and hook it into the router's USB port for everyone to back up files and store music, movies, etc...  I have been using this router for almost a week, and the signal is rock steady and have not experience the signal highs and lows and drop-outs that we experienced with my last wireless router.  I would highly recommend this router for a no-hassle, very dependable wireless network.  Well worth the money...
I purchased this router 4 one reasons, and that wuz 4 my XBox. It works great!! High Connection, Quick responds time, easy video and audio streaming, and im 2 floors up!!!! Very Very Satisfied!!!

column9: Netgear Dual Band Router - worked out of the box
column10: Router worked well out of the box, easy setup.  Have not tried guest channel feature, interested to see how this would work with an Xbox. Replaced my dying Linksys with outdated software, the Netgear is a much more advanced router. Tried the ReadyShare Fast backup and Storage feature but found it slow.  Might be useful if you were out of USB ports on your PC.

it's easy to install with the self-explained on-line menu. Have been using with for several weeks and have no problems with the router.  The USB network drive feature is great.  All my computers in the network recognize the added USB hard drive. It is little bit pricey for now.  Highly recommended it.

Unit was DOA.  Amazon shipped another immediately.  The replacement has been working great since.I bought this router to replace a Netgear RangeMax240 WPNT834 that was giving spotty connectivity and speed on my 2nd floor.  The WNDR3700 has resolved these issues.

column9: Excellent Choice for iPhone 4 + other wireless/wired computers in a home network
column10: I selected this router after purchasing two new iPhone 4's and finding that they just would not stay connected reliably to my older Netgear W54g unit no matter what I tried with network resets, settings, airplane mode or power on/off tricks.And I'm very happy to share that so far - after 2 weeks - the new Rangemax WNDR3700 has been fantastic.  The iPhones connect immediately to the home wireless network even well outside the front or back door, and stay connected without any problems.  And the connection speed is much, much higher, even with a mixed N and G network of two wireless laptops, a wireless print server, and two wired desktops. The signal strength is excellent, helping to make our home use of the iPhone tremendously easy and productive.Folks researching this router will undoubtably see the many recent positive reviews of the product (as of September, 2010), and read about the router's extensive feature set.  The initial configuration was indeed as easy as others have shared, and downloading the latest firmware was automatic, fast, and painless.  I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for an upgrade to their current wireless router, especially if you have had problems connecting with an iPhone.

Upgrade my D-Link DIR-628 N Router to this. The D-Link was crap, constant dropped connections and the need for reset all the time, and their 'SecureSpot(tm)' technology was seriously embedded, unremoveable spyware. This router is leagues ahead. I've purchased Netgear in the past and don't know why I didn't just stick with them. It's a good looking router, the reboot time is very fast. On a power cycle (off/on) it boots all of the way up in about 30 seconds. The range is ridiculous, I live in an apartment complex, most of which is now covered by this beast's WiFi signal. The 10/100/1000 Wired connection is also amazing along with the 300Mbps wireless N connection, I can transfer large files on the inside of my own network very quickly without the need for USB drives, and all of my devices can stream content with relative ease. The default firmware is probably my only real complaint. It's more than enough for people who just need a day-to-day router and don't attempt to way over-control their technology, but it is very helpful that it allows you to install the Tomato Firmware to it. If you're a tech-savy person I would highly recommend switching to it.

column9: Great router - stability + speed = the key to my happiness
column10: I picked this router up, because I had been using a standard/default router that is distributed through Comcast, which was somewhat unreliable, dropped connections, and was under-performing.  I would hope that Comcast would utilize the newest devices, sporting the latest technology, stability & speeds... but that's wishing for too much from a cable company that's rated about as horribly as Congress's job approval.So, after replacing the older Netgear router (about 4-5yrs old, I believe), I've noticed a great deal better stability, faster speeds, better connectivity & a vast array of options/customizations that I couldn't be happier with.  I certainly made the right decision, as stability & speed were my two concerns.No problems to report thus far and very pleased with my decision.

I just disconnected my previous router (old 80211.b), followed the instructions to set up the router, ran the install CD and voila!, it works.  I bought this based on the advice of my wife's friend, who is a technogeek.  It is not that hard to do with some basic knowledge, like how to plug into a network and how to connect the router to the modem.  Even setting up the network for wireless security was easy to do.

column9: Great speed, so far so good...
column10: Have been using this for about a month now.  I primarily use it as a Wireless Access Point as my providers (ATT - have Uverse) modem has a built in router.  I upgraded as wireless G was no longer helping when pushing HD content from my NAS to my HTPC.  It was a little painful to get this router setup as a Wireless Access Point as Netgear does not provide instructions on how to do such a thing, but doing a few web searches helped me find the information I needed in order to get it setup how I liked.  I paired the router up with a Netgear WNDA3100 adaptor and so far streaming HD content (from my NAS) inside my house has been wonderful.  No longer have jittery video as I did with the wireless G.So far have had nothing but a great experiences after I was able to figure out how to setup the router as a Wirless Access Point.  Would definitely recommend for the performance although depending on your networking experience and  how you would like to use the router, you might need some help setting it up.

column9: Finally, range that matches wired solution
column10: After being frustrated twice, I now have a router that goes the distance and delivers all bar signal as opposed to 40%. Super easy to set-up, with Push and Connect, it does all the hard stuff for you! I am just learning about ReadyShare, can't wait to use to access files while traveling via my Iphone.

column9: I never knew a router could be this good!
column10: I've owned many routers since I started playing with networks, including LinkSys, DLink, Trendnet, and Belkin. I have to say, of all the routers I've EVER owned and used, the Belkin was the worst and this Netgear is the best, head and shoulders above the rest, even eclipsing my previous favorite Linksys. I won't repeat all the technical features of this router, many others have already covered those in great detail and eloquence. I'll just tell you that I have two desktops and 3 laptops hooked up to this router, and in the 6 months that I've owned it, I've never had to reset the router, and never had any interruption to any of my systems. Even in farthest upstairs room in my house, where I would often drop down to (literally) dial-up speeds if I even connected at all, I get 4 out of 5 bars of signal and 100+ MBS speed. I couldn't be happier or more pleased. This bad boy exceeded ALL my expectations. I never knew a router could be this good! Get this router. You will not be disappointed.

I loved this router. Its very fast and has very good range. My son has his computer down stairs in the basement in his room and he still gets perfect reception and high speeds. My wife and I can be on the our own computers and he can still play his Playstation 3 without any lag on our end or his.

column9: Completely as advertised!  I'm happy with it.
column10: Just wanted to stop by to say that this router has worked for me completely as advertised, no hiccups or connectivity issues of any kind.  It is such a relief to just plug it in, fire it up, and be done with it!  I have another review out there for a similar router (dual band N) that didn't go so well.  The software that comes with the WNDR3700 is easy to use;  though I do find myself looking around for things, they ARE there.  Would be nice to be able to boot a user off easily, but fortunately that's not really important.  Look to other reviews for speed tests and the like, I'm just happy to have my household online and complaints down to zero.

column9: A very good High End Dual Band Router!
column10: Okay, i just bought a new laptop (HP Dm4t) and had wireless internet before. Through extensive research on the web i finally found this powerful router. This is the most feature rich router ive seen in a while, a little pricey but its worth it in the end due to the longevity of its life span and its ease of use and speed consistency over several devices connected at once.The WNDR3700 lives up to its name! it increased my range throughout my whole house 2500 sq feet, and theirs no speed difference whether im upstairs or downstairs. Its fast, easy to install, reliable and one of the best 150 dollars i spent on a networking device. A plus to this already great device is the 5ghz wireless a connection which is less congested and sometimes gives a faster speed than the over crowded 2.4 ghz But make sure your wireless internet adapter/card supports it! it should say wireless a when you look at your wireless card through device manager. If it does not than you have no use for the dual band capabilities in this router but nevertheless, its 2.4 ghz gave me a promised 180 mbps wireless and 300 wired. But considering that i have a ps3, an xbox 360 an ipod touch and a laptop connected at once this router still maintains its speed.Th only bad thing i found was the limited capabilities with the guest network but that was fixed with a firmware upgrade. I also suggest that you keep the router elevated on a shelf (downstairs if two story) and keep it standing rather than laying it flat due to heat issues and better range. I also should say the first thing you should do is update the routers firmware from one of the icons the install wizard makes for you.All in all this is by far the best router i have used and its speed is fast, range is excellent and is perfect for connecting more than 1 device. The dual band is a plus, it will help if you live in crowded areas but you might notice a speed decrease or increase using 5 ghz and a range decrease. This is one of the best items i bought off of amazon and i highly recommend it for a people who aren't familiar with networking due the the ease of installation. A great buy indeed.

column9: The best router I have ever owned.
column10: Finding the right router is difficult, especially for those of us who do not have a thorough knowledge of wireless networking or an abundance of time.  For every router there seem to be an equal number of positive and negative reviews.  All I can say about this router is that it works flawlessly for me, and it is well worth the money.

setup was so easy, I did think it was going to work. I conncect out Wii, our DVR, two laptops and two cellphones withn an hour. So far everything is working great. Lastly, this one doubled our range to anywhere not only in the house, but the entire backyard.

column9: The Best Router I have used!
column10: With the Dual band 5GHz capability, this works great in highly congested areas (like apartments and town home communities) where there are a lot of home networks. Without the added dual band options, you are fighting with your neighbor's networks for channels and getting knocked off line continually.

column9: Awesome router for gaming on multi consoles!!
column10: I run on Window XP and I bought this NetGear router to use with my Motorola SB6120 SURFboard. It was very easy to install/setup and I notice the different in my internet speed right away! Before NetGear, I was using some older model D-Link and always lag in video games. Now I can play Xbox online on multi consoles (at the same time), never lag and constantly get host! I can even download a few movies at a time and play online game without bad connection! Extremely happy with this item!!PS: I use Comcast internet 24Mbps before the purchase and notice the internet speed different after the NetGear router without changing my service.

column9: MOST POWERFUL HOME/SMALL OFFICE WIRELESS ROUTER
column10: This router I bought as an upgrade to the WNDR3300. It is more compatible with windows 7. New firmware is detected and easily installs. This router did wonder for the speed of my WIFI I phone 4 and laptop.  It is extremely feature rich yet installs in minutes. You can always add features as you become more familiar. The default settings seem to wok great out of the box. Netgear is of much higher quality and powerful than Linksys .
Works with my newer 'N' devices and my old 'G' devices.  Extends the range for all devices.  Works great, looks cool too.

This router is so much better than our previous router!!! The speed is wonderful, but more importantly, it hasn't lost it's signal once since it's been installed.  Our old router dropped out several times every time we used it.

column9: Won over spending $250 on other solutions
column10: I have found that network routers, wifi AP, repeaters are fought with setup problems, poor tech support, poor documentation, poor performance, poor compatibility problems, and incompatibility problems between the wifi device and the AP's.  I wanted to extend the range of a Linksys AP/router by using a repeater -- failed.  Tried another vendor -- failed.  Tried a linksys product, but it would not support the encryption requirements.  I FINALLY junked all of this (which couldn't be returned to Amazon) and bought a Netgear WNDR3700 AP/router Plus a WNHDE111 AP (only).  I ran a 250' direct line from the AP to the AP/router.  I programed each of them independently (by direct connect to a router) and using a browser interface.  (MINOR RANT: their support disk runs only on the junk-windows, but you can use the browser to interface to each unit separately).  After doing this, I connected the units and everything worked as advertised. Thanks to the master programming of Apple's products, Apple determined all the communication parameters in use with NO input from me except for the encryption password. In this case I was using their iPAD.  Documentation is wonderful.  (MINOR RANT: whenever you screw around with routers, you can expect to unplug the Comcast cable interface for 30 seconds w/o the new AP/router attached, and then attach the Netgear AP/router and then the computer.  I can't remember if the documentation mentions this.)  The only negative wrt to the WNHDE11 AP is that it only supports the 'N' protocol; the WNDR3700 supports both N & G at 2.4 ghz and 5 ghz.  Some devices (e.g., iPhone) only supports the 2.4 ghz.

I purchased this router with my Alienware 17x a few months ago...  Flawless performance! I like that it has an on/off switch in the back so I don't have to have it on all the time.  Range, signal strength, connection have been without fail.  I have surfed the web, downloaded movies from Blockbuster, and streamed video without ever having a problem.  I can't tell the difference from my hardwired desktop to my wireless laptop at all.  Setup was easy with cable.

The Netgear WNDR3700 is a solid bit of tech. It ends up being one of the more expensive consumer routers, but for some, the dual-band technology and guest networks will be worth it. The firmware is good and updating it is a snap- it can even check for updates every time you log into the console. You can change passwords, set up guest networks, decide what channel and speed you want, choose to broadcast your SSID, security- all the basic features that you'd come to expect with a router. My one complaint is that you cannot change the username for logging in- it's surprising Netgear left this off as it's a simple way to help increase security.I suggest using WPA2 security on your main networks. If you have something that requires older security like WEP (such as the Nintendo DS) I would suggest utilizing one of the guest networks for just this purpose. If it does become compromised, your network is still secure from prying eyes.If you're experiencing issues with interference or have a particularly congested neighborhood, I suggest using this along with free software called inSSIDer. It basically shows in graphical form what wireless networks in your area occupy space on the wireless spectrum. Combine this with the ability to select your channel via the console GUI and you can make this already great router just a little better by selecting a less-used channel.The build quality is solid, though I was disappointed in the stand- it's plastic and not as solid as I would like. I had thought it was metal from the picture. It's a bit wobbly but still holds it just fine. Not perfect, but still good.Overall this is a good purchase if you can make use of the dual-band N and G technologies. I'm running my one laptop at 300mbps and the rest of my wireless network at the standard 54mbps of wireless G.

column9: Worked right out of the box!
column10: Had this up and running 24/7 for 6 months now. It took a little long going through the menu and settings and final tweaking to my setup. Also the auto-updater took a few hours to work when it first powered up. Set up took most of an afternoon with the 3 different computers and 6 devices that connect to it but once it was done it has worked flawlessly. The guest net works on the ssid. I know because I'm on a hill in the country and my neighbors are able to use it just fine from 400 yards out! They do have a repeater set up. I recommend limiting your firewall on the router to known unsafe sites and using norton or mcaffee for most firewall and virus scanning. I've been getting measured speed of 280-300 mbps wireless and 500-700 mbps wired. It drops alot during the frequent lightning storms here off comcast cable but the ups I use have kept it all running with no failures. *****Highly Recommendend.

It was not as easy to set up as promised, but not too bad.  I have a computer in a difficult spot that used to get spotty wireless reception on G protocol.  With this router the connectivity strength went from one bar to four....and no more interference from microwave when I stream music.  Recommended.

column9: Great Router!!! Easy to install and reliable!
column10: I have always used LinkSys routers.... until now. I purchased a NetGear Dual-Band N for my home use. It was extremely easy to install. I was up and running in a matter of 5 minutes or so. I was having problems with disconnects and conflicts with my older router, but this NetGear router is wonderful. It is so reliable, fast and the range is so much greater. I have laptops, desk tops, Rokus, ITouch, IPhone & a Wii using it and we haven't had any problems. Since it worked so well at home, I purchased one for my business. Once again, the ease of installation was great and all the devices hooked up immediately. Thanks NetGear for a great product!!

column9: A very reliable Router with a complete feature set
column10: After using this router for several months, I find it is far more stable and reliable than the Belkin F5D8235 which it replaced.  I like the ability to separate the 'G' and the 'N' protocols with different log-in's which enables each device to run at their maximum speed.  The range on the 'N' is greatly improved and more importantly it is very stable.  No more daily router resets needed.  It also allows for a guest log in, was quite easy to set up it's basic features and has many (very bright) status lights to keep the user informed.  The 'Readyshare' feature works but as might be expected is slower than a conventional external hard drive.Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase.  It has been just what I was looking for from a router...set it and forget it stability.

column9: Very easy to set up and works well
column10: I received and set this up earlier today, so can't speak about the long-range reliability, but can speak to the ease of use and set up.The instructions couldn't have been more simple - each step illustrated with an animated image of the system with a very clear, direct instruction.  It took longer to gather up the three laptops, the netbook, and the iPods to change the automatic connections than it took to set this up.  One laptop runs XP and the other laptops and netbook run Windows 7 and I had no trouble connecting any of them to the new network.We replaced an older Netgear router (which, when new, replaced a Lynksys router).  I love the ease of  use of the Netgear routers and this new router has increased range, signal strength, and speed over our last Netgear router.The speed is wonderful - I was able to download a video that took more than an hour with the old router in less than ten minutes.  It has streamed all of my media with none of the freeze-ups that I was getting with the old router.Very impressed so far!

This is certainly not the least expensive model on the market - but it is well worth the additional price. I can broadcast multiple lines for guests and even for specific devices.I'm not the most technical guy around, but this one practically set it self up.Very satisfied customer.

column9: Cleared up my issues with bandwidth
column10: I needed a router to work with Comcast's hi speed internet. This router was easy to install and connected without any issues to all of my devices.
Price seemed good. Haven't had any problems yet, and it was very simple to set up and monitor. Range could be better, but i haven't been using the 2.4ghz band.

Checked with many people before purchasing a router. Very important when you are only on satellite & still waiting for broadband in your area. Not everyone made is suitable with satellite.. Easy to install, clear instructions. A must buy when you have more than one computer.

column9: Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
column10: All I can say is this Router is just flat out AWESOME!!  I am using every available feature of it and it works like a charm. Being able to setup different SSID's accounts is perfect for my setup. I have 1 setup as a dedicated Media Steamer to my TV. I have an external HD hooked up to the USB port an am able to stream my media files directly to my TV and they play perfectly.  The setup was simple an easy and networking it to my TV was just as easy. I highly recommend this router.

I got this to replace my old WRTG54G Linksys router (which still works and served me well, just wanted an upgrade).  I was going to purchase the Cisco-Linksys E3000 High-Performance Wireless-N Router but, there were a few things that discouraged me.  The first being that the E3000 is not DLNA Compliant, and can't stream to PS3 w/TVsersity or Media Player.  The second was all the negative reviews compared to this one.  Anyway, the only hick-up I had was during installation.  The software wouldn't let me use special characters in naming the router or in it's password.  I thought that was stupid and was about to return it when I went into the advanced settings (under the routers IP) and was able to add them there.  After that was done the router has been running flawlessly for the past few weeks.  No issues and fast speeds.  Especially when wirelessly steaming media to my HDTV in the other room.

column9: Wow, I should have gotten this a long time ago!
column10: Although I've only had this for a day, I'm quite impressed. My old Netgear G router was buckling under the weight of 2 PCs, 3 laptops, 3 game consoles, 2 iPhones and a printer.  I usually try not to spend this much for a router, but it was worth it, and more.  Easy setup (10 minutes tops), and blazing speeds for everything, even when most are going at he same time.

This is a great device if you are looking for a combination wireless access point and router to work with your cable modem. Pros for this device: easy set up and lots of features. With other similar devices you have to fiddle around with changing your static IP address (which I found to be difficult) for installation. I have a 64 bit system so I was a little nervous that there would be set up issues. All I did was put in the set up disc - it spun away - installation complete in under 5 min. VERY EASY!

Works great for file sharing via an attached USB 2.0 external drive.Perfect for a wifi based media player setup.Setup was a breeze and this was a great jump from my Wireless-G to Wireless-N technology.I have not tried the DLNA setup yet.
I have never installed a wireless router before.  This router, with it's included cd, was very easy to set up. It has worked wonderfully for 3 months now.

I bought this router almost a month ago. I really like it. It was really easy to set up and it worked great with no issues. It is fast and the range is amazing. In my 2 story house, our old router signal couldn't always reach the computers upstairs. We would get maybe 2 connection bars, Now all the computers in every room get full bars. It works great! I love the speed, the ease of use, and the fact that it does what it claimed it would do. This router is worth the money.
The product was shipped quickly,was easy to install...and performs with a a stronger signal,better range, and secured wireless network. Very easy to hook up other computers, and phones to it.

Very happy with this unit, which upgrades my network to N from G and adds 1 GB wired ports.I like that you have the ability to use different security options for the different bands, and to offer separate wireless SSIDs when desired for guests which does not allow them access to any network resources other than the internet.  I also really like that there is a button on the front panel to turn the wireless radios on or off for whatever reason.  (I like to turn the transmitters off for energy savings when wireless isn't needed, keeping my wired connections going.  With my prior Linksys wireless router, there was no physical button to do this - I had to open up a browser in a wired computer to turn wireless on and off.)The web-based control panel is friendly and offers many features.  The fact that the software checks for updates each time the control panel is opened (by default) will no doubt keep many users more up-to-date than with other devices that require checking the manufacturer's web site from time to time (which almost nobody will do).The attached storage, via USB port, worked fine with a thumb drive.
Had it up and running in about 20 minutes. It has been running flawlessly and as advertised for almost 5 1/2 months. It sure beats the linksys 610n that crashed at least once or twice each week.

I 1st read about this router from Max PC, as their best-of-the-best recommendation,because I have long distance betweeen router and one of my computer, need the best range I could get,so bought this one. installation is straight-forward, did not encounter any problem,wonderful product!!

I'm not sure what's up with the lower reviews by some but I've had this router for over 6 months now and have had absolutely no problems with it. I've performed the firmware updates, and set everything up the way I wanted with ease. I'm very please with this router and its features!

my title says it all. i've had alot of different routers in the past and none of them can come close to the WNDR3700. i've even had a linksys WRT310n with a DD-WRT reflash and the WNDR3700 beats it in every single category i can think of, especially reliability and throughput. i had a bit of trouble with my setup, so i just called the tech support and they were very helpful. like with many routers, u probably want to just skip the installation CD and do it yurself, or call the tech support. make sure u have yur wireless security encryption to 'WPA2+AES' to achieve full N speeds. after that, u just sit back and enjoy. :D i haven't even had to reset my router once since it's been activated. 300mbps <3
I have had this router for about 6 months.  My control 4 is hooked to it which controls all my lights, distributed A/V, and multiple computer.  It has never had to be restarted.  That says alot.

If you know anything about wireless routers this is one of the best to have. Very feature rich and always easy to use and setup. The security features are nice, and the fact that you can set up a guest account on your network that blocks unwanted prying eyes from seeing your personal network is awesome. The next big bonus is the ability to attach a external hard drive directly to the router essentially giving you a NAS drive for very little money compared to actual NAS drive systems. To top it all off, right from the setup you can turn your PC into an FTP site to access your files from anywhere. Just a wonderful router easy to use with tons more features than Linksys.
I haven't had to power cycle it yet; our laptops always seem to be able to connect.I like being able to hook up my external USB storage.

I owned a DIR-655 for about 2 years. I am a computer consultant so my computers are my livelyhood. I had no problems with the DIR-655 since I was directly connected, but my son and daughter complained all the time. So I have been thinking of replacing the router for some time but the reviews still put the DIR-655 at the top of the heap. After I started using a IPOD touch that I received for my birthday I began to see what everyone was complaining about. Very slow performance and dropped sessions only 2 rooms away. So I did a lot of research and decided the WND3700 might be worth a shot. My only comment is WOW! The range and performance of my wireless network are significantly improved. I was even able to connect outside. Well worth the money!

Bottom Line: This router fixed ALL my internet problems.I work in a small office in a business building that has hunders of other small offices. Everyone seems to have wifi installed and this was creating problems for me. At first when we moved in we hooked up a Belkin G router and everything was fine. As more people moved in and hooked up their routers our internet started getting slower and becoming intermittent. I blame this on frequency congestion, inteference, etc.In my desperation I logged on to Amazon and found this router. The router packs quite a punch. It transmits at 5.8 band and 2.4 ghz band. It also transmits at N which is great.As soon as I hooked up the router my internet was faster, no longer disconnecting etc.On a positive note I found out I could have 4 networks on at the same time:1. 5.82. 2.43. 5.8 GUEST4. 2.4 GUESTNo my guests just use the guest networks without having direct access to my network etc.The USB port at the back for sharing a hard drive over the network is also a plus.
What's to say, I have installed many routers none was easier to install then this one.  I would highly recommend this product.

I have had my wireless router now for several weeks and it was very easy to set up and use. I have not had any connection problems and it starts up when I turn it on pretty fast. I have no problems using it for multiple wireless electronics at the same time. It has all the features that one would like to have all in one router. I checked another website to make sure I got all the necessary things in my router to do everything I needed it to do and have great safety incoding too. All in all this is a great router everything all in one router!

column9: What a beast of a wireless router!
column10: What a beast of a wireless router!  Excellent range.  Has eight meta meta material antennas. No drops.

column9: Netgear Knocks One Out of the Ballpark
column10: I recently upgraded my old Wireless G network to the new and improved Wireless N network. I bought a Motorola Surfboard SB6120 Cable Modem coupled with the WNDR3700 router along with WNDA3100 adapter. Using the bandwidth speed test on speakeasy.net, I improved my download speeds from 10Mbps DL/1Mbps UL to a very beautiful 33Mbps DL/2Mbps UL with Charter (boo). The only problem I encountered was the 5Ghz signal has trouble getting through walls and I got a 70-80% signal through two walls at a distance of about 20-25 feet. However, the 2.4Ghz signal probably showed up on the computers of all my neighbors for a four block radius. I'm exaggerating, but seriously, my iPhone still had a Wifi connection to my house half a block down the street as I was driving in my car.I was considerably distraught, however with the performance of the 5Ghz network because of the lack of signal around my house even though I strategically placed it at an elevated level  (Near the ceiling) at the very center of my house. My solution came in the form of Netgear's WNDHE111 5Ghz Access Point. I got creative with drilling holes in my ceiling big enough to fit ethernet cables through my attic to different parts of my house. I setup the access points in the three rooms I use internet. FYI, you can buy refurbished ones for around $40 and they work great. Now, I have a TRUE Wireless N Network running at 5Ghz. I think I'm the only one in my neighborhood with a 5Ghz network so speed is incredible with no interference whatsoever. My speeds with 5Ghz are 40Mbps DL/2Mbps UL which is not bad since Charter only offers 25Mbps MAX DL speeds. (I think the tech messed up when setting up my ISP and modem)
This is a great product.  Easy to use interface with included help screens.  Would definitely recommend!  Tons of features.

This router is fantastic for home and personal use. I wouldn't trust it for anything larger than a very small business. It has some nice features with the dual broadcast for n-band and a/b/g, as well as allowing for a guest networks. The NAS feature is nice as well. All of it is very easily set up. Once plugged in, there is a CD to walk less advanced users, but for advanced users, I found the admin section to be pretty good. I also strongly suggest getting the new firmware. A neat feature is when the router finds firmware itself and suggests upgrades. So many great features to micromanage every aspect of a network. It also looks kind of pretty.

column9: Beware of the FAULTY router batch
column10: UPDATE July 7th, 2010: NETGEAR fixed all my issues with firmware 68 and now it works flawlessly. It is the best router I have ever own. It never hangs, never drops connection and supports advanced QoS. I can now talk over my VOIP phone even when downloading in multiple threads. The router even has a flawless SIP ALG implementation, which helps to use VOIP phone without disabling ALG option. I tested most of the marketed feature of the router, including guest network, USB drive etc. and all works flawlessly now. In fact to test the router, I have downloaded around 200GB over a week and it never even slowed down. BTW, I have been using the router for little over a month now.This is my first review (sorry for being so selfish to read hundreds of reviews without ever writing one). But I felt obliged to let people know that netgear is actually deceiving their customer by deliberately marketing a faulty production batch. Search on internet 'netgear wndr3700 enabling the guest net disables wifi router radio beta firmware' and you will find all the horror stories of customers who purchased their WONDERFUL (up until February, 2010) router which does not work as advertised (due to a faulty production batch, guest network does not work and cripple the whole router once enabled). I am furious... I consider my time extremely valuable and the time that I have wasted (before realizing the fact by searching internet) is far more valuable than the router price. If NETGEAR could pay me for my time, I probably would be able to buy a super professional series router.Now my main gripe on AMAZON: I love Amazon and they have been so supportive over the years (indeed they have instantly offered me a free router shipped overnight) but I could not resist to vent my anger on Amazon too: the router batch is defective and it is so well known. As the 'earth's most customer-centric company' (trust me, I still believe they are), they should kick NETGEAR WNDR3700 out of their inventory. And people should bring a class action lawsuit against NETGEAR for deliberately marketing faulty hardware.

After years of using lynksis products when it was time for a new router, after reading reviews we went with the Netgear.  It's much faster than our last router and needs resetting much less often, although the range does not seem to be icreased any.  Also it appears to braodcast two separate networks which occasionally confuses the computers.  To be honest i just did a quick set-up so there is probably some way to deal with that and i just haven't bothered looking into it since it's a minor inconvenience.  Overall i'm very pleased with this router.

I'm reviewing the Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 here because as I was setting it up I noticed that it is a part of Netgear's green initiative. The power plug is energy star rated, and the user can control how much power the wifi radios are using. There is also a handy button on the device that will turn it off when you're away from home - if that's what you want. All of this means that the device can potentially save you electricity every month...Now to the performance. Setup was easy, but to be fair I know what I'm doing with a router. I skipped the 'basic' setup using the CD, and jumped into the device itself via http. I had it up and running in no time. I like having 2 different networks off of one router. It gives you a 2.4ghz network that you can set up as b/g/n, and 54/150/300mpbs if you want. Then you have the 5ghz radio that sets this device apart. It allows for a/n and up to 300mpbs. But the beauty is that 5ghz networks don't get the interference that 2.4ghz networks do. For example, most cordless landline phones are 2.4ghz, so is your microwave, so are most video game controllers, bluetooth devices, etc. Not to mention the 13 other wifi networks that I pick up at my house (I guess my neighborhood is pretty 'unwired').The main reason I bought this thing, and the real test that I gave it was streaming media to my Xbox 360 via the media center extender feature. I have a dual tuner video card in my PC, that I use to record TV. Then I use the Xbox to watch everything on the TV via Media Center Extender. I bought the wireless N adapter for the console this summer because I moved into a house where running  a LAN cable was going to be tough in that location. My previous N router wasn't up to the test of streaming content of HD quality though. When I ran the bandwidth test from the Xbox, it always gave me a message saying HDTV wouldn't work. I bought a cheap wireless G access point off ebay, and it was able to mostly handle the throughput... mostly. But, I wanted to really take control of the problem with my new WNDR3700 - and it does. I get a perfect signal to my xbox on the 5ghz channel, and it gets a throughput at nearly 300mpbs... which streams HDTV jitter free...The WNDR3700 fits my criteria of providing an eco-friendly solution to my networking needs. As a christian who cares about God's creation, environment, I want my purchases to reflect my convictions. This one met my criteria, my needs, and goes well beyond. It even provides the ability to create `guest' networks if one so desires. The device has way more features than I need right now, which is nice because I usually end up learning how to use them and then deciding I do need them later.[...]

I had been using a trusty old Linksys WRT54g for the longest time. I didn't really trust any other routers. Then I got a new laptop with 802.11n support. I also realized all my wired machines supported gigabit. I started to research gigabit routers with 802.11n. This one seems to have everything I was looking for.And the research was exactly correct. This thing is great. I put the 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz bands on separate SSIDs so that my legacy b/g devices don't slow down my n devices. The gigabit is way fast. I setup a guest SSID so that visitors to my house can get on the Internet without accessing my LAN. The Readyshare USB file sharing just works. Everything is great.Not only that, but all this stuff worked right out of the box. I plugged it in, visited the configuration interface in my browser, automatically updated the firmware (worked perfectly), and it was good to go.The only negative with this router is that maybe it doesn't live up to its Rangemax name. I'm in a tiny apartment, so I don't need that much range. However, the range on this is so small that if I go far away from the router, it goes down to 4 bars instead of 5. Not a big deal for me, but a huge deal if you are in a big house. I notice it does have the ability to be used a a repeater, so maybe in a really big house you can buy more than one of these.

It is extremely stable and fast.  I've had no compatibility issues.  Running it with a D-Link DAP-1522 wireless bridge with no problems at all.  Been running the router constantly for months now and never had to reboot it once.  I love the multiple networks feature so I can isolate the N traffic from the B and G traffic.

column9: Works great and is super fast!
column10: Installed and worked great right out of the box. It has some kind of USB sharing feature but I haven't used that. The gigbit ports are great and the Wireless N works great. It really sped up my connectivity. I love that it's wall mountable as well. Although when it is mounted on the wall the indicator lights are not as easy to see. Well worth the money!!

column9: Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
column10: I received my new Netgear router this morning.  It took me longer to unpack it than it did to set it up.  This router was setup and actively connected to the internet in less than 10 minutes.  That is how a router setup should work.  It took another 5 minutes to setup the wireless security and my whole LAN was up and running at this point.  As soon as I logged into the router it connected to the DSL modem and automatically changed some settings so it could connect to the internet to download updates.  It downloaded firmware updates and installed them automatically.  It then asked me if I logged into my ISP.  I do not.. my connection to my DSL modem is dynamic, the PPPoE login info. is held in the DSL modem, not the router.  I checked the NO box and the modem set itself up from there and I was connected to the internet.  Well done Netgear.

After pulling my hair out for years over lousy Linksys routers, this thing is a breath of fresh air.  The best feature?  It WORKS!  The network USB storage is really nice.  I plugged in a terabyte drive into this and everyone in the house can backup their PC to it.  I found the advanced routing options easy to navigate as I run a few servers from home and route services to them.I guess after my Linksys experience over the years (several different routers all the same crappy bugs), it is just nice to finally have a router that does what it is supposed to do!Thanks Netgear, keep up the good work!

This router is very fast and looks great as well.  The firmware menu is very different from my former D-Link router and is more user friendly.  It has all the bells and whistles I need. Together with my new gigabit ethernet card, gigabit cable modem and cat-6 cables I now enjoy the maximum download speed provided by my cable service.

Replaced an older B/G Band RangeMax with the N-Band RangeMax. Noticed the guest login options so you don't have to hand out full access to people who want to come over and game. I have a 2 story woodframe/brick home and get strong signal almost all over the property. Setup was straightforward and there are explanations on the right side for those who don't know the difference between WEP, WPA, or WPA2 security or what port forwarding is and why you might want to use it. Have a Roku HD/XR player hooked up and a home computer. Wife can be on the computer doing all her stuff and I can be watching video streams without bottlenecks. Haven't tried pushing the router yet but since the backend of our data pipe has much more throughput than our DSL connection any bottlenecks will be at the gateway and not the LAN side. I would definitely recommend this router for an in home wireless network.
I chose this model because reviews claimed it had better range than any other consumer router.I am extremely happy with the superior range, the improvement is dramatic for me!

column9: Recent purchase - First Impressions then followup
column10: I just bought this router today and came home and set it up, so this is a VERY initial review.  I'll have to come back and update it as I have it set up longer.  **SEE UPDATE AT BOTTOM**Previous router was a 5 year old Linksys Wireless-G, so my first impression is WOW, the is noticeably faster!  I've made the jump into Wireless-N technology.  The setup was fairly easy if you've done this before.  I think a newbie could handle it too, but it doesn't lead you very easily into setting up the 'wireless' portion of you network.  It just configures the router with a cabled connection and then you're on your own.Interesting to note that my iPhone is using the 2.4GHz while my laptop uses the 5GHz.  It's like having two routers, hence the name dual-band, I guess. (sorry this is new to me and I found it cool).I like all the features that it offers.  This is truly for networking professionals and highly knowledgeable amateurs.  I am glad that as I learn more advanced things, I will have a router that can offer me these features.It is quite pricey, but you get more control over your network for it.  The Administration pages for this router area also quite easy to understand.I'll return and update in a few months...***UPDATE***So, I've been using the router for over two full months now and I'm still loving it just as much as before.  I've had one dropped network experience, but that could have been my cable internet service just as easily as the router.  I just had to unplug everything, wait 30 seconds, and plug back in.  The big thing I've noticed is the speed difference in uploading and downloading files.  Going from a Wireless-G to a Wireless-N router has been wonderful!

This router is GREAT! I bought the Linksys WRT610 and returned after few weeks having the Linksys, the Linksys router dropping out internet very often I replaced the linksys with the Netgear WNDR3700 and it's been troublefree afterward. Thanks Amazon for having this product.

column9: easy as pie, don't be intimidated
column10: I have never written a review before.  I have only set up one wireless router prior to the Netgear.  It was a Linksys G.  I went to the Netgear web site after opening the box.  I watched the installation video for this router prior to doing anything else.  You have to turn everything off before you start, so you must have this info prior to starting.  I only followed the web video instruction and it went perfectly.  I have a Win XP desktop.  THe install may have taken 30min. or less.  The router doubled my range and speed.  Great product, and sooo easy to install.  I almost didn't get it because of the scary reviews.  Don't be intimidated. It is well worth the money.  Watch the video; [...], good luck, enjoy the range.

Not a geek so not going to get techno on you.  I just know that it works.  Bought it to replace a Linksys WRT310 that was a major P.O.S.  Never had a netgear before so I was a bit nervous at first.  But, there have been no problems so far in the two months I've owned it.Installation was a breeze, used setup utility and it worked great.Range has been fantastic, router is on 2nd floor of house and never at a loss for signal.Both bands are rock solid and very speedy.Used for general internet surfing, e-mail, netflix streaming with no hiccups.Looks great on the desktop too.  Love the vertical profile and high-tech design.Won't be going back to Linksys anytime soon especially after my last experience.Highly recommended!

This router is lightening fast. I sometimes work from home using a remote connection to my office desktop and my son loves to play WOW on his laptop (wireless). With our old router it was not possible to do both at the same time. The Netgear router supports it all without degrading performance for either of us.The router setup was also extremely easy and we had it up and running within minutes. Initially the router seemed slow. Their customer service helped me trouble shoot and we learned that I lacked the lastest firmware update. A quick visit to their website, a couple of clicks and I was on my way. I was worried when I learned that I would need to call customer service because, from my experience, some companies have really weak customer service. Not the case here... Netgear's customer service was very impressive. They were friendly, knowledgable and extremely helpful.

Easy setup, only took me 2-3 minutes. steady and fast wireless connection. wide range for 2.4ghz and ok range for 5ghz. I am happy with it. by the way, I returned my D-link dir655 and spent $50 more for this one, I think it is worth it.

column9: Netgear RangeMax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
column10: Easy install, product works great, nice features.  Installed 3 separate access points, one for myself and family which gives full access to home network and internet and two others for guests at 2.4 GHz for older adapters and 5 GHz for N adapters both with access to internet only (no access to internal network), this is a great feature.  Tested all access points and they work flawless.  Tested firewall and it works flawless.

column9: A bit expensive, but in the end an awesome true dual-band router
column10: Pros:-Quick and easy setup: easy to use, intuitive and powerful. Firmware updates went smoothly.-Good looks: router looks very sleek, shiny and powerful-Performance: FAST. Both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz N-band networks are blaaaazing fast!Cons:-Price: a bit on the expensive side, but is about right for a true dual band router based on the competition (Cisco, DLink, LinkSys, etc)-Performance - 5GHz range is kinda weak, but only while using Windows 7, Mac OS X always has full bars.-Summary: Performance is great! Clocked over 18Mbps download speed from [...] (with Comcast). Web browsing is VERY noticeably faster, gaming - always have full bars and no lag (yet) using MW2, have not tried any torrents yet but I am sure I'll see a speed improvement.Bottom line - if you have the need for a true dual band home network like I do and are willing to invest a bit more in a top of the line kick-ass router, than get this!!

I have been tinkering with wi-fi routers since they first came onto the market about 10 years ago.  The last couple years I have defaulted to DD-WRT on Linksys routers for reliability and performance.  I recently hit the limits of 802.11g and Linksys AP's in general and was looking for something significantly more powerful and dual band capable.I run ooma Telo VOIP, WHS, 2 WD Live media centers, 3 netbooks, 1 laptop, 1 desktop, 1 iPhone, 1 Droid, 2 Xbox 360's, 1 wii, 1 bridge, 1 wireless color laser printer.  Also have various devices networked for internet connectivity, DVR's, Bluray players TV's etc.  I stream hi-def content all over the house and hit the torrents pretty hard.  House is 2 story 2000sq ft.With all the devices I wanted to support I originally thought I would have to opt for a business grade AP.  I looked at cisco's 'N' stuff and was impressed, the high $$$ kept me searching.  I came across the great reviews on this router and thought I would give it a try.The router is pretty feature rich, not up to par with DD-WRT but its enough for me.  Range is great as I have no dead spots in my home or yards.  The GUI is a bit clunky but aren't they all?I have been very impressed with this router.  Have never had to reboot it, it handles everything I throw at it with ease.  It handles all my devices and never gets bogged down.  I highly recommend this router.  It has been the best investment I have made in a long time.

Picked up this unit for a building with much concrete and walls.  Setup was a breeze and it has some very nice QoS features for VoIP phones.  Range is surprisingly good for the barriers in the building and I can maintain high speed wifi connections well at the furthest point from the router.

I'm using this router with two Mac desktops, wired, a Mac Notebook and an Ipod.  Basically I plugged it in turned it on and fired up my computers.  I do have some problems writing to the common hard disk, I think it's because I don't have some of the settings set correctly, other than that it works like a charm.

column9: Awesome enough for a turbo-nerd, easy enough for his 8 year-old to install
column10: This product is a Gigabit Ethernet (GigE) and 802.11n router with simultaneous dual-band radios. It is one of few such dual-band devices currently on the market that actually has DUAL radios, and as such it is both fast and stable and does a stellar job of supoprting multiple dual-band connections. Don't waste you time or money on a router that isn't dual radio.Knowing what a high-end consumer grade router can and cannot do before you buy will save you a lot of money and frustration. It can provide excellent performance within your home network between devices which have Gigabit Ethernet and 802.11n wireless connections to this router. My home network includes about a dozen devices (Windows, Linux, Android, and occasionally MacOS) which connect via this router's GigE ports and wireless radios, and the connections are rock solid and very vast. While it provides great performance between the devices on your network, it won't alter the performance of connection between your network and the internet.I've installed this router in my basement to minimize the signal 'leakage' to my neighbors. Even so, the wireless signal on the first and second floor of our home is excellent. The wireless signal strength is adjustable, and if you have difficulty obtaining a strong wireless signal (which can cause your connection to drop and retry frequently), the router's configurations allow the signal strength to be adjusted.My home network includes a mix of NetGear switches, older Linksys products, and a variety of other client devices. I've had NO compatibility problems, despite a somewhat complex setup.What's good about it?:(1) Dual radios for genuine simultaneous dual-band 802.11n(2) The GigE switch really performs like GigE (some GigE don't cut it).(3) Strong, rock solid signal from both radios. Very stable wireless connections.(4) Easy setup via web interface from any computer. Accessible for a novice, fully featured for experts.(5) USB port to share a disk across the network.(6) Guest networks can be configured on both the 2 & 5 GHz networks.(7) 1-click firmware upgrades.However, as happy as I am with this router, there are a few features I'd like to see added:(1) I'd like to schedule the radio to be turned off at certain times of day.(2) The ability to do a site survey with the router to discover which wireless channels are already in use by my neighbors.(3) Three user-selected DNS servers when I'm not using the ISP-provided servers.If I needed another wireless router, I'd buy another one of these without a second thought.
Good and robust router. Works perfecly with n-adapters and also works fine with the older g-adapters.Very easy to install and sync with existing wireless devices. Great range.

this router is fantastic. the administration software is fairly simple to navigate and this thing performs. we run a game server, three computers streaming netflix and playing games, two cell phones and a laptop all at once and. this is a good router for a large home network.
Purchased the new router to replace my old netgear that was causing disruptions of signal. New router has been great with improved signal throughout house.

This router has now been in service for almost two weeks, and performs its job well.  Netgear sizes its home routers well, and this model works well in my medium-size house in its central location.  The router came well-equipped with all needed items and literature.  The Netgear web site provides access to detailed literature as well.  Set-up was relatively straightforward, and reregistering a range of devices including printers, notebook computers and tablets was easy.  We shall see if the router stands the test of time.

I bought this on recommendation from my son who is a computer geek.  He was helping me choose a router I could afford that would also perform well.  I get an excellent signal for my wireless connection anywhere in the house and outside when I choose to sit under the trees.
