I won't go into details, but suffice to say that I've ended up buying a new router every year.Here are my impressions of this new router.Netgear, the manufacturer of this, the WNDR3700, seem to finally have made a very good and thoroughly engineered home router product. I will compare it to my previous router, a Netgear WNDR3300, which I decided to replace due to instability and random reboots, seemingly under heavy data loads.This Netgear product sports the same online control interface that all Netgear consumer router products has used for years, so if you're familiar with them, you'll be familiar with this.The installation is a breeze. The unit is affixed with stickers that make its physical setup foolproof - the things you need to plug in have stickers with LARGE FRIENDLY NUMBERS IN BRIGHT COLOURS.Out of the box, it is a very nicely designed unit. Netgear has gone with a terrific streamlined look, and abandoned the flashly (no pun intended) battery of blue LEDs on the side of the WNDR3300 (annoying, so i always turned it off; would probably induce epileptic seizures in some people if left on) - the 3700 has exactly the diagnostic and activity LED's you need to see whats it's doing, and nothing more. It's utilitarian and sleek, not over-decorated. Otoh, it avoids the boring sandwich-and-brick look of most D-link routers, and Netgear has wisely also avoided plastering the router with all-blue LED's for the diagnostic lights. All LED's on the 3700 are green during normal operation (amber for errors), with the exception of one, the 5 Ghz WLAN LED, which is blue. I'm happy with this; blue is a nice colour, but EVERY manufacturer of digital equipment thinks so too, so you can hardly get a thing without BRIGHT BLUE LEDs anymore.In operation, I'm likewise very happy with it. My reason for switching from the predecessor (the 3300) was that heavy data traffic semmed to cause heavy packet loss; and when the WLAN interface was active, I would experience as much as 30% packet loss (tested over several hours running pings on several nearby hosts).I've stress tested this with both heavy data traffic, saturating my outbound internet connection, and activity from multiple clients on the wireless bands (both 2.4 Ghz and 5 Ghz, also simultaneously), and nothing touches it; the packet loss is not noticeable, or in specifics less than 0,1% at all times. (I recall having the same problem with lost data or no availability when the WLAN was heavily active on a D-link DIR-655, which resulted in my replacing that. I'm wondering if this is a general problem for some routers.)Wireless ranges seem somewhat better than the predecessor. I'm able to get somewhat better 802.11-n connectivity than with earlier N-capable routers.The web interface for the router is fairly easy to get the grips with, but is likewise showing its age. It works well, and is fairly easy to comprehend, yet Netgear should give it a makeover - HTML frames are so 90's. :)I have not tried the external USB storage function yet, so I can't say anything about that. I'll try that later.All in all, for the price, this is a gem. The installation, setup and configuration is a breeze. It's functionality is spotless. The gigabit (1000 Mbit/sec) interfaces means that it has enough throughput capability to serve your home / home office  or small office network in regards to collaboration and file sharing for years to come (which is more than can be said for 100 Mbit networking still found in some networking products, which in this day and age feels like a ball and chain around the leg of people who do file sharing regularly).I'll continue to test and poke this router, and I will revise this review and rating, should any problems show up. But for now, I'm overjoyed that the quality I'm familiar with from Netgears Professional products seems to has made it into their consumer segment as well. Well done, Netgear - do keep it up.Update, 27dec, 2009: Has been runnign flawlessly for over a month, under heavy and varied loads. Overjoyed.

This guy easily gets 5 stars.It looks so beautiful and sophisticated in my room.  (Honestly, people always comment on it; the ooooh's and awee's always ensue).I used to work IT (and no, it's not the geek's who oooh and awe, they do that over my cisco rack, but that's another issue altogether!)My previous router was a linksys and while I'm not a big fan of the whole GUI interface, this router makes me appreciate the linksys interface all the more.The interface on this guy is clunky, there's no easy way (heck there may be NO way) to see who all is connected to your network wirelessly (I needed to get an ip address off a device so I could connect and couldn't find it anywhere, even though it was connected (that device being a wireless bridge))The interface is just quite clunky for me.Please do not let that dissuade you by any means (once you get it working (which takes MAYBE 2-3 minutes) you'll likely never venture into the gui again).I love having 802.11n (it's like I'm living in the future!), being able to stream content off my desktop to my laptop in high speed is just so amazing (previously only had 802.11g (stone age, I know).This guy performs almost flawlessly.  I've gotten disconnected a few times with my macbook pro as well as one of my game consoles, but for the most part it is quite consistent.  (I know I got disconnected from my router because I could not access it via the routerlogin.net and needed to unplug and start it back up to get back online).Pros:Looks drop dead gorgeous (honestly, It's like a beautiful futuristic piece of art, the sheer look of it brings an unparalleled joy to my life (might be over doing it here!))Works as you would expect, easy to connect to, future proof, and it supports all the latest technical protocols (also has a guest network access feature, as well as the ability to track how much bandwidth you use).You can hook up a harddrive and stream it to your other computers, as well as to your game consoles (did not try this out myself).It just works, all I did was unplug my old, put in the same info into my new one and I was off in minutes (the longest part of the process was opening the box).Cons:Interface can be clunky at times, ok so I need to click here, watch the middle screen, and then scroll down and click that button, then wait for it to refresh?  Gotcha!Day to day usage with 802.11n will not make much a difference to you (unless you're streaming HD video from laptop to apple tv or something).  (This is NOT a con of this device, just something that needs to be said).Bottomline?  Features almost all the same specs and features as the apple device, works great, looks absolutely awesome (standing vertical) and the lights, ahhh, the lights, they bring such life into an otherwise dull room (filled with blinking red lights and the occasional green light having yellow and blue just makes life...'better'.)If you need (or just want) 802.11n you cannot go wrong by picking this up.  Highly recommended (just don't hide it like you did your old crappy router that looked horrible, this one looks nice, much better than the picture would have you believe).

Love the router, quick and easy setup with Vista and Windows7.  My laptop with Windows XP wasn't so easy to setup so I bought a new laptop.  Quick and easy setups for my plasma tv, ps3, tivo, denon receiver so they can all be connected.

column9: Great router, some problems with the setup
column10: I have hade this router for 2-3 weeks now. I'm very happy with it tho I did have some problems with the set up, I hade to call there technal support. They started with geting the product registered then moved on with fixing the problem, they were able to help me get it up and running in about 30mins. Now I have awsome range and speed unlike my netgear wireless g router but after all it was a good product too and I can't compare it to my new wireless n router. I would reccomend this product to any one that wants a new wireless setup, but if you do run into problems seting it up be patient and the technal support will get it working for you.

column9: Best product in this category by miles
column10: Win 7 64 bit requires a manual setup of the router, but that was basically painless.  After setting up the access controls to your ISP, just reset your ISP modem and bam you have the internet.  And wow, how fast this thing is can't be overstated.  Connections to Intel 4965agn and 5300 are flawless as well as the USB adapter from Netgear.  Range is significantly better than the 3300 I replaced, resulting in noticeably better speeds than the former at longer ranges.  Talks perfectly to a Motorola Docsis 3.0 modem and IPV6.Given that you can spend MORE money and get less performance, I highly recommend this router at this price point.  If you are deeply concerned with the USB drive connection, check compatibility first.  But as a wireless router this is finally a product that can make N speed a household item.  Router sits in the cellar and goes up 2 floors from there with connections on the upper floor at 80-100mbit in single channel mode.  Extremely good considering the old router could barely manage 1/10th of those speeds.2 weeks into this and not a single reboot.  Firmware update took a couple of minutes and not many at that.  It's very fast internally as well as connection wise.
This device gives better range than my old wireless router, even when I still have computers on the old format on the network.

I switched from a Linksys WRT300N router to try the Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router (Black). I have been on the 300N for about a year, working wirelessly mainly from a Dell laptop with wireless N. The design of the Netgear is pretty solid. With the antennae built in and not sticking out everywhere, its clean and albeit non-functional, the case and overall design is aesthetically pleasing.Performance: the increase was immediately evident. Before installing I set my laptop up approximately 25 feet from the existing router, with  two partial brick walls between the two. From the Linxsys, I was able to get a fading in and out poor signal. Without moving the laptop I swapped to the Netgear and immediately received a solid very good signal. It was fast and solid and the signal didn't drop once in the hour or so I tested from that location. Just on shear signal strength the dual band is worth it if you have any sort of problems with your existing Wireless N router. Also to note, power setting are available at 3 levels in case you want to go the opposite direction and limit your broadcast range. Obviously, I had them cranked as high as they would go. :)Features: I generally use more than the average setup. I network about 6-8 pc's at any given time in my home. I run a website, FTP and a voice chat server for gaming all from various machines in my network. Everything was set back up and running within a couple minutes. The configuration interface is robust but clean and well organized. The traffic routing features are a definite plus and although haven't set any of them up yet, I was able to look and was impressed with the potential. The router also allows for multiple SSID which is a very nice feature if you have people in and out of your house as I do.Overall, for about a month this has been a solid router and I have had no complaints at all. I'm pretty excited to play with some of the other features I have not had time to play with, but even with the basic to moderate settings, this router is leaps and bounds ahead of my previous N router. It really seems to grasp the concept of the N wireless and shows you what it can do when done properly.

I replaced my Linksys WRT610N after its failure at a mere 14 months.  As a consequence, I can offer a direct comparison.  I was looking for equivalent or superior features in a unit with greater reliability.  After two weeks of use, I can confirm that the Netgear WNDR3700 meets that requirement.The WNDR3700 offers a solid, fast N connection to several notebooks and wireless nodes using both the 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz frequencies.  Signal strength in my two-story house is 4 bars at 5.0GHz and 5 bars at 2.4GHz at the farthest point from the router on a different floor .  This is higher than that ever provided by the Linksys router.  Throughput rivals that of the direct connection used by my desktop.Installation was simple, with connections swapped between routers.  I was again online after rebooting my cable modem and router, and then using the router utility to configure my wireless and network settings.  I am particularly impressed that the router utility automatically checks for firmware updates and then offers to perform the task.  I followed the prompts and did so upon first use.  This is MUCH easier than checking manually and then going through the convoluted download and installation process required by Linksys.  (I'd performed a hard reset and firmware upgrade in an effort to revive the old router without success; previous firmware upgrades had been successful.)The availability of a secondary guest wireless connection that can be isolated from the remainder of the network is a boon.  I was recently able to provide a separate password to a visiting ISF calibrator so that he could access the Internet without seeing my secured data.  GREAT!  I didn't have to reset my security password on the router and multiple devices; merely changed the guest password for the next potential user.The connection for the USB external HDD is immediately recognized and appears as an available network drive.  I'll soon test the proclaimed ability to remotely access the drive when traveling.The Linksys router required a reboot on a regular bases when it would refuse to authenticate wireless devices using the proper password.  Dropped connections were also a problem.  Thus far, the WNDR3700 connects flawlessly and remains connected.The WNDR3700 is everything I'd hoped for with the Linksys router, and then some.  The fast and solid wireless connection is complemented by an easily-used configuration utility that makes security and wireless settings simple and firmware upgrades exceptionally timely and easy to install.  For home-office use, this router meets and exceeds my needs and expectations.  It is worth every penny!

column9: Netgear Rangemax 3700 dual-band is now the standard
column10: For home or small office networking it doesn't get much better or easier to install. The true dual band allows me to use my laptop in the kitchen even when the microwave oven is on. Quality of VOIP calls are much improved during a simultaneous download or video playback. Range also has increased over previous Netgear wireless g. The 'guest' network feature comes in handy when visitors are in town. In short, it's worth the price.

I got this router to use in our office network and it totally exceeded my expectations.  The WNDR3700 allows you to create wireless SSIDs on the 5GHz and 2.4GHz bands so everyone can join your LAN.  In addition to the two frequencies, you can even set up a guest network on each frequency that allows guests to get internet access without allowing them access to your LAN.  This is perfect for our office where we have local servers that contain sensitive information.I haven't done any official speed tests, but everything feels snappy and quick on wireless G right now.  I'll be adding some wireless N devices to the network over the next week or two so I will update my review accordingly.It seems that the open source firmware community is working on porting DD-WRT for the WNDR3700, but I haven't had any problem with Netgear's software.  The interface is a little clunky to use because it's bogged down by the wealth of options that this router can provide, but if you're experienced with setting up wireless networks, you shouldn't have any trouble finding your way around.  For people who want a quick and easy solution, the router configuration also provides a wizard that will walk you through the setup.So far, we've been running in it for a few weeks now and it has been perfectly stable.  Setting it up as a wireless access point was easy enough.  I just plugged it into our LAN and configured the wireless to what I wanted.

After testing this out for a few weeks I'm very happy with this product.  I'm a bit biased as I've always used and trusted Netgear, but this shouldn't deter you from getting a VERY high quality product.  Besides the almost non-important fact that it's a very sleek and stylish product, I needed to make sure it could handle my multi-computer, high speed, high security work environment.What I've found:-The signal is sharp, clean, and without interruption.  Speed is excellent (any issues THUS FAR have been found to be with either the website or my ISP, not the router).-Multi user, multi-computer, multi application/component interface, use, and setup/monitoring is very simple.Yes, it's a bit on the expensive side, but this is something I'm planning on keeping for a while, I don't think I'll ever need much more then what's offered here.  If you're someone who uses just a standard computer/ISP, for typical tasks, then there's really no need to get this expensive router.  If you need speed, realibility, and especially for multiple anything, then this is a must.

This is the most capable router I have ever used.  In the past I've worked with Netgear, Linksys and DLink equipment.  I tend to prefer Netgear and the WNDR3700 has pretty much cemented that for me.The interface and setup are pretty much the same as any other Netgear router, except there are a few more options.  This is the most feature packed router I've used to date.  I think some may feel that it is over kill, but I think all of it will soon be standard fare in most homes in the near future.  The ability to pretty much instantly create networked storage from any USB device, the ability to stream media to DLNa/UPnP devices, the multiple channels, guest accounts and pure speed are all becoming more necessary as our homes become increasingly connected.  What good is a nice fat pipe coming into your house if things get throttled right after the modem?What I've always liked about Netgear is that the default firmware gives me a lot of functionality that I haven't seen in other devices.  Sure, I can slap dd-wrt on something but that isn't always a stable solution.  My WNDR3700 is rock solid, giving me all the features I want or may want without adding the complexity of trouble shooting third party software.Signal and speed have been great thus far.  Setting up a guest network is easy and a real convenience.  I've had people over before, had to give them the key to connect to my network, and then I have to change it after they leave.  Which means changing my setup on my machines too.  No more.I can imagine some saying this is more than they need.  Maybe so, but I like having options and I'm not a cutting edge guy but already the majority of my entertainment and communication come via the web over multiple devices.  It's nice to have hardware designed to do the lifting necessary, and I don't foresee the need getting lighter in the future.  This would also work well in a small office, though I don't really have any expertise in that area.Bottom line, this is a little more expensive than a very low end router that doesn't support the newer technology and features but you get great value for the extra cost with this unit.  It's not a throw-away unit, it is built to stick around a while and meet the needs of owners for their current and future networking needs.

It's a good router.  Easy to set up.  Has 2 networks 2.4 Ghz and 5 Ghz.  Also use NETGEAR 5 GHz Wireless-N HD Access Point/Bridge (WNHDE111) as a bridge for my ASUS O!Play.  Everything seems to work just fine.The router will find, download and install any firmware updates.  The web interface is nice.  There is a nice help section on the right portion of the web admin screen that explains anything that may be unclear.So far so good, no problems.

column9: Finally a router with GB connection and Wireless N.
column10: I have been waiting for Netgear to produce and distribute a wireless N 5GHz router with Gigabit Ethernet connections.  The 3700 delivers this.  Easy setup, great range.  Combined with the WNHDE111 I can connect all my devices in different rooms (such as DVR, BlueRay, PC and Netflix receiver) while connecting my computers in the server closet to a gigabit network.  Finally!!!  Patience is indeed a virtue.

column9: NETGEAR WNDR3700 -Super Fast with Reliability and Functionality
column10: The Netgear WNDR3700 replaced a Linksys routers that I had. The WNDR3700 takes routing to a newer level, with faster processors driving the dual bands to faster speeds and better range.This router has superior build quality,Functionality you can configure this router manually to your liking, Speed is way out front of any linksys router from 54G to 400N that I have used, the signal strength is exceptional when connected in the 2.4ghz band I can get at least 60 feet from the router with excellent signal and between 60 and 100 feet signal strength drops to good, all this with the router in a room where all the walls are concrete with a steel roof. (never happened with a Linksys router). The router operates at a temperature of 41C in  a room without AC,the room ambient is 30C.The unit gave absolutely no problems to set up my cable modem was on I plugged in the 3700 and waited for the power supply to normalize and then plugged in the WAN cable from the modem to the router WAN connection, next I plugged in my PC. That was it nothing else and I was online. I then went to the configuration page and configured my wireless service.My recommendation cheap things are not good and good things are not cheap! Just get one.

I may not know that much about router but it has very good range , full bars.The speed very fast too. There so much feature to this router that someone who don't know alot about it get confuse. simple to use. Look grate. IT doesn't seen to run hot. Over all it great. May be if i was more knowable about router i wouldn't say the same thing, this is my first route but it awesome. 5-5 It pretty, i really  like how it change light color make it look cool

column9: Very Easy Installation and works great
column10: I purchased this a month ago arrived in 3 days even with free shipping.  Easy installation and setup had it working within approx. 15 minutes of opening the box.  Have had no drops in 3 weeks and it actually sped up the speeds on my laptops connected to the network.  Still learning about the features and how it all works.  I would recommend this product.

column9: More Options than I know what to do with
column10: I just got this Netgear to replace an Pre-N Belkin.  I must be getting interference from other people in the building so my connection sometimes would hang.  Video would pixle, so didn't watch that often.  I had the USB adapter for one computer and the express card for the laptop.  The laptop had the better reception.  Sometimes the system would hang, so I would have to restart the router, then get going again.  Started looking for a new router, saw this one and thought I'd give it a try from the reviews.  I'm glad I did.  I didn't have to call customer care, I followed the wizard, and it was fairly easy.  Naming the bandwidth was a new one for me, I named it the same as my password.  Oops, easy to go online, and adjust it there.  plan to read through the manual to understand more of what it can do.From the Belkin my reception increased over 25%.  It is tall, so I ended up laying it on its side.Connection to the device is so easy.  I just went to my Laptop, it saw the router, I clicked on the name, then you go over to the router and push the button near the bottom, your connected.Very Pleased at this time.

The Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router is a well made and good looking feature rich device. It was also amazingly easy to install and setup using the included utility that provided step-by-step animated instructions. The process was very straight forward and I was able to have the Netgear router up and running in less than 10 minutes, seamlessly replacing my aging Linksys wireless router.We have a lot of networked devices in our shop, including 3 wired PCs, 3 wireless laptops (two 802.11g and one 'N'), a Linksys hub, 2 wired laser printers, and 1 wireless (802.11g) All-In-One printer. In addition we also hold training and workshops that run over several days and our customers often wanted to jump on our wireless network, something which we often allowed by giving them our WEP Key, but unfortunately that also gave them access to our network devices. The WNDT3700 has a lot of advanced features that made significant improvements to my network performance and security, including:+ 4 Gigabit Ethernet Ports - Each port can auto 'downspeed' to as well to support older Ethernet cards.+ Dual Band Wireless - Supports 'legacy' 802.11a,g and the newer 'N' (very fast indeed) with much better range than my Linksys router.+ Support for Wireless Guest Network - Easy to setup and control access, we use this as a courtesy to our customers in our shop when we hold classes and only give them access out to the Internet, protecting our internal network.+ USB Drive Support - Works very well! We now have a networked 2TB RAID drive that is accessible from all of our shop PCs, it was easy to setup using the utility included on the CD that helps you map the drive. We now store all of our critical files and photos on the network drive. No complaints at all on the speed and performance with retrieving even the largest files.+ Broadband Usage Meter - Useful to monitor your traffic volume to\from your ISP, which is important if you push a lot of multimedia files over a provider that has a monthly usage cap (like Comcast). This seems to be fairly accurate from my casual observations.There are a few features that I don't expect to use (QoS, WPS, etc) but all of the functions I configured worked correctly right out of the box, which is perhaps a first for me and a welcome change over previous network device installations.Overall, I am very pleased with the ease of use and performance of this wireless router! Highly Recommended!

Amazing speed and easy to set up.  Very good range and seemed to be better in the horizontal position.  I get complete coverage everywhere in my house (about 3500 sq ft) and it's located in the corner of my basement.  I'll report back after I have it up and running for a while.

After a couple weeks of suffering with the 610N, I decided to scrap it and found this one-I'm so glad I did. This product is by far the best 11N product that I have ever purchased. The dual wireless and USB features are so easy to setup and use. The performance is stable and it has a great range. I haven't needed to restart it in over a week! I am so happy that I don't need to spend more time and money to look for another router that ends up being garbage (this after 5 Years of looking). The WNDR3700 has everything I need and I'm guessing it will be the last one for you as well. I can highly recommend this product.

Got this item Today (10/1/09), and it is hands down the best router I've seen. Going through web pages with ease while torrenting 2MB down 1.3MB up. I even played some WOW on the pc and Uncharted 2 demo(PS3) while this was going on, and everything was super responsive.Played a few H.264 movies on the PS3, and was able to raise output resolution on the media server to 1080 with no flickering/stuttering at all. Of course with more than 1k different torrent connections going on at the same time.It looks cool. LED's are kinda bright, but not to bad. I wasn't able to use the disk provided with it to set it up since I'm running a 64 bit OS (win 7). However, their is a built in setup wizard in the router config page that just did it automatically. Which is super easy to use, and instantly downloaded the new firmware.Their is no dd-wrt available at the moment dedicated to it, but a quick stop at thier forums showed users who have used wndr3500 versions on it.UPnP does seem a little off since I had to manually set some port forwarding with Quake 3 and torrent software, but after a little research this does seem to be pretty common with all of Netgear stuff.The wireless is unbelivable. Very good range, and after putting it through constant 'stress tests' the router only got slightly warm.First time Netgear user coming from Linksys, and super glad I did.

I'm having some issues actually connecting to the external hard drive connected to the USB port on this router (something with SMB and Windows 7 I believe) but so far so good otherwise.  The Netgear web interface to manage the device is similar to their previous routers which I like.

column9: Netgear Rangemax WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
column10: Have been running a D-Link DGL-4300 for several years with good results.  Needed a replacement with more speed and processing power to handle multi-media, large LAN file transfers and N wireless services.Tried the D-Link DIR-825, but undocumented MAC address restrictions killed the deal.  The router would not accept a non-zero value for the first two characters of the WAN MAC address.Looked at the Linksys WRT-610N, but was concerned with past Linksys product performance.Purchased the Netgear WNDR3700 which was getting very good reviews and selling out quickly after release.Configuration was a breeze with typical Netgear menus.  LAN and WiFI speed are excellent.The DLNA USB device option works great, streaming pictures to our LAN connected Samsung TV.Guest WiFi access with LAN restrictions makes sharing with guests or visiting family easy.There have been no issues using Vonage VoIP and transferring large amounts of data at the same time.  QOS settings are available in the WNDR3700, but I'm not currently using it.  Even with QOS and rules active, the DGL-4300 would sometimes cause the VoIP to stutter during large transfers.Port Address Translation (PAT) is not available.  This makes it difficult to access multiple Port 80 LAN devices from the WAN side.I rate the unit 4.5+ stars.  PAT would have made it a five.

column9: Fast router with easy setup and nice features!
column10: This by far has been the easiest router I have ever installed, and what's even better, this has been the one with the most features!the whole setup process takes about 10 to 15 minutes, but that takes care of everything from connecting the first cable, all the way to setting up a password to protect your network. it even gives you two options, one for those who will be setting up the router for the first time, and the other is for those who will be replacing a router in their network, I was replacing a router went through the setup process with such ease that I was even surprised I was done and back online in just a few minutes.I had two xbox 360's, one PS3, Wii, 2 DVR's, one netbook and two PDA's running on this thing (wired and wireless)just to see how much it could take and I had not one hick-up during testing, it's just so smooth and fast that I didn't miss my previous router one bit, it also has great range as I walked all the way to the neighbors house with the netbook just to see how far it would go and I cam back before I got to lose complete connection, being that I'll never have to go that far to use netbook, I was more than pleased with the results.You can also plug in an external hard drive straight into the router and share it with different computers around the house within the same network.It allows you to setup a second password for guests that come and visit, that is such a great plus since I always have someone that'll ask me for my password, then I realize that I gave them the same password I use for my email account! ha ha.overall I am very pleased with this router and I definitely recommend it to all.Thank you

column9: NETGEAR RANGEMAX WNDR3700 - Fast, easy-to-use and rock solid
column10: This router is fast, easy to set-up and smartly engineered.  Although this is a high-end feature-rich consumer router, out of the box, I had this running in just a few minutes.  Using the simple color-coded 1-2-3 step setup process, an expert, or a novice, can have this router up and running very quickly.Modifying the two dual band networks for different names and passwords is straight forward, and I preferred to do it manually. After logging into the firmware, the screens are divided into three panels.  The left panel is the list of the feature sets, such as 'wireless settings,' or 'guest network' settings; the middle panel has the pick list of options for the feature set; and the right panel on the screen explains, in the easiest of terms, what the features and options mean.  There is little need to refer to the product manual or other help.  Everything is in one place, and in the right place.I attained maximum speeds with each of the dual bands when my laptops were in close proximity to the router.  My throughput on the 5 Ghertz band using the 'n' protocol was a blazing 300 Mbps.  With my previous router, I was never able to achieve anything faster than 130 Mbps.  As is the case with the 5 Ghertz channel, this speed drops off quickly as I moved my laptop away from the router.  By 30 feet, I was down to 100 Mbps a second, but still relatively fast when compared to the legacy 'g' speeds.  On the 2.4 Ghertz band, using the 'g' protocol, I saw very little degradation within 50 feet of the router.I streamed a Netflix movie to an HD television flawlessly through a Toshiba laptop and an HDMI cable.  There was no stutter in the picture, and the picture quality was excellent.  Unlike past video streaming, I did not experience a dropped picture while waiting for the video buffer to reload.I connected a USB disk drive to the router and shared it among three laptops without incident.  I established read and read/write passwords for various file folders on the disk drive.  I also made the drive available for access through the Internet, and again this process was straightforward in creating.  I plan on backing up the three laptops to the USB drive on the router, as well as sharing photos and other files with family and friends by having them access the password protected IP address of my new network-based disk drive.In total, you can establish four networks on this router.  One for each of the dual bands, and two more as guest networks for each of the dual bands as well.  The guest networks are nice as they can completely isolate guests from accessing sensitive information on other PCs or devices on the network.  (Or you can open up the guest networks to everything on the network.)Some other features worth noting are the automatic checking for firmware updates every time you log into the router; the 'traffic meter' that shows daily, weekly and monthly internet usage that can be configured to throttle it; and the ability to backup personalized firmware settings in case of an emergency restore.  With regard to the latter, it would be nice to also get a saved PDF file of what the settings are for each of the backed-up firmware configurations.The Netgear WNDR3700 replaced two Linksys routers that I had connected together to essentially create a 'dual band' environment.  One was an older 'g' unit, while the other was a newer 'n' router.  Together they got the job done in a mixed environment of video and Internet surfing.  But the WNDR3700 takes routing to a newer level, with faster processors driving the dual bands to faster speeds and better range; and a big feature set that is easy to use, understand and configure. SIX-MONTH UPDATE - This router has been powered up constantly for six months now, and it continues to run flawlessly.  During this time, two firmware updates have been automatically flagged and applied without incident. I use many of the key features of this router across the three laptops that are connected wirelessly to the dual bands.  Video streaming from Netflix and other Internet sites continues to work smoothly.Being able to connect a USB disk drive to the router has become a heavily-used feature.  The router-based disk drive is the central location for backing up the data from the three laptops.  I can backup these laptops locally, or from anywhere using the Internet.  When traveling with a camera and a laptop, I am able to easily backup digital pictures to the router's USB disk drive.  It is another way to save and protect files when away.This router is my third, and best to date.

This is an amazing router which was easy to install and easy to set up. Have had no problems with it and it performs beautifully! I don't use all the features it comes with as this is a lot of technology. Definetely recommended however for heavy users.

column9: WNDR3700 works great, get it with WNDA3100v2
column10: The WNDR3700 works great.  Bypassed the setup wizard because of custom requirements.  Have been using wireless for ten years.You likely will need a new adapter to get the full benefits of the WNDR3700.  Ordered it with the WNDA3100 wireless adapter, which had many problems, thus it was returned.Locally bought the WNDA3100v2 which worked great with the WNDR3700 and has much better range.  Its chipset is from a different manufacturer so it should have been called the WNDA3700.  Unfortunately V1 and v2 have the same model number so you need to look at the picture on the box.  WNDA3100v2 has a light and a button.
awesome router, fast, lots of features, hopefully DD-WRT will be supported someday so we can add even more features

column9: Great router, not a single problem so far.
column10: I've had this router for a few weeks now.  It has performed flawlessly.  We have up to 4 laptops, two game consoles an Iphone and an Ipod touch running on wifi and we have not had a single problem.  We also run an HP wireless printer through the wifi signal with no problems at all.  There are a lot of things you can do with this router and I don't touch most of those features.  I wanted a simultaneous dual band with N and this fits the bill and has performed flawlessly so far.

so, far works as advertised. updated the firmware and so far all features work with NOT one single problem. I have tried just about every other dual band simultaneous wireless router and have experienced issues with all but this one. lots of cost but so far it is worth every penny. great product.
I chose this for great performance, both wired and wireless, and because it runs DD-WRT. In practice, both of these expectations have been satisfied.

column9: Good price, great range and a great product
column10: Great range. My business is computers and this is an excellent dual band router. This router was an upgrade to a much older G router at a small business. Signal strength is a factor because the building has an metal exterior and caused bad reception in certain areas. Not a single issue getting a full single anywhere, even outside in the parking lot. Easy to set up also.

column9: Very nice feature packed router for the money!
column10: This little router is performing as specified.  My reliability and up-time is almost 100% now.  As a bonus, I had an extra external hard drive that had been laying around for the past two years collecting dust.  I plugged it into the USB port and now I have a wireless backup solution for my laptops in the house!  Setup was a breeze for me but I am a techie.  The do offer the 90 day free support if needed though.  I purchased this router to replace my NetGear WNR3500 RangeMax Wireless-N Gigabit Router.  Very satisfied so far and I've been using it for a couple of months now.

Purchased this to replace WMDR3400 router which wasn't getting the job done for Netflix wireless/wired service. This router plus a Netgear Ethernet splitter is now allowing us to watch Netflix w/o any interruptions. We used a wired connection to our TV as I was tired of non stop problems with the wireless setup as our Router is in the basement w/computer & the TV is on the 1st floor. I know it's possible to do wireless connection by putting the router on a high shelf in the basement, but we had so much trouble with getting the 3400 to work wireless or wired that I decided to upgrade the router, add the Splitter & designate the Fastest(High Priority) port to the TV. Our iPad is still wireless which had almost always worked with the 3400 & always w/the 3700. I used wired to get the fastest & most reliable connection to the TV,TiVo & computer. We were sick & tired of fighting the wireless setup & having the reset everything prior to watching every episode of a certain series. We fought with Netflix, contacted Our TV manufacturer & our ISP provider to solve the issue. This combination has solved our problem. We found Cat-7 cables cheap on Amazon & all is working Great! No more Interruptions!
I already own on of these routers. I needed another one for a different location. This router provides all the functionality I need. Works Great!! Easy installation and set up.

Once I took it out of the box it was an easy setup and worked great. The users manual could be a little more descriptive, trying to figure out which button to push to add a device was a little confusing.  Overall I'm very happy with it and I'm getting over twice the download speeds I was getting from my old Microsoft router.
Awesome Router.  Easy to set up.  Only took a few minutes to be up and running withe high speed internet

column9: Dual band is the only way to go.
column10: I love the dual band feature. Works perfectly for me since I have one computer that stays pretty close to the router, plus iPads and other devices that tend to be used much further away. Keep in mind, there is a separate power button to turn on the wireless features.
Works perfectly!  It even reaches down the hall to the farthest places in the house and works just fine.  Good signal!

I paired this with a cable modem so I can have wireless access as well as wired.  It has software (Genie)  so simple that you do not have to know anything to make this work.  I have negligible loss of download speed.  I recommend this highly

Excellent product when speed and downloading are what you need. It's great for use anywhere in the house when you want to use your laptop/iPad! Would recommend this product if you are still using an older, slower version of Netgear. Come out of the cave, man, and enjoy updated technology!
Easy installation, never dropped the signal, great router, great range, Much better then the Dlink I replaced 3 times. Recommend!
works much better than my last netgear router. it is much faster and stays connected well with many devices (3 iphones, blueray player, xbox, 3 macbooks, 2 printers...)
I got this ,and it works great , I love it ,easy to connect, also got the extender to use as a repeater

Great product.  I set it up and am able to administrate it with ease.  I am in the IT business and this product supplies what I need.  I am able to setup VPN's, tunnels for viewing my security systems and more.  Secure product.

column9: Set up was easy and painfree
column10: As a non-technical person (well, maybe just a little), it was very easy to set up and replace my old home network.  Easy-peasy and my home wireless internet is working perfectly.
This one was recommend by my cable company. I've had Netgear routers before and never a problem. Great tech support when you do have a problem tho....
Very easy to set up, quick speeds, absolutely nothing to complain about.  Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a home wireless router.

THIS HAS WORKED PERFECT IN MY HOUSE.  I HAVE HAD NO ISSUES WITH KEEPING CONECTION AND THAT IS SAYING SOMETHING.  MY PREVIOUS ONE I WAS CONSTANTLY HAVING TO REBOOT THE ROUTER.  THIS ONE I HAVENT HAD TO AT ALL.

We needed an upgrade from our last router.  This one had great reviews, so I took a chance with it.  It works excellently..  It is easy to set up with good range and lots of features.  I'm glad I took the chance of this product and I am now a fan of Netgear and would recommend this router to anyone looking for an upgrade.

We were having issues with our old router streaming to our TV. This one says it can do 2 HD streams at once. (Provided your server can) Since installing this one, not a glitch, pause or having to reboot the router. Nice to finally have the right combo in equipment for streaming.
This router is great!  It easily accomodates my 4400 sq.ft. home and extends outside.  It was easy to install.  Good product.
Pros:  Reasonable Price.  Excellent performance. Great signal strength throughout residence.  Wireless capability has made my gradual conversion to 'Smart' Tvs seamless.Recommend

Either way as your primary wi-fi router, as a repeater wireless station, or as a wired access point, this 2.4/5 GHz dual band wireless router will do the job you need. Deploy two of them in your home, and have the convenience of a backup for your main router on hand at any time. Plus, cover your home with a strong signal at every spot of your home network area.

column9: I do in fact LOVE this router.
column10: I used this router as stock for quite some time and it was the best even then.  Then I upgraded it with DD-WRT and I have to tell ya...it really brought this router to life with far more options and functionality than the stock software would ever hope to accomplish. Can't go wrong with the WNDR series of routers from Netgear.
I have been using this for awhile now with no problems. It does what it is supposed to do without fail. Easy set up, etc.
I literally plugged this in and it worked off the bat.  I've had netgear before and I like the brand.

column9: Wow the increase in speed it amazing
column10: I should have changed out the router ages ago what a change in the speed of my connection - this router is hot and it works really well - easy to set up and it also gives you and online widget so you can see all the activity on your network - I recommend this
Replaced my tlink router. This one doesn't drop the signal at all.  Have had no problems in the 3 months I've had it.

I went to a local store to find a router that i could use in the basement of the house with my dell 1721 laptop. The salesman said i would need atleast 600 gigs in a larger home. So i came back to amazon, and they had this router for the same price the local dealer had. I had to pay extra for shipping but this is mine, and don't have to pay to rent it. Set the code for wifi, and use your laptop around the house. Great!

I didn't know how outdated my linksys router was until I finally just bought a new one. I use it mostly to play online with Xbox live  with a few wireless devices. I don't want to drag this out so here's some pros and maybe one con.Pros:-Very easy to set up. I plugged it in and signed onto the Netgear router management and set it all up on my iPad.-Gigabyte wired set up is super fast and is crucial if playing games online.-Solid customization options with stock firmware so you don't need to flash 3rd party stuff. (Although they make it pretty easy to do)-Reliable wireless connection never drops.Con:- Does not support new faster AC wireless.Great price and good customization options make this router a solid choice until the newer AC routers come down in price.
This item has a great range in our house. Wonderful security and easy to set up. I would highly recommend.
Awesome product so far.  Use this everyday for work at home.  Great signal strength throughout the entire 1st floor of the house. Would purchase again.  Fast delivery.

column9: Make sure you get the V4
column10: As of now, you can pretty much ignore the negative reviews involving the connections dropping. That's an old firmware issue that was resolved long ago.The new V4 version of this router has significant all-around performance improvements, so closely rivaling the high end models that cost more than double the amount that it seems pointless to pay more unless you really, really need a more robust wireless N setup than this standard 300+300 dual band router provides. For myself, I have wired gigabit for my most important connections, so that's not an issue for me.Three things I wanted from a new router, after my trusty old WRT54G finally bit the dust after 8 years (wifi had been overclocked all that time... it finally burned out):1) DD-WRT compatibility2) Gigabit switch3) Decent enough dual-band wifiDD-WRT support came earlier this year for the V4. If you use this firmware, you already know... first on the agenda is verifying support and yes, you have it here. For #2, obviously I want gigabit ports since I'm set up for it, and this lets me avoid using an additional, separate gigabit switch like I had to use with my WRT54G. As for the wireless... as stated, this now industry standard dual band capability is more than enough for me. I don't even have the 5ghz radio enabled at this point since I'm not even using anything that supports it. I just need my phone, PS Vita (which supports N on 2.4ghz), and occasionally a laptop on wireless. Very light use overall so 'Decent enough' is enough.DD-WRT installed smoothly and I'm up and running with all my tweaks back in place like remote access and the ability to send a wake-on-LAN packet over the internet to wake my system (something that so many stock router firmwares can't support).All in all it's the perfect upgrade for me. Everything I need under a hundred bucks and it is pretty much as powerful and fast as anything considered higher-end... but I stress again, make sure you get a V4! If you can't be certain you are getting the V4 here, pick it up B&M somewhere because you can verify the version on a red label on the box.

I have a n/g/b router I purchased in South Korea, but this was like when the wireless N was just being released to the US so the one I had was pretty fast. I replaced my old one with this and there are so many benefits with this router.I live in a 3 story house with 5 other people and placing this router in the center of the house makes the range so long. We used to carry a wireless repeater for those who lived in the third floor, but now this router reaches to far we don't really use it anymore. If you're a gamer I would go direct connection, but for those who need it to stream YouTube videos, Netflix, or email this is it.
The Internet like I haven't experienced at home ever before. Streaming movies with no interruption,we are able to offer Internet to guest w/o compromising our password . Love it
I bought this for a lot of coverage on my cabin for cameras. It is power for wireless all the way from basement to top floor three floors no problem with signal
I used this to replace two routers that I had needed to cover the whole house.  This works well, extends over two floors.  Quick setup.  Good product so far.

column9: Does the job in a two level house.
column10: I bought this to improve the signal for a PC at a lower level in the house.  Had the N300, which was a good product, but not quite up to the task I needed it for.  Good quality so far, and very easy to set up.  I would recommend this to others.  No problems so far.
Wanted a all-in-one modem router, wireless unit.  It's what I expected. I would recommend it to anyone how what's a all-in-one unit.
Set this up a couple years ago in our 4BR home and haven't touched it since. It's worked perfectly since the day it was put in service. Very satisfied with this product.

column9: Solved alot of wireless problems in our office
column10: Bumped up to this unit to replace a lower-level Netgear 600 that kept dropping connections.  This baby has solved that problem and also more than covers the zone that I need it to.  Works very well for me in an office-zone environment.
Absolutely love the new router.  It performs flawlessly, was a total piece of cake to install, and has worked without a hiccup!!  Great brand, great piece of equipment.

This router was very easy to set up, the instructions were very clear and only took about 7 steps. We have had excellent broadcasting range over about 1k sq ft. This is a very good midrange router and in my opinion, worth the cost.

I had a Belkin router for about a year, and it was working fine. Suddenly it stopped working. I called the Belkin technician and he told me that the firmware of my router had been updated, and that I needed to pay for a 6-month or 1 year technical support subscription (between 70 and 160 dollars) and that he would update my router and assist me with all my computer problems during the subscription length. This response really made me angry and I told him that I preferred to buy a brand new router, but it would not be a Belkin this time. I checked out the available routers and I picked NETGEAR. Before I bought it, I asked the NETGEAT support team which model would best fit my needs (a have one laptop, an android phone and a wireless HP printer). The support team suggested I buy the N600 Dual Band WNDR3700. This was an excellent recommendation. The router arrived quickly, was installed in just a few minutes, without flaw. It is fast and very reliable. I would greatly recommend this router.
Great buy for the price.  I found it very easy to set up both my CPU and my Printer.  The coverage and service is excellent!
My whole family is getting much better reception with this router. My daughter did not have any difficulty installing it.

I really do love this router. Has great support from Netgear and great software behind the router. It is a relatively cheap router for how great it is. The range and speed of 2.4ghz is rock solid, no problems at all. The 5ghz band is not so great at longer ranges but up close it is blazing fast. Overall, for price and value I recommend this product to anyone interested at this price range.
We had another brand that didn't work if I was in another room from the router!  I can be in anywhere in my house and still connect now...just as a router is supposed to work!

Works great.  Network is running much faster than my old (G) network.  Streaming video on WiFi has not buffered at all so far.  The range is good throughout my home of  2200 square feet.  Lots of features such as guest networks for both lo and hi bands.  The lights for each port remain steady on indicating a connected device but they do not blink when data is flowing and I miss that because you can't tell which device(s) are being used.
i set this up and right away i had my wireless home network up and running it is a great value for all of its options
Put on line w/ ease, following genie instructions. Added devices, laptops,and printer to my network .Most time involved new pass word assignment

column9: Works great. A single unit covers my entire house
column10: I wanted to eliminate running wires around the house due to the amount of lightning in Florida. Long wires pick up charges from local lightning strikes. Even if the lightning doesn't hit directly, a close strike can take out your wired networking. This has happened multiple times over the last 15 years.Now all the networking in my house is wireless. The speed of this wireless connection is excellent and exceeds my expectations. My unit is flashed with dd-wrt and it performs flawlessly. If you're looking for additional features, this model works great with aftermarket firmware.

This Netgear N600 router offers plenty of features for network configuration and security.  The USB connector for using an external drive, along with the DLNA media server, is a great bonus.  I would recommend this router to a friend.

I swapped over to this router from my Linksys WRT150N router whenever I purchased my Motorola DOCSYS 3.0 modem and have not looked back since! This router has functioned flawlessly since I first set it up. The setup for the device is an absolute breeze and if you have any previous router knowledge you could most likely do this blind folded. The performance of this router is superior to my old one in many ways, and the routers interface and settings are easily accessible, clearly laid out, and very informative!I took this router a little bit further past standard home use and have it connected to the old Linksys WRT150N with a long Cat5 running through the attic to the other end of the house. This has greatly expanded our wireless ranges by bridging this router with the other. This setup was not as simple as just setting up the router, but all in all it was not that complicated.I highly recommend this router to anyone who heavily uses their broadband internet as that will squeeze the most performance out of this device. As far as Netflix and gaming goes, this router has performed outstandingly on a day to day basis and has yet to give me any problems. By far one of the most painless devices I have had to deal with as far as installing and operation goes.
Does the job without any problems and it is easy to set up. Don't advise using in the vertical position due to stability concerns
It has met expectations so far. Purchased to replace an older one that dropped the wireless frequently. w w w
replaced an old, hard-wired router....this one is so much faster and wireless.  Really expands my office and home system.  Especially a lot better for streaming vids both wired and wireless;ly.
It is very fast and reliable.  It was easy to install and I  have had no problems with it at all.

Flawless install, solid signal, even away from the device. The utilities that come with it are simple enough for non-experienced folks, but the advanced features allow for fine control of your network. I love having gigabit on the wired portion of my network! This router delivers.

column9: Have set up 5 no problems - recommended
column10: Get the 3700, flash dd-wrt firmware onto it (just be sure to use the correct version based on which 3700 v. you have!!) - and you're good to go. Why folks stick with the provided crud-ware on routers and dont flash dd-wrt is beyond me,Anyhoodoodle, I've set up 5 of these now (mine, a colleague, ,my parents', my cousin, and cousin's cabin) and have had not a problem with any of them.  I would recommend to anyone with the caveat that they use alternate software as set forth above.
Easy to setup with Windows 8 computer, but disappointed to discover my computer wireless adapter does not support 5G - will be sure next one does!

column9: Excellent Price, Easy Install, Easy Admin
column10: I have been having router issues for quite some time.  I purchased this router because the reviews indicated that it could handle a good amount of traffic, many device connections, and also that it would be easy to administer moving forward. I didn't really expect it to live up to the reviews given it was so much more inexpensive than other routers in its class.  Out of the box, the setup took maybe 15 minutes from start to finish. Very happy customer.

column9: Fixed all my home network issues
column10: We're subscribers to Comcast. I've got a fairly complex network layout in my house. I was using Cisco ( Linksys) products previously for years. With my wife now working from home (telecommuting) it's critical that the home network be up 100% of the time. I was using a first gen wireless N router from Linksys and we were experiencing significant downtime with the network. This caused her many hours of frustration (and me many hours of troubleshooting) with her company's tech support. I had Comcast come out and they analyzed out signal coming into the house and everything looked good. The Comcast tech was super knowledgeable and after hearing me explain how I've got the network configured recommended this router from Netgear, he said he used the same one at home. That's not their official recommendation, it was just his personal one.I ordered this from Amazon the day he was here, it was delivered in two days, I plugged it in, configured the router using the routers web page and it's been seamlessly working ever since. I can now forget about coming home and scanning through the router logs looking for red herrings as to why my wife was having connectivity issues that day. She'd call me at work 1-2 times each day saying the network was down. It was becoming a real bother.This Netgear wireless router has been working great since I've hooked it up. I would have to say that we "push" the router with all the devices we have connected to it. We can have up to twenty devices in the house connecting to it either wirelessly or plain 'ol cat5. My wife might be streaming Netflix on her tablet while I'm downloading some gargantuan installer from MSDN and the network never hiccups.I have a 4TB external USB drive hooked up to the USB port that allows me to backup our machines through the router. That frees up a port on my main machine for more toys.***Pros***: Simple easy to read/interpret user interface, dual band, guest network, USBReadyShare, Gigabit ethernetThe network interface (webpage) for the router that Netgear has designed is simple, intuitive, and gives you a quick snapshot of your setup on the 'Basic' tab. You can then drill down into menu items on the left column to get more detailed information about 'wireless', 'parental controls', 'internet', etc.For the more adventurous there is the 'Advanced' tab which allows you to go deeper into the router's functionality, 'security', 'administration,'wireless setup', etc.***Cons:*** I have yet to have an issue with this router. It's been up now for two months with no issues.

column9: NETGEAR Wireless Router - N600 Dual Band Gigabit

column9: Great router very fast! looks great to!

Just bought this router yesterday at staples for $99.99. It was a pretty good deal. I cant talk to much about the long term durability for i have only owned it for a day. I previously had the netgear n300 wnr2000 and it lasted for about 2 years but then it got a virus on it and i couldn't use it( it was my fault for not setting up better protection on it) When that broke down I bought the belkin n300 router for a replacement and boy did that backfire on me. The range on it was great but it was extremely slow for gaming, surfing the web, watching youtube videos, and just being on my mobile devices. I had that router for about 2 months before I finally decided which router to buy. I chose this particular router because 1. I am a big fan of netgear 2. The gigabit connection is what i wanted and needed for my pc gaming. 3. I have alot of devices that need connecting to the internet ( 3 pcs, 5 smartphones , 2 ipads, 1 ipod,2 laptops, 1 ps3, 1 xbox360 and a smart tv.) So the dual band capability is really useful for when i game on my pc and my kids are on their gaming consoles. When I finally bought the router it took 10 minutes to setup the router and get all my devices connected to the internet so i was happy that it was very quick to setup. The range is great considering i live in a 3 story house and i get great connection everywhere i go in the house. I might have to buy an wifi extender though as my daughter gets bad connection in her room at the top of the house but if you are living in a 2 story House this has amazing strength and range. I will review again after i have owned this product for a longer amount of time. If you are planning on buying a router for your home this is the perfect choice.

After switching to this router, the system performs as expected. column9: Surprised to find it the most rock-solid router I've ever had
column10: I'd been a Linksys guy back in high school and college, but recently have been disappointed with the downhill their consumer products have been traveling. I gave this Netgear a chance back in December 2010 and I'm pleasantly surprised to find that it's the most stable router I've ever used.For the first few months of ownership, I would update the firmware religiously, hoping that IPv6 support and support for using the USB port as a printer share would be added. The former was given, the latter never was (buy the next version up, they said!) I'd call that a con, but I knew what I was getting into when I bought it so although I wish they could have added that in firmware, I won't have them lose a star for that.The uptime: I have had the device running, at its longest, for a solid year without a restart. I run a network speed tool/gadget on Windows 7 and note that my ISP always gives me 100% of what I'm paying for (I'm lucky in that regard) and my intranet speeds never vary either - they're always what I expect them be.The device has never frozen on me or needed to be rebooted, even. When I say a solid year, I mean I turn it off generally once a year for two weeks when I go on vacation, along with my cable modem. When I get back home, I turn them on again and they're up and running within 3-4 minutes.I don't know if I'm just lucky, but after rebooting my WRT54G every week or so, this has been a breath of fresh air. I definitely will buy a Netgear (with printer sharing!) again after the experience I've had with this one, I hope its successors will be as dependable.(note: I don't use 'readyshare' or flash drives with it; I've heard it's terrible but I have a NAS I use for media files, so it's not important to me. Your mileage may vary)

So, honestly I opened the box, hooked it up, turned it on and was done. I do not know why people are complaining about firmware.I have not had an issue. The only extra step I had to take was to call netgear (support is free for a certain amount of time) and make sure it was setup correctly with my ISP.Over 6 months later:A little over six months later (10 months) and this router is still functioning at great speeds. I definitely would recommend this router. I use it for my internet and have never had an issue no matter what speed. I have not had any wifi issues either. The router comes with plenty of options for functionality and customization. I am using this instead of the router I got with my ISP and I notice a big increase on speeds. No matter how many hops i have in my network, this modem speeds it up quite a bit!
Using this product is more cost effective than renting one through my internet provider. I've had no problems. Therefore, no complaints.
The Good: - Easy to setup - Fast -Good range (using laptop indoors andout) - Attractive designI very happy with  this  purchase

column9: Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band  Gigabit Router WNDR3700
column10: It had been about 9 years since we bought our last router and with the advances in technology we were falling behind the times.  Between the internet telephone we use dropping our calls to our son's computer throwing him off World of Warcrafts, it was time for a new one.  We started shopping around and were quickly introduced to the Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band  Gigabit Router.  We did our research and the we shopped around and found the price to be about standard everywhere, so we picked one up.  We have been happy with the choose we made and the dual band has helped a lot. There is a button to shut down the wireless, but anything plugged into the LAN ports still has internet, yes our sons laptop is hooked up to the wireless, so we can shut him down if necessary. :)  The setup  was extremely easy to do and there is no software that needs to be installed from a disc.  There is a web interface to allow you to customize the setting to suit you particular needs.  We were quoted $100 to have it setup from store, but that would have been a waste of $100.  We did post a video to Youtube showing the unboxing and the setup if you are interested in seeing what it looks like up close and how to set it up.  Our Youtube channel is 'WeRmudfun', just look for the 'Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR3700v4...Unboxing and Setup' video.

column9: The range is as good as advertised
column10: After buying this router, I don't think I'll ever buy another Linksys/Cisco router again.  I figured that Cisco was a very prestigious company that made quality routers.  However, with all the bells and whistles that some quality routers I bought from Linksys/Cisco had, there was always one drawback: WiFi Range and Strength. I was skeptical about buying Netgear. It was either this or D-Link and I didn't want to go down the Belkin route. So I bought this nice router and it's been a lifesaver. With some Linksys routers (such as the E1200 and E2700), I would get fantastic WiFI throughput, but gosh, the second I walked a few feet away from the router, I would lose Wifi strength immediately.  With the WNDR3700, I managed to get decent WiFi speed as far as 50ft (direct ethernet is always fastest, and yes, the farther I walked away from the router, the slower speed I got. I dunno about getting signal at 300+ feet (as the box states), but I sure get a nice decent WiFi signal and strength at farther distances.  I have my main computer connected via Ethernet and I'm running fast on that already. I think that the word 'dual band' throws people off into thinking that this is a really good thing. Well, yes and no.  For one, I don't have many devices that can run on the 5ghz frequency. Heck, my trusty Nexus 7 tablet, my Roku 2, etc. only run on 2.4ghz. So if you have printers or a network that thrives of benefitting on the 5ghz channel, by all means, go for it. Otherwise, the 2.4ghz WiFi on this router is very strong in my experience. Definitely worth the $99.99 I paid for. The price dropped. Also, keep in mind that there were 4 versions of this router that got release. I got v3, which is decent. Otherwise, there are firmware updates you can obtain from Netgear's site. All in all, a great router.
Easy & quick to setup. Works even better than expected. Highly recommend this execs lent router.Have used Netgear products for several years & will continue to do so.
Needed a new wireless solution to replace our oldl linksys router and this worked out perfectly with enterprise class options built in.

column9: Using with DD-WRT v24-sp2 (06/08/12) big (SVN revision 19342)
column10: This version of this router requires two step firmware flashing. Depending on your skills it is a bit involved here are the instructions. I've been using with this DDWRT firmware without any problems. tons of useful features.Two very important things to consider before flashing:1- After flashing to this firmware it requires very advanced linux skills to revert back to factory firmware so be %100 sure about it.2- You won't be able to use DLNA features of the router but any form of USB connected to device works perfectly and router shares the storage device among all devices connected to the router.This is for version 3 not for any other version.  Version 3 uses a broadcom chipTo get dd-wrt on the WNDR3700v3, go to this link follow instructions and download the files.dd-wrt(dot)com(forward slash)phpBB2(forward slash)viewtopic(dot)php?p=728266How to mount a usb storage device?Goto DD-WRT control panelUnder services click on USB tab1- Enable Core USB Support2- Enable USB Storage Support3- Enable Automatic Drive Mount4- printer support is up to you to enable or disable it based on your preferences.5- Select /opt under 'Disk Mount Point'Then click on NAS tab1- Enable Samba in file sharing2- Type WORKGROUP in Workgroup box (I am using win7 and didn't change the workgroup name which windows assigns by default if yours is different type that name.)3- Select /opt under 'path', Type the name of your USB storage drive under 'Name' Check the box 'public' and select the access option to Read/Write4- Reboot the router under administrator tab. You should be able to read all the storage drive info under 'disk Info' when you select USB tab.Note: You may have to reboot a few times to have your USB storage device detected. So, take your time.

Extremely easy to set up. It's been working continuously for over a month, no restarts needed. I'd recommend this router to anyone who just wants fast, reliable WiFi out of the box with no need to tweak it later.

column10: I was looking for a wireless router to work with an enhanced modem upgrade from my internet provider.  this router is great, I have returned to the land of high speed processing,  I would definitely recommend it.

column9: Fast -- easy to install -- haven't used any fancy features yet though
column10: Very pleased with the speed.  Took my son's gaming experience to a new level.  Was easy to install even for a technologically challenged person.  I haven't tried out any of the special features -- mainly wanted it for the speed.

The Netgear Wireless Router (WNDR3700) is exactly what I wanted to establish a WiFi for my home and it has the range that I need to cover the entire house.  Easy to set up and use, especially for a not-techy like myself.  Works perfect.

column9: I own 2 at different home locations
column10: Great router  ez setup  works good with a Magic Jack Plus  Comcast is the only problem there connection speed varies
Works great, easty to set up, fast shipping.  If you already have a DSL modem, this is what you need.  Security is good too.
The setup was quite simple and the improvement, particularly with video streaming of Netflix, was immediately noticeable.  I would recommend this product.

column9: Best router I'v owned so far
column10: My previous 2 Netgear routers were the WNDR 3500's both good routers but seemed to lack the range I needed and would often boot one of my devices off, not this one I spent more for this compared to my last 2 only because I now have a Samsung smart tv a Ipod,Samsung Galaxy tablet and my Galaxy S phone. This router allows me and others to all be connected via WiFi without any lag or getting kicked. The setup was too easy I almost had to do nothing other than plug it up and follow the few steps involved and in 2 mins done. When I stream movies from any of my devices they seem to load and run seamlessly as if watching a dvd and gaming is great as well no lagging its does everything I need it to do.
I have been using this product for the past couple of months.So far its perfomance is excellent.Its working fine and satified with it.
I like this product, There is never a single failure from the time it is turned on since 2 months.
Have been using this router for over a month now, no complaints, easy to install and setup, wireless and wired. The network speed is as expected.

I have installed several of these routers and they all work great. I especially like the guest feature where you can share the internet with a guest, but not allow them to connect to any of the other computers that connect to the router.

column9: Good Wireless Router, easy setup and connect
column10: The router was easy to set up and get started with. I was able to quickly and easily connect to the router with each of my wireless devices. I expected a bit better range out of it, but it serves it's purpose.
The biggest thing I love about this router is the setting for being a WAP.  It's so easy to click on this setting and BOOM... you now have a wap.

column9: NETGEAR WIRELESS ROUTER-N600 DUAL BAND GIGABIT (WNDR3700)
column10: MY SON-IN-LAW SET THIS UP FOR ME, ACTUALLY HE IS THE ONE WHO RECOMMENDED THE PRODUCT.  IT IS WORKING GREAT AS FAR AS I CAN TELL.

Blazing fast, looks stylish and I wall mounted it so it looks quite nice in my home. Even my friends complimented it and inquired about it. It resolved all of my internet connection n speed problems which I had b4 for quite a while.

column9: Great router at a fair price
column10: I chose this router to use with my Time Warner cable Internet service.  From the moment it was hooked up it has worked flawlessly.  All I had to do was enter the code from the box and it did everything else automatically what an easy and friendly router. The speed seems much faster than my previous router and I am very pleased
We have a large home. Our old router just couldn't cover the whole house. This new one seems to do the trick.
Easy to install, very small footprint and works great! Technician installing internet service was thrilled with it and wants one for his home.
Easy set up and no problems works just like it says. I told my friend this was the one to buy but went with a cheaper one. He wasn't satified so he returned it, ha ha.
I was worried about configuration, but it's pretty much done for you if you follow the directions. Installed in 10 minutes. Works great so far.
This Router is super fast, Connection speed to my Roku and Xbox is Fantastic also My Omma internet Phone is very clear I have always owned NETGEAR Routers and they are reliable.
Great router, dual band helped resolve issue with our wireless video network conflicting with our wireless network.Fast and reliable!

This Netgear router replaced my old router and WIFI extender.  I now get a stronger signal and more reliable connection to the internet with my laptop and tablet.  It was also quick and very easy to install.

column9: WNDR3700-V4 is the best one yet!!
column10: UPDATE:We moved to a bigger house (2.5x more sq foot) and the signal was still good on the first floor. On the second floor, the 5G was non-existent and the 2.4 was weak. Decided to play around with some more hardware. At first decided to switch out entire router and bought the new netgear AC router R6250. Folks that router's range was even worse and i decided to stick with the wndr3700. i did buy an extender and am using that now.I initially had the v1 which gave me a lot of problems as the wifi 2.4 connection dropped and I realized that this was a standard issue. I loved the V1 for it's long range wifi antenna and connectivity reliance.Since I liked the features of this router (multiple SSID, guest network, e.t.c.), I opted to buy another version of this product. I got the V3 and that's where more problems started.The V3 had a different antenna provider from V1 and therefore signal strength was weak and choppy at times. Add to that the fact that the V3 dropped WIFI all the time. The router had to be rebooted every other day. Thankfully it was still under warranty and I had amazon switch it out.They sent me a V4 which was a god-send. Not only did it have the same antenna as the V1 (greater signal strength), the setup procedure was a breeze with GENIE. Additionally, GENIE transformed my panasonic wireless multifunction unit into an AIRPRINT printer so I could print from iphone and mac (mac drivers not available for this unit so I couldnt print from mac at all - but GENIE fixed that!).No connection drops and everything works seamlessly. Have had unit for 2 months now.

Not the easiest to set up compared to others I've used, but not too bad.  I haven't tested the range, but I don't need it to reach out real far.  I live in a camper in an area without 4G, or even 3G for that matter.  It's great when I want to check something on my phone, the speed is great.  I have high speed cable internet.  All of the security and monitoring features are the best I've seen compared to my other routers.  Definitely recommend it!
We operate several laptops, iPads, Blu-Ray DVD players, printers, etc. through this wireless router.  And, everything responds normally and smoothly.  There is no lapse in the signal whatsoever.
The product was as expected, meet customer expectations, showed 100% as the site, responsible and very good quality of the goods.
Recommended by the Cablevision tech who came to our house to replace our cable modem.  Told us that our "old" wireless router should be upgraded with this one from NetGear - a brand he recommended.
