I have upgraded from my older NETGEAR router due to more wireless devices in use in my home and to improve streaming from programs like Netflix and Roku. I couldn't be happier. The device installed fairly easily. I had to run through the process a couple of times but once it installed, I immediately noticed the speed increase especially on Netflix. I am now streaming at over 13 MPS as opposed to less than 3 on Netflix which is very noticeable in loading and picture quality. I have all but eliminated any buffering while streaming on my computer. I should have done this upgrade earlier but adding WiFi sometimes can be painful. Luckily, this all went rather smoothly.
I have owned the WNDR3700 for over a year now.  Solid performance, No lock-ups, No dropped connections, and expected good range.  Would Recommend.

Our old router needed to be replaced. This one was recommended by the person who was going to install it. We wanted one that could be private and also be able to have guests and cell phone use it. So their is a guest log on and a private for personal use. I am probably not explaining this very clearly.
I had problem with other routers because my house it is of metal (steel) then I could not  not receive the signal with this router I can without problem
It does help my internet. I'm little far from the router and my ping is like 89 all day long. Love this router now
I have been using this for a while now and It works well. Have a ps3 and 3 iphones that is running on this wi-fi. I use my PC but this is working well for the family. No complaints.

column9: Reliable and the bare minimum for any home network
column10: Just looking for a good reliable cheap router. This one had good reviews. Bought it used and came in great shape and ready to go. I went from 11mbps to 54mbps and all modern devices log into the network flawlessly so far.5 star product and also for a reliably fast delivered product by the seller. :)

I love this modem, it might not have all the features that the top model by Netgear has but if you don't need those top model features (at a top price) than this is a great modem. It is fast both wired and wireless, hasn't needed rebooting since plugging it in a month ago which some modems need. Firmware upgrade detected upon setup went so smooth I was amazed and I've seen some belkin models not go smooth on firmware upgrades. This router detected the internet in our apartments Ethernet and works flawlessly. I would definitely buy again.

I upgraded from an older Netgear router and this one does not disappoint.  What did disappoint however was the installation process.  It took hours and several calls to somewhere in India.  Very confusing.
Want to run cerowrt? Get this router. Or maybe the 3800 instead. I've been running cerowrt on it for over a year now and the thing just never goes down. Rock solid.

column9: Install DD-WRT and it becomes a great router.
column10: I installed DD-WRT and this device it made it extremely useful.  Otherwise the signal strength is great, 5.0Ghz is great for conquering all other signals in my 2.4 filled apartment.  Great device, and I highly suggest you avoid the Netgear Interface and use the DD-WRT firmware.
the speed is constantly  above what I expected. The set up was easy, works with all my internet connect devices.
Great product, have not had an issue with dropped signal since I hooked it up! Would definately recommend this router.

I read lots of reviews on lots of different routers.  Frankly, I never know if the reviews are real or if they are planted to sway buyers one way or another.  I took a chance with the Netgear.  It is a really good router.  I use the wired and wireless options.  The security is good.  I like being able to type in specific MAC addresses so only the computers I allow can use the router.  It is very reliable and I have not had any problems.  We have had it for over a year.
Great coverage and speed. Works great in my home. Both my family and I love this product very very much.

I can't say anything but great things about this router. I have a tendency to "burn" them up after a year or so. I host a server and play a lot of online games and this has yet to fail me in well over a year. This is extremely easy to set-up and configure. Well worth the money!
my ISP installed it!  And it now works as it should. very happy with the purchase.  No more to say.

This router was top notch for the price; It was delivered within two days following the purchase. I would've gone with the higher end model but was not necessary due to the size of my apartment; installation was simple step by step, and had the router working with in ten minutes. For those of you who complain that its cumbersome to install, just follow the directions in the packet.
So far so good. Had a Belkin before this one and it did really, really well. I've added more wireless equipment and hope this holds up!
Recommended by a friend. Very satisfied , easy to install and use .  I have recommened to others to purchase.
excelent item wwe are very plesased with the performance of this item it works gret we will recomended to anyone
This was super easy to install less than 5mins and it was up and running. Strong signal in entire house. I love it.

I just received it within an hour and setup took literally seconds.No cds, no confusing steps. Very simple to connect and to configure. This my second router that i have owned and this is a huge upgrade from my crappy Linksys, which I encountered to many problem to list. I had two day shipping with amazon prime and it was delivered less than 24 hours by fedex. Faster than expected date.will update if any problems
Best router I ever bought since my old WRT54G Lynksys router. So needless to say it's super fast and not as expensive as most!
Upgraded to this model and my wireless speed is awsome! Easy to comfigure and the price was as good as ebay!
This router does exactly what I need it to do.  I'm not a sophisticated user, but really love my router!

column9: Very fast internet and easy to set up
column10: Internet speed is excellent and it was very easy to set up. The dual bands are very helpful because when there are many devices accessing the network at once, the speed is not affected
Was recommended by a friend, so I bought it and it works great.  No issues or problems so far and it has been a year,

Arrived on time. Had some trouble initially connecting my laptop to the router's Wi-Fi using the given password, I would still say it's easy to set up and connect. Even though, 2 laptops and a gaming console were running at the same time, no noticeable dip in the internet speed is observed. I would definitely recommend this product. Excellent router for the price paid.

I really like this product so far! Both bands have really good range even through multiple walls and outside walls. Easy setup and GUI for any user level and size is good to still fit in my network box.

This router helped alleviate the exact problems we had:-We needed a router that wouldn't fade much through the walls-We needed one that would handle cellphones, etc on one signal, and could put our notebooks and wireless game systems on the other-We wanted one that wouldn't be obsolete in a yearWe got all we needed. Great paired with our new Surfboard Modem too.

upgrade from what we used to have. this router has many different features on it that i am unable to explain lol. it does seem to have its own file wher you can load music/pictures/other media to it and share it throughout your network.router is very easy to set up and our speeds are pretty good.

I used this to replace a Linksys, which just upped and died on me. I installed this in ten minutes, needed a tiny bit of help from my cable company in the manner of an IP address, and it was up and running. My kindles and phone picked up the signal and were wireless in seconds! Best of all, unlike my previous router, I can turn this one off when I don't need it, and when I turn it back on, wireless is up in about ten seconds! I really like this router and am very happy with it!
The installation instructions for this router were very very clear!  It works extremely well!  I recommend this product to anyone who wants to replace a router.
Good price  and  Great service!!!!!!! Merchandise arrived promptly and undamaged due to excellent wrapping and packaging. I would highly recommend trading with these folks!.

column9: Easy to set up, no hassles
column10: It just works well, remarkably my ping seems better when I play online games with this thing. My previous connection was pretty unstable but its rock solid now.

The forum discussions on the netgear wndr3700v2 router were solid. So I took a chance and bought a refurb from Embiz.  Had a problem with the initial router (no fault of Embiz).  Contacted Embiz, and they promptly replaced the router. I must say, I was highly impressed (quick response, no stress resolve, and fast shipment on the replacement). I'd buy again from Embiz. As for the functionality of the replacement router, so far, so good.

column9: Wireless Router works like a charm
column10: The best wireless router I've owned so far. I have used three others over the years and this one is definitely head a shoulders above the rest.Been using it for quite some time and have had no complaints. It is fast and reliable, what more can you say.
This is a great router.  Easy setup.  Works so well with my ipad, Macbook Air, pc, and Roku.  Super fast.  I love it.  Wish I bought it earlier.
The Netgear Router exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend it to anyone needing a router.  It was easy to set up and deploy in my house.
This is a great product. recommended by friend who has it. Very very easy to set up. Economical with space. Will see how it handles over time, but at present it's excellent.

This router is AMAZING!!! It's fast, has insane range, and is really easy to set up. I chose Standard Shipping 3-5 business days and it got here in two! If you are looking for gaming or just loading 1080p youtube videos fast this is the router for you.
I was able to install this router quickly, instructions are easy ti follow, working perfectly! Priced reasonably. Netgear hasn't let me down yet!

We have this router in a central location in our 1800 sq foot house. We have excellent WiFi service throughout the house and within about 100' of the house outside too. We have three things plugged into the Ethernet connectors, and run a WiFi printer, three WiFi computers, a ROKU, and two iPod Touches on it. The new iPod Touch 5 runs on the very fast 5GHz Wifi too. The router handles all of this without any problems. The router has not filed us once. If we have WiFi issues in the house it always has to do with something other than the router.The setup and user interface is very easy to work with too. I highly recommend this router.Another nice feature is a Guest WiFi capability. If we have guests in the house we can give them internet access without them having access to our local network and data.

Router came in two days.  It was easy to set up, start, and was operating in no time.  I had not issues with setting it up with SSID and password, and using it.  Instantlhy increased our range and flexibility with wireless devices in the house.Have had it on for two days now and no problems to report.

column9: easy basic setup, faster than my old router
column10: It's only been running for a couple days but I really like it. My speed test speeds went from 12mbps down to 25mbps. Obviously my old router was pretty old. So far it's been stable and haven't had any hiccups when browsing/downloading/streaming. The quality is good. It's smaller and sleeker than I expected.

I needed gigabit network ports.  The wired ports are gigabit.  I now can transfer data within my home network very fast compared to 100 mbps. The dual band wifi is a great feature, but the dual band belkin usb adapters always default to the 2.4 ghz wireless and not 5.8.  If you are in 2.4 wireless spectrum, and your network adapter is a single band frequency you should be fine.  My laptop can see the 5.8ghz wireless but defaults to 2.4. My Belkin WIreless N 2.4ghz adapter works super fine.  I had to return my dual band adapters still sticking with my older usb adapters.Overall performance its rock solid, only had to restart after the firmware update or when i modify something.  I have yet to restart because it crapped out.  The options GUI is a little more different than DLINK routers.  But you get the hang of it after a few mins.

column9: Works Great in my home network
column10: Seven months ago I switched back to Charter for my internet access after a less-than-steller experience with another provider. Since fast and reliable internet access was my goal, I replaced my old router with this Netgear N600, WNDR3700, wireless router / switch. I chose this router/switch after reading several reviews and I am very happy with the results. I have had this router-switch now for over 7 months with no trouble at all. My home network includes 2 PC's and a network wired printer, plus a Roku streaming video box plus several video equipment connections such as my DirecTV all-house HD sharing and the Blu-ray. Several wireless devices including my iPad and a wireless connection to my DirecTV whole-house system. I feed this router-switch with a Motorolla SB6121 cable modem which also works really great !

Router was easy to install and worked fine.  The USB port allows attachment of a network drive so that I can conveniently back up files from all the machines on my network.  Setting up the drive was very simple with the supplied instructions.

Router was received in just one day after order with '2 day shipping'.  Installation was straight forward and quick.  Up and running in minutes.  Cord hookup was most time consuming part.  The router provides 5 bar signal throughout the house.  Not a single problem to date.  Price/value makes this router highly recommended.

column9: Perfect router to extend ATT U-Verse signal!
column10: After researching several routers to extend ATT U-Verse's RG wireless signal, I settled on this one and setup was a breeze and it's a very powerful router with lots of useful options - particularly the USB port which allows you to turn any flash drive or external hard drive into a NAS device. Netgear has a winner with this one!
Good product. The wired gigabit ports are just what I needed. Netgear is the best. The price was acceptable too.

This is a great router. The setup was so easy. I hesitated in buying a new one because the thought of what I'd have to go thru in setting it up. I kept loosing my wifi signal with my old router so finally I broke down. My cousin purchased this one and told me about it and how easy it was. Am I glad I did. It was so easy to do, no Cd involved. I think it took me only around 10 minutes or so to do. The days of loosing my wifi signal are gone. I highly recommend this router.Also Amazon's delivery was prompt, it arrived just in time for me. So glad I purchased this router.
I bought this product only to use the Roku streaming player I bought the same day. it was easy to install, was delivered fast with amazon prime and works great with the Roku.
I chose this router because it was the same brand I had before and my computer tech recommended this particular model for my home.  It definitely meets the needs of our household.

column9: NETGEAR Wireless Router - N600 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR3700)
column10: The NETGEAR Wireless Router - N600 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR3700)was easy to set up, including the security and has provided a superior connection since installed. My previous router worked fine but often dropped connections, which was a bit aggrevating, to say the least.

I've owned and helped friends with numerous brands of routers. I am consistently pleased and satisfied with the Netgear brand. They are easy to set up and their web-based configuration menu is easy to navigate and use. With this router in particular I am happy with the dual band as well as the dual band guest network options also. I am glad I chose this router and recommend it.
This is a great product  no one will be let down the easiest way set up also plus a guest account great stuff.

I have Comcast high speed internet and I wanted to upgrade my wireless router for more coverage and more speed, both of which this router accomplished. You know you have a problem when the neighbors wireless has a stronger signal than your own.The installation was ridiculously easy with plugging in and opening the browser to set up the SSID. We live in a narrow, and tall three-story brick brownstone and we have several low-reception spots.  I have not tested all the blind spots but so far I am happy with the performance: stronger signal, more coverage.PS-I picked this Netgear product because the Comcast forums rated this the most compatible with their high speed internet. They were right but although  I do not have a D3 modem, the speed is respectable.

I am by no means tech-savvy. If something doesn't work right, I am at a loss as to why. When our old router died last week, I was frustrated that I was going to have to install one by myself (the last one was professionally installed for free).With the features of this router, I was scared ordering it. Would I be able to figure out how to set up a password and account name by myself?It came with a simple, concise, easy-to-read pamphlet on installing it (complete with pictures!). When I had it installed and the internet wasn't working through it, the Netgear Net Genie showed up on my screen and automatically suggested possible fixes. (They worked.)Then Net Genie helped me set up account name and password. All in all, the process took me less than 10 minutes.I would recommend this router to anyone. It even has its own little base so it stands up sideways, and doesn't take up much room.

I thought it was about time that I replaced my old router for something new. After a long search I settled on the N600. It's a fantasic router, that took me only 5 minutes to setup. The firmware works great, so no need for third party firmware.
I was having trouble with my old router so I  got one from local store. It was easy to setup and is working just fine. I did down load there software, so far everything works great

I replaced my Linksys wireless router with the Netgrear N600 about two months ago with the hope of achieving better wireless speeds.  I had regularly been speed testing the Linksys and never got better than 1mb download speed and very limited range in my house.  To my surprise, the new Netgear router speed tests at 27.5mb download/4.75mb upload!  It was a remarkable improvement in both speed and range, as well as including additional features not available on my previous router.  I highly recommend it and it is well worth the slightly higher price I paid for it.

I purchased this router from Amazon about 18 months ago.  I loved it since the first day I set it up.My home is pretty demanding on its network.  Half a dozen gaming consoles, desktop PC, tablets, and laptops oh my.  This router has handled it all in stride.I have most of the media I watch on my desktop PC in a media share, from which I access from my Xbox360 to watch from my comfy sofa on the big screen.  I've had no buffering issues using the wireless G (haven't prioritized getting an N adapter for my 360 yet).Pro tip, if your going to wire anything to this router make sure you pick up CAT 5e or 6 cabling or else you'll won't be able to utilize its gigabit port speeds!

I purchased this router as an upgrade to the Netgear N150 I had because I was going to increase my speed of my internet service and I wanted something that would easily handle the 20/2 speed I was going to subscribe to, and this product met my needs. It arrived quickly and in good condition.  I ordered this product from amazon.com, and I am very please with the service I received.  This router installed without a hitch, and it connected to all of my wireless devices without a single problem.  I would say that the time it took to connect 5 wireless devices, and a wired desktop computer was less than 30 minutes tops!!!  The installation software is so intuitive, it is scary when ones realizes how far we have come in upgrading and installing new equipment.  I have had the router installed for a over a month now and not one thing has occurred which would make me regret this upgrade and purchase.  Plus amazon's price for this product was otustanding and it saved me many dollars.Don

One thing I've noticed with other reviews is people claiming they had problems with this router. The first you should do when buying a router is make sure you have the latest firmware installed. This router should check for updates automatically. This is the 2nd Netgear router I purchased and I love this product. I like the following features1) 2 SSIDs for the main network. 1 for 2.5 Ghz band and 1 for 5 Ghz band2) 2 guest SSIDs and the ability to limit access to the router for guest access3) This router keep track of bandwidth used for the current and last month. This is important for people who have bandwidth limitsI've had zero problems with this product.The only downside I can come up with is the blue light is very bright. This can be a problem if you keep the router in the bedroom.

Before purchasing and installing the NETGEAR WNDR3700 router I typically could only access my wireless network one device at a time. This was a very frustrating issue for my family. Since installing the NETGEAR router I can now connect with all my wireless and wired devices at the same time without any connection or performance problems. This router has been all I wanted to improve my in-home network and maximize its performance. Connected to the Motorola SB6121 cable modem it has been a perfect solution to my networking issues. A very satisfied customer indeed!

This was a upgrade purchase to handle increased speeds of my ISP.  Previous experience with Netgear products made this selection a no-brainer.  Very happy with the functions, speed and reliability of this router.

I received this via Amazon but from a non-Amazon seller. The seller shipped the router immediately and I received it in the posted time frame. It was well-packaged and it fit the description that the seller provided.The product itself has been working okay for the past 2 weeks. I only had temporary slow wireless internet connect once but it could also be from the internet provider.So far so good.

column9: Got a v3, but surprisingly pleased with stock firmware
column10: I bought this router planning to install DD-WRT, but when i got it I found out it was a version 3 which isn't supported. Initially I was planning on returning it, but after a week of excellent performance I'm very impressed with the stock firmware. It has all the functions that I need, and while I would still prefer DD-WRT, I am having a hard time wanting to return a router that offers better reception, speed, and stability than my old router. Not to mention the awesome simultaneous dual-band wifi. I will be able to get by just fine on the stock firmware until someone hacks some custom firmware on here. Can't speak to long term reliability yet of course, but fingers crossed!

Easy plug and play set up. Range is about a 75 foot radius around our home. Super fast up nad download. Will stream movies on four devices at once, and still play internet radio on another. Easy access to a portable hard drive plugged into router from multipule devices. Very happy!

column9: Just what I wanted--lots of easy 0-days
column10: UPDATE: In the newer WNDR3700v4, my 0-days from Black Hat and DEF CON are gone.  But good news! There are others that are just as good.  Sadly, this time around, the DLNA service can't be exploited if no USB drive is plugged in.  Still giving this device 5 starts though for all the fun exploitation.  Keep it up!Here's a link to my exploit code:[...]Original Review:This device is perfect for my needs.  Plenty of trivially exploitable vulnerabilities that will give you the admin password, WPA key, and even pop a remote root shell. Plus, it's vulnerable to Reaver.  Ideal fodder for a DEF CON talk.  If you're going to be in Las Vegas next week, come check it out.

I tried to cheap it and originally purchased a TRENDnet TEW-731BR - that was a mistake - not that it did not (at all) work, it just worked very poorly.  The router is a replacement/upgrade from my old (and still working) Netgear Wireless-G router.  Setup was simple, for more advanced setup - it's all there.  I love the USB attached storage and built in DLNA server - DLNA access is the primary reason I upgraded to a wireless-N router and this one has it built in.  Access in my house is a mix-match of wireless-G, wireless-N 2.4GHz and wireless-N 5GHz and everyting works smooth.  Basically 4 times the cost of the TRENDnet, but you get what you pay for, and on the flip side of that - you pay for what you get. ...know what I mean?  I'm satisfied, it gave me no headaches.  No complaints, but one point:  They don't list a specification on the maximum storage capacity the USB port can handle.  It is 2TB per Netgear technical support.  Worth the money.

I just got this router and it seems to work without any problems. This router has noticibly faster wireless than my old router and the gigabit feature is nice because therefore in works in conjunction with my Netgear GS108 (8 Port gigabit switch witch I will also be doing a review on). Since I just got it, I don't have much to say but I will be updating this soon.!!UPDATE!!This router has been excellent. It has many features and connects all of our wireless and wired devices day after day with no problems. I love the external hard drive feature, I use it a lot and it is awesome. Great way to toss up something and then access it from any computer on your network. Sadly, I have had to restart the router a few times, but overall not many times at all and the router goes day after day with out any problems. Not lets talk coverage, all routers say that they have 'Amazing range'... but it really really depends on your house and what is blocking the router's signal. For example in my house the router's signal is blocked by a large brick wall, therefore some of the far rooms in the house are not covered. However overall the router has good range for most houses.You really can not go wrong with Netgear. I used to have a Linksys router by Cisco and I had to reboot the router often. Other then that, the router had goos range but still I like the Netgear router better. It has awesome features, good range, and works great.I will post another update later.UPDATE: DECEMBER 10, 2013Still doing great! I had to re-boot it couple of times, maybe about once a month, which considering for a router with these features and all the stress i put it under, that's pretty good.

I bought this router to replace my old G only router.I am very pleased with the first 2 weeks of use. Very simple to set up. Upgrading the firmware to the latest one was a breeze.The initial setup took a little bit of time, but it wasn't difficult at all.I bought a Patriot 16 GB USB drive and attached it to the back USB port, and now all computers connected to my network can see this drive as a network drive. I have a bunch of pictures and music, great for parties.

I purchase this product on a Sunday and Receive it the next day in the mail, OUTSTANDING delivery. Product was shipped as described NEW in original packaging. It took me every bit of 15 minutes to setup and configure before I was connected wirelessly. My old router I had to manually reset at least once a day because I would loose wireless connectivity, so far with this router I have not had to do that at all. Product is working beyond my expectation.

This router has better range and handles multiple devices better than the previous unit (wndr3600), we just hope it lasts longer (more than a year) than the 3600.  With its upstairs location we had to reconnect my downstairs dish reciever to it ( via broadband) and we will probably add a wireless printer in the near future.  Netgear still makes a better product than Belkin.

I spent several hours researching routers and I ended up getting this one based on the security options, the great software that comes with it (which is realy great), and all the great reviews. I was not dissapointed when I got it and set it up.The setup is very simple and I had the internet up within 1 minute of hooking it up. And I had configured the wireless network, including a Guest account, configured within another 5 minutes.I immediately went to [...] to check the speeds and I have a 7Mbps increase in download speed(Went from 10Mbps to 17Mbps), I had a D-link before. The upload speeds stayed the same, right around 4Mbps. The wired computers and the Wi-fi phones/tablets all run the same speeds.I keep the router on the floor under my desk and I can still go outside or upstairs or anywhere around the house and still get full reception (all the bars).  I have been as far as 100yrds from the router and still get an excellent signal.If you are looking for a perfect home router, this is it.

Just what I was looking for in my house. I have a video baby monitor in my house that runs on the standard 2.4 GHz that most electronics run on which interferes with all wifi signals. With the dual band signal from this router it's not a problem. Easy to set up plug and play practically easy to setup you're own network and encrypt it. Great set up for a good size house with wifi hungry devices like phones, laptops, video game consoles, and TVs. not to mention the price was well below all other sites I found this on.

column9: Great router for a normal home user
column10: Just set it up last night. The set up is pretty easy. If you are average with computers/electronics, you should not have a hard time setting this up. I like that you can have different names for each band (2.4/5) and different passwords + a guest network on either of those bands as well. My house is not very big but it reaches all 3 levels and makes it around a big brick chimney as well. I was hoping the 5mhz band would reach my bedroom well so I could use it with my ipad and it does perfectly fine. My old linksys (just a 2.4 G) did not reach my whole house well. I am very satisfied...so far.

I replaced my older (and very reliable) Linksys WRT54G with the Netgear WNDR3700. The Netgear was very easy to set up and the user interface is logically structured. A few of the options in the advanced settings area are not well defined in the manual, but google is your friend and will come in handy if you're unfamiliar with the settings.Overall I'm very satisfied with the 3700. With the same internet service, It's definitely faster than the older Linksys (to be expected) - you'll especially notice the wireless speed and reliability improvements.  After over a month of use I haven't experienced any problems either.At $99 I can easily recommend this router.

I didn't know what to expect  but the the installation turned out to be very easy and quick.  The CD gave simple easy to follow instructions.  There were no glitches.  However some of the terminology was new to me and it took me a while to understand what was meant.

finally went wireless and this was the router i chose for my 2 story house. its a hit! son is on ipod all the time, wife  watching tv on laptop, me online gaming on desktop (i did increase my bandwith from my internet provider when i did this)all at the same time and you would never know the difference if they werent. when i installed it i called my internet provider and they walked me through it, so dont feel like you need to know anything at all about installing one of these, cause you dont. all you need to know is this is what you need if you want to go wireless and you need to cover a good size home.

My router is in my wifes office upstairs, and my desktop is in the living room.  This is quite a distance to travel.  It also has to go around three corners and down stairs.  I have had it for about 6 weeks and it has never dropped a signal.  I also use it for watching Netflix using a Sony media player.  This uit and TV are downstairs also.  Movies play seamlessly.

I've been very happy with this router. I've had it up for about 2 months, with no problems. Consistent wireless connection; nice guest feature separates networks. No problems with dropped connections.I bought the refurbished router. V2 shipped, as I expected. However, the serial number is blanked out. This was not indicated in the seller remarks.

Got the router configured within ten minutes. Has been working great since then. The only problem we've had is with the 5GHz network. For some reason we are regularly unable to connect to that wireless network. Fortunately the 2.4GHz network works great and is more than fast enough for our needs. Has been a solid router so far and really appreciate the easy setup.

PRO - SET UP WAS A BREEZE, HAD A NETGEAR. got a greater range out of this router, speed is slightly faster compared to previous. have multiple set up for guest account. works great all in all. even hooked up a external hard drive and it streamed to my laptop and to my crappy WD tv wifi connection..
This wireless router has an excellent, steady signal as well as a very strong range to reach every part of the house.
I researched this first and it was rated as the best for the money and it has lived up to the reviews.

column9: Simple to install and connect to my 3 devices; works as advertised at an excellent price
column10: I read a number of on-line reviews before choosing this brand and model and I wasn't disappointed. It proved easy to set up and to get my devices - a PC, a Kindle, and a Roku - to recognize it. I have not experienced any problems of connectivity or performance speed to date. The preinstalled name and password seem to be a good idea and worked well.
Purchase to replace old router, that I had for years, old reliable finally had to be replaced, new router is much better.

column9: Does just what it is designed to do
column10: Easy to use. Clear easy directions. Took just minutes to set up with all my gear.If you really want to use this router to it's full potential, you do need to download the PDF manual.
Over many years routers have come and gone.  This one is the best so far.  And it is compatible with Comcast internet.Easy to setup and use.  A winner.

This really increased my wireless speeds compared to the old Netgear G router I had.  So far, it has been very stable and hasn't needed to be re-booted.  It is not the fastest router out there, but I also don't have the fastest internet connection, so it works great for me.
Easy to install.  My WIFI is working faster and streaming videos are processing more efficiently.  It is also a very nice looking device.

I have owned about 8 wireless routers. Most were Netgear which so far is my favorite.A storm took out my last N.G. so i thought that since it was a few years old i would try something different.I bought a Cisco-Linksys WRT54GL mainly because of the reviews and amount of people who bought it.All i can say is what a hunk of junk that Cisco-Linksys WRT54GL router is!It so limited on features its sick, things like that should not be even allowed to be sold. What shocks me the most is the high feedback on it.All i can say to that is, most of those people either have never tried a Netgear router, or have no clue what a router should be able to do as far as controls to the user.OK, enough of that, and onto this router. Like i said this is the best one by far i have owned. It chucked full of features and is ultra user friendly.Unlike many other routers i have tried to date, this one is able to know if there is a firmware update on it own, without me having to go to the manuf. site and look for it, then download and install it. When i first started it up, I nailed my WAN connection setup in seconds where it was a fight with the Cisco. after it got the connection it told me there was a firmware update and would i like to apply it. Setting up the rest of the network was a breeze and adding other controls like QOS was a snap. I like QOS because with kids in the house on XBOX, tables and so on i want to make sure 'I' have the highest priority bandwidth and leave them the leftovers ;)There are just to many features on this router to get into that it has over the Cisco, I assure you that if you get this router you will be hooked on N.G.

Wow... after reading about this router, I couldn't believe that, even with as high of expectations that I had, it would exceed them!  I immediately got much, much better wireless speed than I had before.  The 2.4ghz band had me connecting with my PC at 140 mbps, and the 5ghz band at 300!  Where before my streaming would studder, its now flawless.Could not be happier with this product.

I needed to replace an aging DLink router.  As I started looking for a new router I had a list of 'things' I wanted. The new router must have Gigabit capability, must have dual bands and must be affordable.  To me, affordable was $100 dollars or less.  So, this router met 2 out of 3 on my list.  I modified my third point on my list to $115.  I could not find another router that could meet all 3 requirements so I purchased the WNDR3700.  I consider myself to be pretty knowledgeable about home networks (This will be the fifth router I have used in the last 15 years and I have had at least 2 computers networked at my house for the last 18.  I currently have a home network of 5 desktops, 4 laptops, 2 smart phones, a Wii, a BluRay player and 2 printers.) so I skipped the 'wizard' set up.  I am happy to say that my 'network' was down for less than 15 minutes!!  The web interface for administering the router is nicely done and extremely easy to use.  I had a little issue with IP reservation for specific computers (my server) and printers, but quickly realized I needed to just restart the router for the changes to take affect (yes, I know, I even said DUH when I did it!!)So, I have no reservations about recommending this router to anyone who is looking at replacing or merely upgrading a router.

Loved NETGEAR N600 WNDR3700 it works great; improved distance from unit; strong signal strength in fact my folks use it next door; the dual-band definately worth the money; no neg comments....  arrived fast and tracking was a snap.

column9: Awesome router once you put openwrt on it
column10: This is the perfect router to put OpenWRT on. It's very stable, very fast and has strong wireless signal. The lights are a bit too bright and blinky though.

I love this thing it works great its fast and doesn't mess up at all! the only thing i didn't like is that it took me a long time to set it up and had to call the internet company to get it to work.... but other than that, it works like a charm!

I have only been using this for a month so far other than a glitch getting it installed no problems.  Tech support was fantastic and so patient with me, once I called them (for free) I was up and running.So much better than my belkin wireless router.  It did cost a lot more than the belkin.  My son is a tech-head and this is what he advised my to buy so I did.

I bought this router a little over a month now. I researched it before buying...good reviews and many different features. It shipped quickly and arrived in great condition. It was very easy to set up. The router stopped working ( no internet access) after a couple of days. I spoke with technical support, which is available 24/7 and they walked me through each step. We concluded that it was a IP address issue and cleared it up. After the internet issue, I haven't  had any no more issues with this router. The range in my house is awesome!!... Happy shopping and Enjoy!
Own this router for 2 years now and I am very satisfied with its range and reliablity.  I had no problems whatsoever!  I highly recommend it.

I replaced an older wireless (N-draft) modem.  This unit was easy to install and it took about 15 minutes total.  Just follow the instructions on the screen.  One thing I did notice is that the upload speeds were about 6 times faster using my fiber network provided by Chelan County PUD.  So far, it works great at regular distances in a rambler house, including in the detached garage and outside in the parking area.

column9: great price and it is clearly one of the best routers i have ever used
column10: gaming, media-streaming, and fast wireless. loaded with the premium features for the price. also has parental controls,internet timer,bandwidth control. also easy to turn into a switch(don't forget to disable dhcp server) then plug into lan port 1 into first router, that is after  you  set up a wireless network on another floor. I dedicated one ssid for our alienware wireless and gets 300mbps! check QOS to auto,detect upload speed, and get ready to rock!
What can I say, being a gamer I went from lagging out of lobby's and frequent booting from Xbox live to being the host with the strongest connection. Out of the box setup in 5 minutes, buy buy buy.

column9: Great Device!! Best tuner for HD Video streaming!
column10: Easy setup!Great GUI.Flexible options, Guest Network W/Wireless IsolationUsing this with SIliconDust HDHomeRun PRIME for HD Digital TV/DVR. I would recommend this to a friend!
The install was simple and works like a charm!  Coverage from old linksys G was not greatly improved.  A great buy and I highly recommend it to anyone.

i always recommend netgear and have been installing them for myself and friends for years!  This modem is a beast and setting it up is easier than any router I have set up (professionally and personally) I always recommend Netgear and will continue to do so!

The WNDR3700 is currently the hacker's darling for routers. Dual-band, hella tons of RAM, fast processor, and all but arbitrary to install OpenWRT or DD-WRT onto. Watch out, however, as Netgear has implemented a 'V3' model, which has a completely different processor and has not been updated for DD-WRT or OpenWRT yet.That said, my unit arrived as a V2 model, which meant that I had it up and running custom firmware (DD-WRT for me) in under 5 minutes. Once I was done with that, I had it set to my requirements (no DHCP, seamless wi-fi roaming on G/N 2.4ghz, separate 5ghz network) in under another five minutes. It's been working brilliantly since then, with none of the drop-outs warned about in its DD-WRT wiki entry.Plus it looks smexy. VERY happy with this router, probably more than any other hackable router I've ever purchased.

column9: Great router easy setup and performs great
column10: I bought this router to upgrade my old Netgear router. This router performs much faster than the previous model which I had purchased 7 years ago. I recently upgraded my internet speed to 25 mbs through Comcast. I tested my modem and then the router and this router provides the exact same speed quality. The movies through Internet stream seamlessly. I am not a techie guy so I have not used the other features some folks seem to be complaining about. I only use it for regular wi-fi performance and it works great. I tested it on my Samsung LED TV (UND55 7000) and on my Sony Blu ray player BDP-BX2 and they all work great (my router is close to these units within the same room).The setup was easy and pain free. The only step I got stuck for a moment was the security method. Netgear reference guide says 'NETGEAR recommends WPA-PSK (TKP)+WPA2-PSK (AES)' however the setup screen would not let me select this security method and it directed me to select another security method. It's not a big deal to me so I selected another security method.Overall, I would recommend this product but if you wish to use it for other extra features, you may want to read other reviews.

Wow! After 10 years of Linksys, what a relief!  The Netgear n600 was so easy to setup. Power down the Comcast modem, power up and run setup on the Netgear install disk.  Follow the setup steps; turn on WPA2 security; turn off SSID broadcast; upgrade the firmware (what a constant challenge on Linksys) and I'm up and running in 30 minutes!  Speed test-WOW!  After running speed tests om my IPAD BEFORE the N600 I saw anywhere from 5 Mbps to occasionally 8 Mbps with Comcast and 802.11G, NOW seeing a consistent 17 to 19 Mbps download!  No issues with Comcast VOIP.This box is awesome!  Entire house up and running is another 15 minutes!  Signal strength is awesome throughout my 2 story house.  Apple TV downloads and iPad videos are now lightning fast!  Thank you Netgear!One month with the Netgear N600 and still amazed at the speed!  Zero issues.  Just ran another speed test from my IPad--17 Mbps download and 5.5 upload!  What an amazing performance improvement over wireless G.  (Ran a speed test on my 3 yr old HP laptop and only saw 10mbps--darn!  It can only run 802.11G.  Old school technology.  Time to upgrade.).  802.11N is the only way to go if you are streaming video from the Internet.But the real benefit of the Netgeat was ease of setup, usage and range.  No issues in my 2 story stick built house with the router on the second floor in the corner of the room.  The user interface makes it very easy to adjust settings, turn on a guest network in a snap, plug in a network attached storage device.  All simple stuff!  Love this router!
This netgear wireless router is a great one. It has a dual band and the setup is 'child's play'. If you need a wireless router, get a Netgear!!!

I have installed many routers over the years. I do like netgear, although like all vendors not all their products are great. I got a V2 of this router, which has much more memory than the V1. I loaded DD-WRT on it, and it works perfectly. I haven't had to restart it often, which is rare for me as I have over 20 devices on my network. I have 10 wired devices on it including an xbox, tv, and media streamer. It works flawlessly on the wired side, and LAN speeds are fantastic. The wireless radios took some tinkering (which I expected) but are super reliable as well. I really enjoy working with networking gear, and this is the best router I have used to date for my requirments. The N900 and Cisco E4200 look great also, but I don't have any wireless clients that could take advantage of it. For now, the WNDR3700 V2 is definately my router of choice.

column9: Excellent, dependable router; Set it up and forget it
column10: I purchased this router 8 months ago to replace a 7-year old Belkin 54G wireless router, which had performed beautifully.  The only reason for the replacement was for the updated speeds.  I was a bit nervous about replacing a perfectly working router with an unknown since my husband often works from home and MUST have a dependable, high speed connection with no breaks in service as his ability to work depends entirely on a connection to his office computer system.  But, after 8 months, I can honestly say that this router has NEVER dropped a connection, and I highly recommend it (my desktop PC uses a wired connection, but all other devices are wireless).  Setup was very easy and it's nice to have options to create multiple networks (two in each band).  For example, my husband's work computer is on a separate 'guest' network from our home devices.  Certainly the speeds are faster than on the 54G router, and the wireless network has better range across my home as determined by my netbook, which is typically used to watch TV via Slingbox on the opposite side of the house, as far from the router as possible.  Without changing the wireless adapter on the netbook (which is the old wireless-G), the connection strength is higher than with the old router. I haven't yet tried setting up and connecting a drive to the router, as a dependable connection was my first priority.  Overall, a great product and I highly recommend it.

This is a great router.  I did brick it to the point where it was constantly rebooting, but not functioning.  There support wanted to charge me $39 to fix it, but I found thisI am going to have to get a new tshirt. Thinkgeek has one that says 'I void warranties'. I need a shirt that says 'I brick wireless routers'.Until a few minutes ago I had a bricked Netgear WNDR3700 wireless router. I also have a bricked Linksys router, I'll try to restore it next and post instructions if I have success restoring it too.I have tried the tftp restore instructions on both routers with no success. The netgear was in a continuous reboot cycle and the put command just timed out. I was able to use the Netgear firmware restore utility to restore the firmware eventually. Here are the steps:1. Get the Netgear installation CD. If you're like me and can't find it, download the Windows 7 version from the Netgear website at [...]. Extract it on a Windows 7 machine (I used a virtual machine on my Mac in VMware Fusion). Set up a static ip address on your physical network port on the 192.168.1.0/24 network, plug a network cable into your workstation port and then in port 1 of the router. It helps to turn off your wireless on your workstation while you do this or you can have trouble only talking on the network cable.2. Do the 30-30-30 hard restart on your router. Make sure your router is plugged in to power and connected to your workstation. Use a straightened paperclip and press and hold the reset button for 30 seconds on the router. Still pressing the reset button, pull out the power cord from the router. Hold the reset button for another 30 seconds and then plug the router back in while still holding the reset button and hold the reset button for another 30 seconds while the power is restored.3. Now you should see 2 green lights on the router. There will be a steady green light on the port you're plugged into and a slowly blinking green light about it. This means it has corrupt firmware but it's waiting and available for upgrade. If you don't see this, run the 30-30-30 restart again. I had to do it twice.4. Start the firmware upgrade utility. It should detect the router and reload the firmware. Follow the instructions on the screen and you should have a functional router in a few minutes!

02/02/2012 UPDATE:  I disabled the 5 GHz transmitter.  Because both of our (essentially) new Lenovo laptops only use the 2.4 GHz frequency, there is NO difference in throughput.NOTICE:  Before I begin my review, I want to state I have serious doubts about this Netgear WNDR3700v2 router.  I bought this WNDR3700v2 last year and never had the chance to install it until now. AFTER I bought it, I have read too many reviews where customers are saying the unit does well at first.  After 3-6 months the WNDR3700v2 starts to lose range and then burns out.  It appears the transmitters get hot and then burn out.  If this happens, I will delete this review and write a negative one.MY REVIEW:  I didn't want this Netgear WNDR3700v2 wireless router broadcasting in my bedroom where my cable modem is located.  I bought 2 - 50 foot CAT5E cables from MonoPrice and installed the router on a wall in the next room.  I think it's safer that way.  I installed the WNDR3700v2 up high on the wall so it would have better range and it would not fall over.  I did not use the included stand.  Aside from the cable placement problems, setup was easy.  I set everything up including both the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz SSID's, password and WPA2 encryption type using the Setup Wizard on the CD.  I then accessed the router using my browser and changed the hardware router password.  I also upgraded the firmware to the latest version 1.0.0.12 using Netgear's file I had previous downloaded.  The upgrade was done through the Ethernet cable on my main desktop system.  Everything went smoothly, except I waited a LONG time to install the router.  I had grave doubts as to its range and durability.  However, everything seems to be running well right now.  Amazingly, wireless throughput is just as fast as my Ethernet connection at 6,499 kbps!!!  That is really incredible!  I never would have believed a wireless connection could be so FAST!!!Because I do not use the 5 GHz frequency, I plan to disable it through the router browser access menu.  I read the router will run cooler without the second 5 GHz transmitter running.  I just hope this Netgear WNDR3700v2 router lasts at least 3 years the way it's supposed to.  See my pic's in the pic's section for this product.

Real fast compared to my 'g' ISP provided router. Plugged my NAS on its gigaport and the devices I backup are recent Apple products so they support 'n' networks; therefore my backups are now 5 times faster, a real pleasure. Streaming is done with the Apple TV and is also way faster: no sluggishness anymore, movies, even high def, load in less than 3 seconds. Signal quality is also much better.The administration web interface is good as well. It's suitable for network experts, letting them the option to fiddle with everything, said settings being called with their actual names (for instance it's written 'NAT', not 'address hiding'), and it's also suitable for non techies as it has wizards. I also like how it self-updates when you load the interface.It's feature complete: it has all you can expect. IPv6, DHCP reservation, port forwarding, firewalling, WIFI repeater mode (usually a separate expensive device), email alerting, QoS, dynamic DNS support, guest networks... you name it. I didn't try the NAS function though but I wouldn't recommend as it seems really basic.Great product, and, on top of that, I bought it refurbished for 60$. It didn't look refurbished at all: when I opened it my wife asked 'i thought you were buying refurbished?'.

I had narrowed down my search for a router that handled dual band, N-type, and had gigabit connections.  A handful of namebrand ones fit the bill and the price range (under $120).  I had to rule out Linksys as I had just purchased a lemon from they and they wouldnt fix it (wont go into details on that).  Anyhow I plugged in the 3700 and it just WORKED! Didnt have to jump through any hoops or anything.  Then I set up each wireless network with its on SSID manually but I suppose the GUI would have done it just as easily.  It's paired to a Motorola SB6121 modem and the system is awesome.  It hasnt dropped connection, locked up or anything bad so far.  On wireless Ive connected iPads, iPhones, Dell Latitude laptops and IBM laptops.  The LAN side of it has 3 desktop PC's connected at all times (gaming rigs).My previous Linksys router would either lock up or get real sluggish and needed to be reboot every other week.  So far I can only say good stuff about this Netgear product.

Setup was a breeze.. even for someone how knows nothing about such a thing.  I asked the guys in the tech department for a suggestion and they all said this was the best thing available right now for the typical user and it was %40 less on Amazon than the local box stores.

column9: Works great, 5Ghz better than old router!  Traffic Meter a must have!
column10: I have been a loyal DSL customer with Verizon for 10 years.  My speeds were 6mbps, fine for streaming HD Netflix.  Well, Santa brought the kids both an iPod Touch so now they are all over the internet (Netflix streaming mostly).  My 6mbps service was starting to choke under all the use.  Did a little research and it turns out Charter was running a $19.99 special for 15mbps service.  How could I say no?I signed up online and two days later it was installed.  Only problem, is now I have a bandwidth cap of 100Gb per month.  Having no way to monitor my usage, I researched and found that Netgear routers have a Traffic Meter for just this purpose.  You set our monthly cap and it will worn you when you get near it and warn when you have hit it.  In addition, you can track usage by the day, week, and month.  I find this very handy.I replaced a Linksys WRT600N which, other than requiring daily unplugs to keep the router up, was a great router.  The WNDR3700v2 is better.  I have read complaints that v2 has low 5Ghz coverage and speed.  Not in my case.  I am getting wireless connection speeds on 5Ghz that exceed the WRT600N.  I also have not had to unplug the router yet.  Imagine.The build quality is nice, but not as heavy a router as I would have thought.  All things considered, this was a great upgrade.At the refurbished price I got this for it was a no brainer and will cover me till 802.11ac comes around!
I've only had this router for a month, but it has performed flawlessly.  It has a very extensive and easy to use setup so that you can tweak it however you need.

I have had this Netgear Wireless Router for several months now and it performs flawlessly. I get very satisfactory high speed performance -- even with PC desktop, PC laptop, Windows Phone and Kindle Fire all running simultaneously. An excellent buy.

Quick delivery by Amazon.  Easy set up resulting in a substantial improvement not only in wireless range BUT I noticed a `snappy' response of my two laptops, iPod and Kindle Fire.  I highly recommend the WNDR3700 by Netgear.
Easy installation - Works very well - Faster than the router that it replaced.  It has an on / off switch if it ever needs rebooted.

Hello all, I have had this router for about 2 years and it has been working fine. Setup was easy b/c all you have to do is plug the modem in the router and your computer into one of the 4 ports. Some people act like this is rocket science lol. I am running 2 ps3's,1 wii, 3 computers and 2 of my computers have windows 7 while the other has windows vista... 0 problems...lol. I almost did not mention 2 smart tv's and 3 nintendo ds's. I download movies, play call of duty on ps3 kids on facebook, all at the same time... no lag but it is always better to have high quality intenet service. I have Comcast 25 meg service not the cheap plan, b/c you get what you pay for. I am in the military and I had to move 3 times since I had this router. The only way my signal dropped was b/c of power failure due to moving... Wired or wireless this thing is aawweessoommee. If this ever goes out I will get the 4500 savage beast, b/c I am sold on Netgear people please believe it!!! If yours does not work,they make a 1000 of these a day,you probably got a lemon...seriously.

I love this router. I bought it to replace an older Netgear wireless router that could not support my laptop, iPhone, and Playstation 3. This does all of that with bandwidth to spare. Setup was easy, it has the same interface that Netgear always has, and supports up to 5G. If you want a router to support all of your devices in your home this is the device to purchase. It is well worth the price.

After reading the review in Maximum PC of new routers,___ Router Roundup: We Review 7 Top-Tier Routers___ Posted 10/27/2010  by Michael Brownit seemed to be the only choice for me.  My house is wiredwith all the coax and Cat5 starting on the far wall of mygarage.  My 4 year old Verizon supplied wireless router couldonly make minimum speed connections in the center of the house.This router doubled the range making higher speed connectionsanywhere in the house.Didn't need to look at the manual, just plug and go toget on line.  Did need to look at the manual to adjusta few ports for VOIP and SlingBox.I'm very happy with the purchase but if buying today, Iwould look at the WNDR4500 that has even better rangeand speed.  A later(Nov2011) Maximum PC review showed it tobe 50% faster and the new Best of the Best.
One of the best router,s i have come across in a long time,where you take it out of the box and plug it in,and in 5 minute,sYou are online.Netgear Router WNDR3700

My brother recommend this brand and model for me. I am not very skilled in installing anything on the computer, but my brother ad no problem. It is working well, hopefully for a long time to come. Well pleased in the delivery time.Thanks

I am very happy with this router. Easy to install. My sister just bought one also and they are very happy with theirs also. I installed theirs too. It takes care of the whole house. 3 Roku's, computer, iPad, iPhone and any one else that comes over needing wifi.

column9: Easy setup and easy router controls, especially for Xbox live use
column10: We decided to switch from U-verse to cable due to the faster speeds, but paying $20 a month to "rent" a router is insane. (looking at you Charter...). I decided to buy this when it wen't on sale and i have to say i am incredibly pleased. I simply connected the router to the modem supplied by charter and followed the easy set up steps to password protect my wifi. I don't think i will ever use the shared USB info, but the range is good enough to cover 2 stories of my high-rise so i'm pretty happy with the results!My previous U-verse router kept failing and misassigning IP addresses which was extremely frustrating, and for $48 a month i expected a lot more. With this router i get 50 mbps download and 5 mbps upload. In addition the 5ghz option is really nice if you have a lot of devices on the 2.4 ghz and want a private network to connect for a dedicated network. This was pretty key since my dad isn't technologically advanced, but he needs to pull up patient files from the hospital. The dedicated network seems to be pretty quick as you can decide the usage for each network on the router setup menu.Also no more remembering an IP address to access the router, just a simple url routerlogin.netVery satisfied at the moment, but i will update if anything changes!

I originally purchased this to upgrade my internet connection.  It did that easily but I was also impressed with the ease of installation and some new options such as guest networks and USB shared storage.  I may not use all the options that are built in, but it is nice to have them for potential future use.

Was getting really bad interruption @ 2.4ghz. Switched it to the 5ghz line and it has been absolutely flawless for gaming in my mancave (which is really far from the router). Constant 17 ping on leagueoflegends
This product replaced a 10yo router.  It was easy to install and now I can use my iPad in other rooms.
Easy to get running with my desktop, printer, two iPhones, two iPads alike. Works better than my old router and is extremely easy to get up and running.
The cover fit is excellent.  I would recommend this item to any who purchase a kindle.  Shutting down when the cover is closed is a great feature.

column9: Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router
column10: This is a great product. I am using a notebook for the first time, so I am pleased that it works so nicely. It came on time and in excellent condition.

Bought 2 yrs ago and its still working superb. Excellent features both hardware and software give you the flexibility to do whatever you might need if your the average consumer and even the 'Prosumer' haha.The only thing I kinda dislike about this is that I would want 2 additional ethernet ports. But I suppose I'm atypical in that aspect.

I bought this router based on a review by PC Magazine.  The main feature I was looking for was range.  Well this did the trick.  I have it located at the far end of the house upstairs, and I get a great single at the opposite end of the house downstairs.  No drops, always strong.  The distance is about 50-60 feet and down one flight of stairs.  I even get great reception at my neighbors house.  That is all I was looking for, strong broadcast single and this fit the bill.

Although I had to update the firmware to keep all my devices from losing connection, it has worked flawlessly since. I connected an external drive to the USB port and connecting to it was easy. It provides excellent signal power to all parts of my home, even going through a floor and three walls.

I'm moving from a Linksys WRT54GL with tomato software as I wanted to get N speeds for my new laptop. I have 5 computers and an iPad and Android phone connected to the router. It has been rock solid since I purchased it and fairly fast with both the 2.4 and 5Ghz bands. I haven't used the guest mode yet so no comments on that. The one thing I miss is the Tomato software. The options and the reporting gathered by Tomato I feel is far superior. I've looked at DD-WRT and it supports the N600 so I'm contemplating moving to that to see what benefits I can get.A couple of notes. As with all Netgear firmware, I find the setup page to be difficult to navigate and understand (compared to Tomato). I like that there aren't any antenna's and that it sits vertically. But I will say that the lights on this thing could light a runway. They are in a closet and I can see the flickering under the door. I took some black electrical tape to cover them but wish I had the ability to control it. Couldn't imagine it being where I worked, especially at night.

I was looking for something with a reputable name and that wouldn't require me to be an IT tech to set it up. I chose this because I read reviews that said it was easy to set up, and it was! I was done in a few minutes and it's been working like a charm ever since. I have other Netgear products that I am also extremely happy with, and have now purchased an eight-port switch to continue the hard-wiring of my house. Gotta love internet access!!
One, two, three, four, five, six... This router works great, easy to install, fast speed.  Don't know really what else to say...

From the moment of the simple installation this router has been outstanding. I have five devices hooked up and have had no problems what-so-ever. To me refurbished means better than out of the box and this product is.
Had my home network up and running within minutes. It arrived on time and was easy to set up with security features.

Received this very quickly during the week, arriving before the given date. Waited until the weekend to install it, figuring that it would take awhile to install, like the D-Link. Should have installed it the same day I got it. Only took about 20 minutes or so to install, including the security setup. I can now run both computers at the same time without bogging down, and are much faster thanks to the dual channels. No complaints.

I have had this router for about 3 weeks now and it is preforming like a champ.I have never had any router to set up this simple, just a few keystrokes and it was done including the security and I do not miss the calls to a representative that does not speak English and creates more confusion then help as I have had to do with other brands!I bought this refurbished and saved money, looks and acts like brand new!If you need an easy to install quality router that has good range this is the one.Finally the icing on the cake is of course Amazon with quick shipping well packaged and a company that stands behind the products that they sell with great service!

column9: Feauture rich for those that need them.
column10: I purchased this router to upgrade from from an equally capable wireless router (an SMC). I have dual computers at my home office and the gigabit wired connection was a welcomed upgrade from the SMC 10/100. The Guest wireless network is an awesome feature that would be good  if you have a lot of guests visiting and want to allow them to get to the internet  but not access your home computers. The buit in dynamic dns updater if great if you utilize network 'NannyCams'. I don't really have a use for the Network attached USB Storage, but its a neat add-on if you decide to share files to all the computers on your home network. It has a rather long 'bootup'  sequence (1-3 minutes)  so I would not recomend turning it off to often. But I DO like the fact that it has an on/off button in case I need to reset it due to your modem needing to be powercycled. ( I hate having to unplug something and then chase the cord when it falls behind the desk) I also like that you can turn the wireless off seprately. Good for telling guests its time to go without having to shut it all down.  Has plenty of routing, priority, and parental controls. I am a net admin, so for me the interface seems straight forward and self explanatory. The interface has a very detailed description of what each setting does in a sidebar for those not so experienced. When I first set this device up it checked for updates and found a few already. Make sure you do them! I have had it a couple months and it has been perfectly reliable thus far.

I've had this router for about a month now, and the minute i got it, i put DD WRT on it, its a great router, extremely fast, and the DD WRT software allows you to push the limits of this router, and it just takes it and runs with it.You get this router, you wont be disappointed at all.I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!

After reading the review on pcmag.com I am searching for low price. On amazon someone selling new router on 40% low price. I have a blind trust on amazon through this I am buying this item. I found the item as describe and since then its working fine no complains.
I have had the router hooked up and running for about a week and I can't be happier. Have 6 devices connected and not a delay in one for connection.

So far (about a month) this router is awesome! I pretty consistently use the 5 Ghz line rather than the 2.4, since I do a lot of streaming. No dropped signals, works all over the (small) apartment. Most negative reviews have to do with problems arising later on, so fingers crossed!

All previous routers have been Netgear and have lasted years. Have only had two routers over the last 8 or more yr. Changed out router and modem b/c had to reset the old Netgear router at least once a day w/in the last few months, usually when the Mac joined the network. The N600 was easy to install and has not dropped signal in the month that it has been on. A Mac laptop and new Fujitsu laptop run on the higher band. Multiple devices on the lower band: two old (>4 yr) laptops - Sony Vaio and Fujitsu; 1.5 yr old desktop Gateway using Medialink Wireless N usb adapter; Wii running Netflix; 2 yr old iPod Touch. And our Canon MX860 connects wirelessly to all the devices w/o any issues (though it was a pain in the neck to reset for a new router). Have Comcast Performance level w/modem and router in the basement of a 3 level house. Signal reaches top floor at other end of house from router w/o any boost. Have not tried the guest hookup or the storage feature.

This is a great product and fairly simple to aply with your router. It took me a while to configure because ATT&T confused the whole issue by saying you should not use a router or extender which I discovered they sell for the same purpose. So Go ahead you will enjoy an extreme fast signal  with just a few clicks .

I was having some issues with my old router, so I ordered this one, on a friend's recommendation, to replace my existing one. This refurbished router works exactly as it should. It arrived in a timely fashion. I couldn't be more pleased at this time.
This is a great product. Solved all my connection problems. Great price, came quickly, good seller. I would not hesitate to purchase this item again.

Within the muscle routers for the home you should consider the Netgear N600.  I use it for video streaming to my Panasonic TV thru a Panasonic Blu-Ray player.  I am not dissapointed with the signal strenght and distance covered by the signal.  Its worth any penny paid for the device.

Received this fast.  It is a rebuilt item, but you would think it is new.  I needed their customer service people's help to set it up.  Turned out the problems were with the settings on my computer.  They helped me and it was up and running in no time.

The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Ban Gigabit Router is a great product. It is powerful and was easy to set up. I can use my laptop anywhere in the house and not have a problem connecting to the internet. It also has a power off button so you can shut it down when it's not being used.

column9: After lots of investigation and comparison
column10: My D-Link DI-624 started giving trouble; more trouble that is. It always had the problem of rebooting when more than one RJ-45 LAN ports were connected and active. So, I had another switch connected to only one of its LAN ports, and DI-624 was my wireless AP and internet gateway/switch without affecting my internal network. That was all fine when I had only one WiFi device active at once. Things have changed, and I have multiple WiFi devices active simultaneously, and DI-624 started crapping out: reboots, infinite delays and just dropping one or more of the WiFi connections. It was time to get a better Firewall/WirelessAP.I gave up on D-Link with my rather extensive home network (several switches, multiple floors, heteregoneous devices, wired/wireless of all sorts, media streaming, etc.), and started looking at 'better' ones. I don't want to pay a real Cisco router I use at work, so dumb it down and look at LinkSys or NetGear. Well, it was a tought decision, actually. NetGear won at the end not only because I had a number of Netgear switches already and they work without a glitch for many years. It won because its detailed specs; also, this device sits somewhere in the back of something else where no one looks at other than me peeking at it every now and then - not that it malfunctions. Cisco/LinkSys one appear too shiny with less advanced features.This is not perfect. I don't care about the USB NAS drive; I have real stuff for that - so I am not going to comment on it. Otherwise, this thing just works in my environment. No problem NetFlix/YouTube/etc. streaming at all. WiFi (I only tested 2.4GHz so far) works with multiple devices active at the same time: I tested with 5 simultaneous devices so far spread across the guest and internal network (yes, that separation is a must for me, and it works, AFAICT).What is missing? DNS setting is very primitive. I want to specify an internal DNS server with scoping, and then want to say 'for all others, relay to DNS you received from WAM DHCP'. This is pretty common with private DNS servers (think NAT). NetGear, I like your products, but do you hear this? It is not a big deal, add that on, please.

Prior to ordering this Netgear product, I had always used Linksys WRT products. However, the prior router (despite upgrading to the latest firmware) would constantly drop connections, require reboots, and would randomly stop even though the administration page said everything was working fine.Now, we have no drop-outs, the range seems to go further and penetrate parts of the apartment better, and all apartment residents can reliably skype, netflix, and facetime all at the same time without interruption. Highly recommended for a workhorse router.

I researched this wireless router before I purchased it and I am extremely happy with the performance.  It was fairly simple to setup.  I like the security of being able to lock down the wireless to certain mac address.  Works like a charm!

Plug it in, install the CD and it easily walks you through the set up. Could not be easier.  The speed it gives me is surprisingly fast (I guess I didn't realize how bad my previous ten year old g router was).  Good product that does its job well.

Love the 2 bands as not all of the items I have can use 1gb transfer.  Ordered the USB adapter for my laptop so I could utilize the higher speed.  Seller was smart & included it in the package making everything simple for both of us.
I got it fast,was easey to hook up and best of all it works great a lot faster then my old one and I thaut my old was good. I was real serprised when I hook it up, a hole lot faster. thanks

The WNDR3700 was highly recommended to me by a co-worker, and after a couple days of research and browsing online, I decided to order it. It arrived on time, and only took about 10 minutes to set up.I regularly play shooters on my 360, download music to my computer (connected to the 5GHz network), have two smartphones connected to the 2.4GHz wireless network, often all at once. I have yet to experience any lag during gameplay or significant decrease in download speed. With my 16 gig flash drive plugged into the router's USB port, movies and music can be streamed to any device connected to the network (haven't tried on my phone yet, but my computer and xBox 360 stream flawlessly)Overall, I could not be happier with this purchase, and will be recommending it to my friends and family should they be in the market for a new router.

I was hesitant to tackle this installation myself, but needn't have been.  The hardware instantly recognized the signal.  It was almost ridiculously easy to set up the laptop, telephone and AV equipment connections to recognize the available strong signal.  Security precautions were easy to set up.  All in all, no mystery to it.  I should not have waited so long to take the big step!

column9: Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3700
column10: Easy to setup.  Had one of the exact same type for about 3-4 months before purchasing this one for a family member.  For obvious reasons was even easier to setup!  I have DSL.  I'm able to use my smart phone to connect via the router (resulting in downloads faster to my phone).

Pros:  Good for almost all purpose.  I use it with openWRT, as a samba share server and the router.  It is stable and fast.  I just rebooted it once after about 1 month high pressure use.Cons:  A little expensive.  The USB speed is not very good, it is only about 6MB/s, which is far far slower for the external hard drive.If you do not use USB much, it is really good.  For me, the USB speed is enough, my house don't have that much stuff to share.

column9: Good Constant Signal Strength...and some basic recommendations
column10: I purchased this Netgear router 6 months ago to replace an older model Linksys router with antennas, which had replaced an even older Linksys, also with antennas.  It's difficult to make a comparison due to the fact that the Linksys was using a `g' band, while I'm using the `n' band on this Netgear - although both are at 2.4GHz.  But I can say the Netgear has more signal strength.  I actually have it sitting flat, rather than upright.  I would say signal strength has increased by 1/3 at the least - and it's consistent.The wifi is approximately 21+ yards away (on the same ground floor), going through 4 walls at full signal strength.Setup was easy (Windows XP wired, Windows 7 Professional wifi).  The software disc (which is the Setup Wizard) included is not Windows 7 compatible, although you can download it at Netgear's site.  I didn't bother with it.  I followed the easy instructions in the manual, and once online at the router's login, there is a setup Wizard which will work with your OS if you choose to use it.  I just set it up manually, which is very easy.  The router recognized my other wifi devices easily, and further setup was a breeze.  My Linksys froze for 30 minutes or longer when applying changes.  The Netgear does so within a few seconds.Having Dual Bands is a bonus, although currently I do not have any `n' band 5.0GHz capable devices - and have disabled the 5.0GHz for now... but it's there for the future.I don't wish to repeat all the options this router offers as others have already done so in good detail.  I would however like to emphasize a few Basic things for those unfamiliar with router setups:1) Once you are connected, do upgrade the firmware before proceeding.2) Please, please change the login Password from the Default (listed in the manual which comes with the router) to your own.  Half my neighbors have not.
