This is just basic and so easily done - and will keep others from piggybacking, or worse yet, logging into your router and changing the settings and using their own login password to lock you out (if this has already happened you'll need to Reset your router manually and start all over).  Once you login to the router's address, you'll find it listed under Maintenance at Set Password.  Keep track of all your passwords!  One of my neighbors could no longer gain access to the internet and blamed it on the router... I had seen that it was initially not secured, and later secure.  I'm guessing a neighboring kid just decided to mess around.  Fortunately they mentioned this to me (before just buying another router) and I helped them get back online.2a) Set up a secure connection.  Again, I 'see' too many who haven't set any type of security.  At your Netgear router login page, go to Setup, and underneath are options for both Wireless Settings (your wifi) and Guest Network. Type in your own SSID (name) - don't leave it at the Default name.  Set up a security option and type in your own Passphrase password... it is strongly recommended you not use WEP for the Guest Network if this can be avoided (I don't think this Netgear even has WEP for Wireless Settings, but it does for the Guest Network).  Again, keep a record of these.  Use strong passwords, both uppercase and lowercase letters, mixed with numbers and symbols - and make it long.Just these basic steps should keep neighbors and drive-by's from piggybacking your connection, which at the least can slow down your internet connection speed or cause intermittent loss of connectivity if you have quite a few piggybackers.Remember to occasionally login to see if there are any upgrades for your router.I'm very happy with this router, and would recommend it.  I will update later should I run into any problems.Update: I've been using this router for 3 months and it's still working very well - wifi remains strong and consistant.  I do use the power button frequently (hold it about 2-3 seconds to power on/off for wifi.  Can even use the power button if laptops are booted and our internet connection is almost immediate.  I remain extremely pleased with this router!2nd Update: It's been 1 month short of a year since purchasing, and this router is still working perfectly.  For a brief time I thought perhaps I'd bricked it when my Ethernet port died on our desktop (routers tend to be terribly fussy about such things), but nope!  The router had been unused for about 1  months while I made the decision to purchase another desktop as opposed to replacing the port.  My laptops wouldn't connect wirelessly after setting up the router again, but 2 other Wi-Fi devices were fine, so thankfully both laptops just needed a driver upgrade.  All is well with this Dual Band Netgear Router and I am still happy with this purchase.
The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR3700 works great and I would recommend it to anyone in the market for a router

This router works great with all my devices! It was extremely easy to setup. The only downside is that we have had to reset it a couple of times, but even that is quick & easy.  Overall I am extremely satisfied with it.

I bought this to upgrade my old LinkSys Wireless G with speedboost. I can not believe how much faster my internet is now. With the old router i would top out at 8 and i thought it was an isp issue but on installing the netgear I immediately saw and increase to 22! I use this router to connect my lg TV wirelessly, ipad, desktop, and laptop and even with all of them running i can watch a streaming movie on the tv from netflix, a live mlb game on the laptop and be playing a online game with the desktop which was impossible to do with the old router.The setup was very very easy after reading some reviews I was a little worried but everything is running great. My only regret was that I did not make this upgrade sooner.

I've never been a net gear person but with the ability to have 3 different 802.11's and create a static IP address I was sold. It's working good right now. I also was able the view and hide two network names one for me and one for my clients.
This turned out to be a GREAT upgrade form the Linksys router that I previous used. I'm experiencing faster connection and download times. Just sorry I waited so long to make the upgrade

column9: Excellent purchase and got it at a great price during the holidays.
column10: Absolutely love this router, didn't need to flash it with ddwrt for my VPN use.  Native firmware runs well.  This router is a trooper, great range throughout the house.
I am not a high tech person so I had to rely on my son-in-law to recommend a good router after I purchased the Kindle Fire.Great recommendation - works super!
Working just fine with multiple phones, ipads, smart TV's, Laptops and a PS3. Very easy setup. And looks good too!
Very easy setup and it works great throughout my home on various devices.  I highly recommend this product for home or office.
Great reception throughout the house.  Easy to install and set up.  awesome.  a pleasure to have in the home now

I have had this router for 2 years and have never had an issue.  It just works all the time.  I use it with my Synology NAS and port forwarding works without question every single time.  The only issue I have with this router is that sometimes I have to reset it in order for my Apple TV to be seen by my Apple devices.

column9: I love the range and the signal strength, great router!
column10: I bought this as an upgrade from an old Linksys G router. Works perfect for streaming to the Wii/PS3 and Droid phones, great on the PC for downloading and surfing the web. I give this router a 9 out of 10.

column9: Best Router I have ever had.
column10: I replaced a very old (Version 2) WRT54G wired/wireless B/G router with this N600 model a few days ago. The first thing I noticed was that the B/G signal was much better at the far ends of my house. At least 30% and in some areas almost 50% more signal.My existing wireless G desktop, at the far end of my house reports 99% signal strength, with my old router the signal would average around 60%.Using 'dslreports' online speed test, I was able to get a down load speed of 7.4 Mb/s and an up load speed of 856 Kb/s on the wireless G connection. I have a cable modem and the upload speed is throttled.The exciting thing for me is the wireless N performance. My new Windows 7 laptop, with a wireless N connection, at the far end of my house, gets 15.5 Mb/s down load speed and 850 Kb/s upload speed. My wired connection is 19.4 Mb/s and 861 Kb/s. With a cable modem, the speed varies but my old router's best down load speed was 17 Mb/s on the wired connection.The USB shared connection is a nice feature. I was having trouble sharing files between my Windows 7 computer and my Windows XP computers. I connected an 8 Gig. USB thumb drive to this router, set it up as a share, and my problem was solved. One thing to note; the Win 7 computer did not automatically see the share (funny, because it automatically saw the media server on the share). I had to type in the address of the router (in my case 192.168.1.1) and browse to the shared folder. After that, I was able to map it as a shared drive.If something changes in the future, I will edit this review. At this point in time, I am very happy with this device.Ken

column9: Excellent wireless router with many features.
column10: I bought the REFURBed router and would highly recommend it.You essentially have 4 wireless networks:  2.4 GHz guest  5 GHz guest  2.4 GHz  5 GHzAll are active simultaneously.  The guest network is on the same IP range as your non-guest machines however, they are isolated and only have access to the internet.USB port allows for internal FTP, HTTP, network shares to the files on a jump/hard drive.  You can also allow internet access with FTP and HTTP.USB port allows for DLNA (media server).  I have JPG's, MP3's, and different video files.  Some Video files worked fine others were choppy and others wouldn't play.  Still need to do more testing here.  Also, I don't know the limitations, but it worked as expected when I had a small number of files.  But when it had to index over 100 GB of files I overwhelmed it.  So, for me it's not a replacement for my iPod, but I think if you use it more resonably, it is great.This was a replacement to my old wireless router which I used to have to reboot every few days by unplugging and plugging back in.  This has been up for a few weeks continuously with no problems.I have up to 30 MB download with my internet cable connection.  My old router was only allowing me to see about 8 MB...this one routinely sees results of 25-30 MB/s. I use speedtest.net for testing.This has all the normal router functions you'd expect...Port Forwarding, DHCP, etc.  It is supposedly better for video streaming.

column9: Finally getting everything out of my internet connection.
column10: I absolutely love this router.  I recently received a promotional speed upgrade to my internet connection for six months.  My old WTR54G became a huge bottleneck.  Upgrading to the WNDR3700 has drastically improved my speeds.  The throughput on the gigabit ports and the 5GHZ networks work as fast as a direct connection to my modem.  Wireless G is still throttled to about 30mbs, but it's still an improvement.  Maybe if I can get rid of that one WPA/TKIP device.....

Overall this router is just extremely convenient. It would be nice if you could also restrict mack addresses and Ethernet. The level of multitasking is amazing. I have been on Xbox live, while my little sister was on her WII, I was also loading 720p YouTube videos, and had my phone connected on Facebook and Twitter, all at the same time. And guess what! No lag! The only way I could see someone purchasing a different router at around the time I post this review is if they are buying a newer model.
Using this with OpenWRT on a cable connection: works fine, wireless and wired. I've also started using the v2 router for work VPN applications.

New router took me a while to set up because of my DSL...but in the end, it works perfectly.  The signal is better (stonger, but not too much better in distance) than my old Netgear router (it still works, I needed some new features).  New features include USB port for hard drive backup of my network and 'N' connection for my TV.  Definitely recommended!

I have used D-Link routers before and I had to buy another one.  Researched in Amazon and got this one.  It was easy to install and didnt have any problems so far.  Love the fact that you can have 2 different networks (private and public).  Speed is pretty good too.  My wife and I use a lot of Sametime chat to talk and she never had a dropped connection once, while my D-link will drop the connection once or twice (could be how Apple devices work with the routers, I dont know).  Anyways, I am happy with this one and would recommend it.
Great product. Does the job. Easy to set up. Fast as well. Good for running home or office. Brilliant product.

column9: Fast, Stable and Packed With Features!
column10: This is an excellent product. Speeds are very fast on both G and N and the built-in gigabit ethernet performs well. I haven't had to reboot the router in nearly six months of operation. There are tons of great features: I especially like the bandwidth meter and support for reserved IP addresses via DHCP.This is my fifth wireless router in about eight years. I have owned a DLink, Belkin and two Linksys routers (one died after six months and had to be RMA'd). Every one that I owned would freeze up periodically and needed to be rebooted to get back online. The wireless connection on my Droid X would drop repeatedly with my old Linksys but with the Netgear it's been totally stable.  This product seems like it was built to a much higher level of quality than other cheaper routers.

column9: An English major sets up a wireless network
column10: I use a Mac, so I have no idea how most technology works.  But I was able to successfully and painlessly set up a wireless network with the WNDR 3700.  All I had to do was follow the incredibly easy instructions.  First there were the 6 steps (with nice, large illustrations) on the card that came with the router.  Then I inserted the CD (step 6).  I think it automatically loads if you are using Windows, but nothing happened for me, so I did have to use my brains to double-click the CD and then double click the icon marked MAC.  After that I just clicked my way through the wizard, gave each of the two bands names (I called them 2.4 GHz and 5.0 GHz), and assigned a password.  The machine did the rest, and it's working great.
Met or exceeded expectations in all areas.  Cannot comment on reliability at this point, have only had it two or three weeks, but so far no issues.
This was pretty easy to install, and has not given me any problems. I would recommend this router if you are looking for an upgrade and some extended features.

After reading the reviews about the difficulty of setting up the guest network I was a little worried, but it was very simple to set up and works great.  I'm not sure if the speeds are much faster, but it was easy to configure.  I have a wired and wireless network, and needed the guest network for when friends come over.  It works exactly as described.  I think the documentation could be a little easier to find and use (how about a quickstart guide for the non-techy?).  But overall love this router and very glad I purchased it. Biggest issue was the post office obliterated the box it came in (looked like it was dropped from a 5 story building!).  I was amazed the router still worked based on the packaging but it did.  No issues here...does everything it says it does.
I've owned this router for around 6 months now and did not have any connection problems whatsoever. Fair price. Oh yeah and set up is a breeze!

Easy setup. Wired and wireless speeds are fast.Use good quality high speed network cables.Follow instructions to start with install disk before connecting the router.Begin your router setup with a wire connection first. Once all of your drivers are installed and the router is setup, then begin the wireless setup.

Many of the reviews who had said this was a bad router was because of hardware issues. First make sure you upgrade your firmware like I did.This router is amazing. It's range is so much better than my old wireless G router. The speed is also amazing. My internet speed became noticebly faster and more stable. The router it self was very easy to set up. The instructions were clear and understandable. The router it self is kind of big but its okay. I connected by usb hardrive to the router so now all my PC's can access the hardrive. I simply love this router and you should definetly buy it. The speed, dual band wireless connections and range is simply wonderful. Net gear didn't cut corners on this router and it is very high quality.I recommend you buy this router.

I bought this to replace an old and dying Netgear WGR614 router. So far this has been working flawlessly for the past two weeks. It broadcasts both the dual bands and my laptops can see both and connect to whichever I decide.  I wish the price was a little lower but otherwise it looks and works great. Setup and configuration was a breeze as usual with other Netgear routers.  I first bought a D-Link but returned the next day since setting up the D-Link was a nightmare and terrible slow.  I have begun to prefer Netgear routers.

Looking for more, well you have it all in this router. I could not the different it made from older model. This dual band lets nothing else to desire. Looking for a wiresless router then I can tell to look no far because this is it. A great buy and an excellent product. Try it because I know you will like it. Don't wait or make the wrong choice.

column9: Don't let all the bad reviews fool you!
column10: I don't write a ton of reviews but I was looking at all of these one and two star reviews and I couldn't help myself.  I had to let everyone know how happy I am with my router.This router was exactly what I was looking for.  I moved into a two story house and wanted to finally transition to wireless-N to get the range and speed that our macbooks can handle.  We were previously using a WRT54G and I don't remember having to reset it too many times but it wasn't perfect.I have had this router running since the end of April.  I have only disconnected the power once when I decided to move my cable modem into another room.  Other than that it has required no maintenance or resets.I didn't used the CD for setup and I can agree with others in saying that the web interface is a little unorganized I was able to get though it without too much trouble.  I do not like that the username for the web login is stuck on admin. I did a little research and it seems like that is an option you cannot change.I have been using the USB storage and I like that I am able to get to my files away from the house, I did have to reformat my drive to get the router to recognize it the first time (I think it was formatted  MAC OS journaled).  I have been using the storage to backup pictures because my wife got a new camera so there was a need to put them somewhere in an organized fashion, which meant it had to be seperate from her macbook.We normally have at least 3-4 wireless devices runnning in our house (iphones, laptops, wiis, xbox).  I have never had any lockups or serious lag.  I get really good range from this router (I have it upstairs above the living room).  I am able to connect with a macbook or iphone in my garage or outside which is down one floor and through a few walls.I have really enjoyed this router and I hope to get some good use out of it in the future.  It has way more features than my old router and it looks alot nicer too.

I've had an older Netgear 802.11 router for about 8 years with no problems, but I felt it was time to upgrade. I stream a lot of Netflix movies, and they often hiccup and kick me out, so I wanted to upgrade to wireless N capability. I also wanted the ability to access a shared network hard drive, and have the faster gigabit connections for hardwiring my TiVo directly to the router, which led me to purchase this router. The first one arrived and was incredibly easy to set up (I was already familiar with the Netgear setup because of my older router). It worked great for about 12 hours, but when I got up the next morning, it was offline and all the lights were off. I tried every trick I could think of to bring it back up, but nothing worked. I finally called Netgear support, and he had me basically do everything I had just done with no luck. I went to the Amazon website and submitted the form to return the faulty equipment. I've never had to return anything to Amazon and wasn't sure how much of a pain it would be, but it was simple and painless. My new router arrived 24 hours later. It took me just a few minutes to set up. So far, it's amazing. Netflix streams perfectly and is very high quality (it used to look pixelated and blurry). And the ability to access a hard drive from all computers in the house is really convenient. Very much worth the money.

The range of the 2nd band is pretty tame but overall it provides great coverage for our three story house (with the router nestled in the basement in the concrete laundry room). Good throughput on all counts. Can't say I notice a big difference in speed with the 2nd band either.

I bought this as a replacement for my 8 month old Cisco/Linksys E3000 which kicked butt for 8 months. I had an issue with extreme slow down. My cable company was able to troubleshoot it to my router. I contacted Cisco Tech support and they said because it was over 90 days old I had to pay them $79.95 for them to help me. You got to be kidding me! Some customer service. That will be my last Cisco/Linksys product. Now that I'm over my rant on to Netgear WNDR3700. The CD that came with unit was useless. Could't install using their install as could not find the connection. I just used Windows 7 to install it with no problem. Log'd in to the router and made my changes and it worked great. Been a month with no issues with speeds as high as 42 mbps when checked with speed test in my backyard. It is much faster to print than my E3000 which was painfully slow to print. Just hope that if I ever have an issue that they don't charge me to talk to them.

column9: Excellent router, somewhat difficult to setup
column10: When I bought this router, I decided to take my chances and go with a refurbished one. It saved me about $50. It came with, what I believe, to be all the standard accessories from a new box. The problem was that the CD that came with the box for the newer version of the router that I received. No biggy, I'm fairly tech literate, well literate enough to set it up manually. The web interface is pretty messy and it took quite some time (15 or 20 minutes) to setup.I've had it for a couple weeks now and I must say, I'm loving it! The router has never crashed or stopped working. I used to have the newest (and worst) version of the WRT54G. It sucked. Whenever I used network intensive activities such as bittorent, it crashes. It could only manage maybe 3 maybe 4 active computers at any given time. (Keep in mind there's normally 6, sometimes 7 active computers!) But with this new router it works perfectly, haven't had to restart it at all since I've had it.

Great router. It came in the mail today and, after fiddling around with it and connecting my computer directly into the cable modem to find its configuration website/login information, I was able to setup both the 2.4 GHz and 5GHz bands and advanced options that I needed quite quickly. Speaking of the separate network frequencies, they are very nice for organizing my more high bandwidth activities from the lower ones. Not to mention that the configuration website allows for easy firmware updates and thoroughly explains all possible networking options as you peruse/edit them. The only problem I foresee is this refurb I bought possibly crapping out (knock on wood!). But so far so good!Oh, and the fact that each band frequency has its own guest network means I could really create 4 networks if I wanted to. But in a house of 3 people that seems a bit much.

This router rocks I have Comcast  and the speed increase was off the charts. I'm now streaming HD video and I have 300Mpbs throughput. I paired it with a Moto Docsis 3.0 modem and they are doing me justice.If you are a novice or pro you will love this router. Buy it you won't be disappointed.

I upgraded my Comcast to 50mbs speed from the old 15mbs speed and had a DLink DIR655 router. The DLINK seemed to need to be reset fairly often so I bought the $179 Apple Airport Extreme that was so highly rated. I hooked up the Apple and ran my speedtests and was only getting 6mbs transfer rate on the two laptops I have that are wireless. The direct connect computers ran just fine. Someone recommonded this Netgear model and I returned the Apple for this. Setup was about 15 minutes, simple and CD included. It took perhaps another 30 minutes to figure out how to add in my wireless printer, but that is not Netgears fault. I re-ran the tests and get over 20mbs now via wireless, over 3 times the speed of the Apple router and am very impressed! I also get a stong signal considering the router is in a lower level. I am very happy with this purchase.

I previously had a gateway I was leasing from Comcast for 7 bucks a month. The range was not ok as I had to punch through several walls and the signal attenuation was pretty large. This unit is everything promised. I now have 3 systems hooked up (wifes Toshiba Satellite and two desktops(windows 7 and xp)). The installation was so simple even I didn't screw it up. If you can load a cd you can do this.The 'push and connect' technology is pretty slick. I think someone had mentioned that the unit got quite hot. I have not experienced that yet. I keep it up high and well ventilated.I'm sure that helps. I was also intrigued by the 'ready share' feature where you can plug in an external USB storage unit. I had 500 G seagate external I plugged in. It works really fine. Just like a file server would. The biggest problem in getting my network setup was the clowns at comcast when I swapped out the modem. It took about an hour and two call backs but we 'got er done'. I couldn't be happier. This is a good unit for the home and well worth the price.
Great, this is one heck of a router, Easy to setup and very easy to adjest the little extras that come with it. Everything from a Wii to full HD video streamed over this ,,without a problem.

Haven't had this netgear long enough to give it a five star on everything, but so far it has worked well. Had a little trouble setting it up to my network, but with help from Netgear it went well.  Took a second Tech. to get us online, but the second tech was Great.  I can't say the first tech was helpful, but recalled and the second tech knew his job. We have it connected to a switch as I have 6-computers wired and 2 computers wireless as my grandkids do their homework online.No problem so far.

column9: Netgear N600 wired/wireless dual band WNDR3700 router
column10: Going from Linksys to Netgear was a pure pleasure!!  Setup very intuitive, firmware upgrade painless.  If you have used the other router throw it in the trash along with the other product support and get the N600 wired/wireless dual band router,

column9: router solved all my network problems
column10: Before I bought this Netgear router, I had used an eight year old router. I kept having problems with intermittent wireless network, poor range. My Comcast cable modem box had to be reset maybe once every month, otherwise I would lose TV cable signal. I thought my Comcast signal was poor.After I switched to this Netgear router, all the aforementioned problems disappeared.  It has been about 45 days since I bought the router. Never once did I have to reset the Comcast cable modem box.  I have much stronger wireless signal now.  I live in a three bedroom house with about 6000 sq ft yard. I can receive wireless coverage anywhere in the yard, although the wireless signal strength is not maximum in the yard.The 'readyshare' USB port is useful, but I find the speed of this port rather slow compared to a direct USB connection to a computer.

Great product.. no problems so far (been a month or two)... solid.  The NAS drive USB jack is nice for being able to provide storage.. wish there was a way to power down the usb jack after a timeout period or something.Otherwise a great product.

column9: Netgear N600 WNDR3700 vs. Cisco anything.
column10: Today I have purchased this Netgear WNDR3700 Dual-band router. And I have done so on the strength of this article: [...]Cisco had been on my wish list since purchasing my N-equipped laptop some years ago; and only needed the router failure to justify the new purchase. After seeing that article, moments before coming to Amazon for the purchase, I decided that I would not buy Cisco -- under any circumstances.I am frankly getting very tired of this type of reverse bigotry, where a handful of radicals castigate everyone into  some 'cum-by-ya', we must all 'I'm OK, you're OK' -- and then summarily fire someone for their own opinions. Nah. Cisco's out.Personally (which I know isn't going to play well with heavy tech-heads), I don't care HOW this thing works. Whether it gets 140MB down instead of 148MB is inconsequential to me. I'm still giving it five stars; and as long as the thing works serviceably well, I'm going with the far weightier issues.

This is a great router/access point. Its range is terrific and is both easy to set up and use. My old dLink died recently and I wanted to improve the wifi throughout the house. Not only did the Netgear improve the connection speeds, but I used to have some conflict that would cause the dLink to drop the wired connection (with Comcast) every day or so. Never did figure it out, but the Netgear does not suffer from the same difficulty. The Netgear is a little more expensive, but it's worth it!

This has been the best router I have ever purchased.  It just works.I have had this router for nearly a year, which replaced a previous router that offered the same 'speed' but would constantly drop connections and require a reboot.  The only time this router has required a reboot is when I change the settings.Another neat feature of this router is the 'Guest WiFi - Hotspot' feature which allows you to do just what it says.  With this feature you can create a second access point for guests that can not see your shared files and you can limit the bandwidth that is available.I have been meaning to open up about 500k of free bandwidth for local smart phones that need connectivity.I wish all routers/ access points made it easy to share some portion of your wifi so we had good open coverage.If you are undecided about a router, stop thinking and buy this one.

I got this as an early father's day gift, and so far so good.I got up and running in about 30 minutes including my USB External drive.  Overall a very good router, and very easy to setup.  The web based config interface is very nice and intuitive to use.  This was a big deal for me coming form a linksys router, and 'knowing' linksys were the easiest to setup.  The app is very straight forward, very simple to use and understand.  I particularly liked the layout of it because is broken into 3 panes (windows) the main selection/menu on the left, the content in the middle, and definition and help content on the right....describing what the immediate features you are setting up are and they do.  I know my way around these things, but it was nice to have there as a backup in case I had any doubts on what I was doing.With that said, I did encounter a few issues getting the router connect (recognize) the modem.  after a few attempts, and tricks I was able to get to connect and get into the web based configuration app.  It prompt me to update firmware, and I did. but I found that the latest firm ware lacked or lost functionality that i had right out of the box.  When I tried to revert back to the original FW, it bricked!I took it back to the store I purchased it, and they replaced it.  With the replacement unit, the router connected to the modem instantly, I had the network setup with 5 minutes, and the USB drive in another 5 minutes.  I spent about another 20 min setting up the rest of devices to the new router, and everything works perfectly...just as expected.  What I did not expect was how easy it was to setup.Summary:PROS:- Very easy to setup!- 4 Networks in one device a private 2.4 Ghz and 5Ghz network, and two guest networks for each band.  This ia plus for me since I let one of my neighbors use my WiFi for free....now she, and any visitor, can have a network, and I can separate my devices from their view.- USB device connectivity is not as slow as many have complained.  I transferred files via FTP from work in seconds, very fast and responsive.-Good range, I have a two story town home, and I have great signal all overCONS:- Device is a bit bulky- Shinny materials get dirty very easy (I'm nit picking here...)Overall I would highly recommend to others....in fact I already have!  I don't think you would be disapointed with it.

Reburb unit came packed well, like new and with cd.  About 5 minutes to install and be surfing.  5G is great, the rangeis good in my two bedroom unit.  When running netstumbler I find up to 28 access points on 2.4, which created too muchtraffic for good speed on wireless, the 5G band is wide open and broadband speed tests consistently run at full wiredspeeds under 5G wireless.  I recommend this refurb unit for any apartment type setting.

I'm a Netgear fan, and this product reaffirmed that.  It was very easy to set up and it works great.  I wanted to wirelessly connect to a Roku box  which is separated from the router by a double floor and a couple of walls.  It did so with excellent signal strength.

I am not an expert in routers, but I knew that our old $40 router just wasn't working right.  I went to [...] and this was listed as the best.  The setup was quick and easy and I have noticeably faster internet browsing than ever before.  Now that we are consistently using 2-3 computers in our 6-member family it was important to have a router that would consistently work well.  This meets the bill.  I did not expect to spend this much, but it is much more reliable than our old $40 router.

I had a DLink DIR655 that was probably straining with all of the devices I had on it - 2 iphones, an ipad, twolaptops, a desktop and occasionally one more laptop.  My main laptop was taking hours to download a 600 mb file that I receive every week.  Tried a different mini card, no difference.I bought the Netgear 3700 and what a change.  My laptop and ipad are on the 5g channel, everything else is on the 2.4g channel.My laptop downloads are very quick now -8-10x at the least faster on the 600 gb file.  Consistently connecting at 270-300 wirelessly,my wife's laptop is at a steady 150.  I'm on Comcast cable and the router is the only change I made in the set up.  This one is a keeper.Hasn't dropped a connection yet.

Overall this Router is nice, i replace my broken Linksys with this Netgear,This Router was listed as NEW but i receive it with scratches and a installation CD for the Netgear 3400.The product is nice but i am disappointed paying for a New product and receiving a used router..

our way old router couldn't keep up with modern speeds. this one ROCKS big time!!!! ya gotta punch in all kinda stuff, but way worth it. we have a paper file folder with all the ports and ISP data crapola, so no sweat. we tried a Cisco plug 'n play thing that had good signal strength, but wouldn't connect to the net, GONG!! big waste of time.......

column9: Super fast and easy to use
column10: Originally I ordered a WNDR4000 but that was a total pain.  I wasted hours searching knowledge bases, calling my ISP and calling Netgear with no result.  I returned it and bought the WNDR3700 instead.The WNDR3700 was able to automatically detect many of my ISP's settings.  I had it up and running in just a couple minutes.Did I mention this thing is fast?  I love it!!!
